story:
There’s nothing a Fringe audience loves more than remixed Shakespeare. And there’s nothing DC loves more than politics.  Enter Better A Witty Fool.  Witty Fool goes right for the jugular as Shakespeare’s John Falstaff comically manages Titania’s bid for her party’s nomination against the controversial Bianca.  It’s cynicism made absurd.  The interests of the public are a nuisance.  Money is the ultimate good.  Everyone is miserable.  Sound familiar?

Witty Fool is the sequel to last year’s To Err is Falstaff!! which premiered at the Capital Fringe Festival to rave reviews and sold-out performances. 

Our cast and crew are award-winning talent from theatre and television.  It costs to mount this caliber of a show.  That is why I am reaching out.  Falstaff has more adventures in him.  Help us tell them.  And remember, all the world’s a stage!!

Witty Fool is produced by Falstaff Productions and promoted by Bucharest Inside the Beltway.

Better A Witty Fool’s funding goal is $6,000.  The largest expense is paying the actors.  This reflects the producer’s commitment to pay the actors a fair wage for the tremendous amount of work they put into the show.

In addition to paying the cast, the production budget includes insurance, Fringe fees, equipment rental, special effects, 3D videography, and marketing.

Better A Witty Fool will be performed at the Eastman Studio Theatre – Gallaudet University.  The address is 800 Florida Avenue NE Washington, DC  20002.

Performance dates and times are:

Saturday, July 9 at 4:00 pm
Tuesday, July 12 at 8:45 pm
Friday, July 15 at 8:30 pm
Thursday, July 21 at 6:00 pm
Friday, July 22 at 6:30 pm
Sunday, July 24 at 12:30 pm

story:
Short Summary

Hi. We are Intrepid Comics. Marcelo and I are in the process of making the graphic novel Terracide. Terracide is about an all out attack on humans by an alien race that wants to harvest not only the resources of the planet, but us as well. Their main weapon of choice is a material that mutates humans when ignited by heat or electricity. A small band of scientists accidentally mutate themselves investigating what the material is as it gets closer to Earth. In this book, no one is safe from death, not even the strongest hero.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  • Equipment and supplies for the production of the graphic novel.
  • Funding for advertising.
  • What you get: everyone that contributes $10 to $99 get a copy of the digital graphic novel
  • Everyone that contributes $100 or more gets a signed print of the cover.


    Risks & Challenges

    • One challenge is having the working supplies needed to make the novel. At the moment we are in needs of a few things that we can't afford.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Even if you can't contribute, you can help by spreading the word about the graphic novel. You can also visit our YouTube page.

story:
FULLY FUNDED!

Cover Art by Graham Nolan (Batman) and Brett R. Smith (Jawbreakers: Lost Souls):  

 

 

The Ember War Graphic Novel

The Story:

The Earth is doomed. Humanity has a chance. 

In the near future, an alien probe arrives on Earth with a pivotal mission—determine if humanity has what it takes to survive the impending invasion by a merciless armada.

The probe discovers Marc Ibarra, a young inventor, who holds the key to a daring gambit that could save a fraction of Earth's population. Humanity's only chance lies with Ibarra's ability to keep a terrible secret and engineer the planet down the narrow path to survival.

Earth will need a fleet. One with a hidden purpose. One strong enough to fight a battle against annihilation.

The Ember War is the comic book adaptation of Richard Fox's bestselling military sci-fi series. If you like A Hymn Before Battle by John Ringo and The Last Starship by Vaughn Heppner, then you'll love this explosive adventure with constant thrills and high stakes from cover to cover.

Creative Team:

Creator: Richard Fox is a military veteran and bestselling author of more than 30 novels. His books have been read by more than a million people worldwide and he has won The Dragon Award for best military science fiction for his book Iron Dragoons, which is set in The Ember War universe. 

Writer: Jon del Arroz is best known for his #1 bestselling Steampunk series, The Adventures of Baron Von Monocle, and for his successful IndieGoGo Flying Sparks comic.  He is an award winning author with proven experience in deep characterization and gripping science fiction stories. 

Artist: Jethro Morales is an industry professional for over a decade, having produced graphic novels for Dynamite Entertainment and Image Comics, and hailed for his work on Green Hornet and Dejah Thoris. 

Colorist: Emmanuel Torres has worked for Heavy Metal Magazine and Flying Sparks, a rising star in the coloring industry. 

Cover: Graham Nolan is an industry veteran of nearly 40 years, best known for his work on Batman as the co-creator of the character Bane.  He's joined by Brett R. Smith, a former Marvel Comics colorist and one of the creators of the mega-successful Jawbreakers: Lost Souls. 

Publisher: Arkhaven Comics is known for publishing some of the top books in the industry. With more than 30 books already under their belts, Arkhaven is making waves in the industry like no company before. Arkhaven will be publishing the retail editions of The Ember War and delivering an incredible product to readers.

What We Need & What You Get

The Ember War is a FULL graphic novel. Five issues clocking a total of 120-PAGES. It's one of the most ambitious storylines from our community to date, and by far the highest page count with the expert quality of a team that's already been successful with Flying Sparks. The Ember War will take comics to the next level, the first adaptation of an mainstream-popular independent novel.  The story is tested and proven on hundreds of thousands of readers with 615 ratings on Amazon for an average of 4.5/5 Stars! 

A project like The Ember War is extremely costly to produce to bring you top-tier artistic talent and writing talent in the industry as well as get a high-quality physical book into your hands. $15,000 covers the art costs for the book.  Rewards will include:

- Digital PDF of The Ember War

- Softcover Trade Paperback

- Signed Limited Edition Hardcover

- T-shirt of Graham Nolan's Cover Art

- Poster of Graham Nolan's Cover Art

- Military-style "Challenge Coin"

- The Potential To Be A "Red Shirt" in the epic climax battle scene - or to have your name written into one of Richard Fox's wildly successful novels! 

Stretch Goals:

$20,000: Funded! The Ember War graphic novel becomes a reality! [Locked]

$35,000: An exclusive print of Elias fighting the Xaros by The Ember War novels cover artist Justin Adams! This print will be included for all backers of the book at trade paperback or above levels. [Locked]

$50,000: The book will be expanded to include a 24-Page one shot of "Iron Hearts" a coda short story to The Ember War. [Locked]

$100,000: ????? [Locked]

$250,000: ????? [Locked]

 

The Impact

This is the first comic of its kind. While we've had several superhero comics reach incredible success, this marks the first time a bestselling independent book will be adapted into comic with crowdfunding. If this becomes successful, it will change the industry as we'll start a craze of epic military science fiction for readers. By backing The Ember War, you create comic book history and change the industry! 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't just back -- share this campaign on social media as well! Tell your friends who love comics and science fiction that this is the book they should back this fall!

story:
What’s An Informal?

Os Informais, which directly translated from Portuguese as “The Informals”, is the first independently produced Mozambican Superhero comic book based in the nation’s capital of Maputo by local creative studio ANIMA. 

Much like great science fiction of the past, The Informals takes place in the not so distant future. A future devised of technological advancements, crime-free streets, and the segregation and oppression of working-class citizens: a perfect dystopia. Unbeknownst to the current political establishment, a group of young and resourceful vigilantes band together to ensure the rights the working man, the street vendor and beggar alike will no longer be violated; this is the mission of The Informals.

There are currently three episodes that have been written, drawn, and completely inked. Each building upon the foundation previous installment. Each with its unique sense of social and political urgency.  The nature of this series also serves as a direct contrast to the world of Black Panther, an attempt to deviate from the mainstream narratives about the African experience, culture, and overall trajectory. After all, it's a story about Africa by actual Africans. 

 

 

 

Who Are You Guys?

ANIMA Studios is a creative studio based in Maputo, Mozambique (Google that last part).  We communicate through integrated mediums such as Graphic Design, Animation (obviously) and Filmmaking.  With a resourceful group of people, we are effectively able to come up with creative solutions that respond to the needs of each given project.

 

THE TEAM

Hélio​ Pene (Illustrator/Penciller): Helio wanted to say hi, so we let him because probably the best-Hélio person to describe himself: “My name is Hélio Januário. My best friends call me "Link". That's how I like referred to as well as sign my artwork. I'm a fan of pop culture, illustration (which is a necessity), and venturing into the "fantastic universe" from which I do not wish to return. Telling stories in an illustrated format has become my way of life and it is even this signature way of being that binds me to “The Informals”. As an illustrator, it is a place more than a habitat where I find ways to express myself. Nough said.”

João ​Roxo  (Creative Director): ): Designer and visual strategist, João is co-founder and creative catalyst at ANIMA. Growing up surrounded by post-independence publications and propaganda, from am early age João developed an interest and focus on editorial design and publishing as an artistic practice. As it is usually said, "necessity is the mother of invention”, and scarcity of resources leads to new challenges in finding alternative methods of production and dissemination of content. Zine production is one such method that leads to amazing, unexpected outcomes. According to him the idea for Os Informais came to mind from early on. Walking in the city and engaging with its surroundings, crossing paths with informal market workers prompted the perfect metaphor for the graphic novel, where the classic plot of oppressor versus the oppressed gave way to this universe, inspired by our often absurd reality and enticed by the opportunity of tracing new imaginaries.

Olivia Imaginário (Writer): A writer of mysterious nature and equally mysterious origins, Ms. Imaginario sought to travel the world in search of adventure and just causes.  One night whilst she was flying around the city of Maputo she miraculously met Joao and Helio. After their initial encounter, the pair were blown away by her otherworldly abilities; especially her talent for turning a phrase, the two knew she was the only being capable of helping to bring their colorful vision to life and thus she was recruited to the ANIMA family. Once the scripts for the first three episodes had been completed and the issues were in the process of being inked Olivia felt as though her she had served her purpose. She has now gone under the radar and our attempts to contact her here at ANIMA have been less than successful. She’s more than likely making her way around the globe again, helping those in need in any way she can. We believe when the time is right Olivia Imaginario will resurface, even if it’s just to say hello. 

 

How Can I Help? 

Unfortunately, because of the geography and the nature of our company we currently don't have the financial resources to release this project ourselves.  That's where you come in!

We intend to use the funds we receive to cover the cost of:

  • Publishing (Primarily) 
  • Printing  
  • Distribution          
  • Shipping (Domestically and Internationally) 

 

ANIMA wants to maintain the highest standard of transparency, so, we've provided a handy information graphic that exhibits our exact calculations and where your funds will be implemented and directed. 

 

The perks included in this campaign are designed to reward generous donators with the same sense of excitement that we here at ANIMA had when developing our story. We also want to provide with a gaze into the world of The Informals the way that only local independent artists can. Believe me, we're a lot closer than Tatooine!

 

 

DISTRIBUTION

Our goal is to make this project accessible to as many people as possible in the future , so, for now, we've sorted to selling the publication at higher costs with the hopes that later on we would be able to sell the series at much more affordable rates across all available comic book consumption platforms, especially online.  

Ideally, if this campaign is successful, we'd like to inspire both domestic and international readers to think critically about their environments and possibly arouse other creatives who might not have the financial means to release their own material.  DIY to the 1000th power!

On a more personal note, we would like to ensure that everyone who contributes to this phase of post-production feels included in the progression of this universe. In other words: our achievements should feel like your achievements. 

 

The Impact  

The Informals serves the purpose of taking control of your narrative on your terms. It aims to represent people at large in a universe and narrative with which people (particularly from a local standpoint) can identify with. It acts as a vehicle to broadcast societal and political issues that often go unrecognized or are labeled as taboo. Since the inception of the Comic book as a medium, it has served the purpose of being the platform that isn’t afraid to ask the tough questions and opens up the discussions about change.  In an era where it seems as though the truth can easily be distorted or lost in a vacuum, The Informals is no exception to that tradition.  

 

Risks & Challenges

Where do we begin? First and foremost, as we mentioned earlier publishing in Mozambique is a pricey affair.  So if we don't get the funds we can't put out the goods. Unless there are any wealthy benefactors out there willing to circumvent the entire process. 

  • We've got seven years of experience in producing documentaries, commercials for large brands, and organizing events for local businesses and we always labor to make sure every product is delivered in the highest quality. Even in the face of limited resources, we make the best out of what is available to us and this project is should be no exception. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that are some of you who desperately want to help but can't afford to contribute directly to our campaign. But fear not! There are ways you can help us reach our goal without cashing checks. 

Spread the word, my dudes! Tell all your friends and family who might be interested. Talk to your buddies at the comic shop about it. 

Don't forget that IndieGoGo has some neat tools to help share this with your loved ones. 

Remember, every little bit helps. It really does.

story:
Special BleedingCool.com Promotion! As stated on the page, new perks have now been added and they are as follows: the first is lowering the price of a signed copy of the comic from $30 to $20 until Wednesday whilst the second is that if we reach our goal by Friday we will give every person who donates from now to Friday free digital copies of Alone issues one, two and three. The final perk is that if you donate fifty dollars or more by Friday you will get free digital and signed physical copies of issues one, two and three! $20 offer EXPIRED. You MUST pay $30 to recieve physical signed copy. 

Donating a SINGLE dollar nets you a free five page comic! Five Dollars gets you that AND a copy of Alone Issue 1! Donate today and help start the adventure!

Who we are

Hey there! Thanks for reading this page as we try to get funding for our four issue miniseries entitled Alone. Alone is written by the creative team of Tony Deans and Gabriel Rosswell who came together based upon a passionate desire to see a strong, realistic female character in a medium dominated by large-breasted, unrealistically proportioned and downright offensive portrayals of female characters. Indiegogo has begun to be dominated by major league publishers who don't want to have to pay for what they're selling despite having the money to do so. This isn't the case with us, instead we're two independent creators who have no agents, lawyers or publishing contract. Instead we want to cut out the middle man and bring our work straight to you, the reader and create a truly independent miniseries. 

So What The Hell Do You Want From Me?

When it comes to funding we believe that you deserve respect to know where your money will go and thus we provide the following break-down:

200 Dollars goes to the establishment of a website where we will independently distribute the comic via digital download

300 Dollars will go on the costs of a small publishing run of around 150 issues

300 Dollars will go onto marketing the comic to get it to reach a wider audience.

If we manage to break over our budget then all costs will go into marketing and potentially increasing the physical copies. Once we reach our target we will seek to have the website set up so that Alone will be released digitally in December, just in time for Christmas and in Janurary for a physical release.

Now we come to the part that you're most interested in, the perks! Well unlike those big companies we don't have thousands of dollars to give you action figures or toys. What we do have however are ways to communicate and interact with you the reader. That's why the initial perks will be as follows:

$1 - A thank you on the contributor’s page and a digital copy of Swine, our short five page comic story.

$5 -  A free digital copy of Alone and Swine and a thank you on the contributor’s page.

$10 - A free physical copy of the comic and a thank you on the contributors page and a free digital copy of our short story Swine.

$30 - All of the above of the above along with a signed copy of the physical copy of the comic!

$50 - All of the above along with having a signed copy of the original script!

$100 - All of the above along with having as having a character named after you in the comic and based on your likeness. (Limited)

$200 -  All of the above PLUS having Bruce the baby re-named after you AND getting a character re-named to something of your choice! (Limited)

The best thing about all these perks is that P&P is FREE on all of them no matter where you are (limited to Planet Earth of course unless you can arrange transport to the Moon to get the stuff to you). If more and more people become interested in donating then more perks will become available.

Well That's Great But What's The Story Actually About And What Makes It So Special?

Well we don't want to give too much away as the story is full of shocks, twists and turns and yes even moments that will make you cry but we can reveal a bit of what happens within Alone as a taster. Alone is a comic that takes place after an airborne virus has wiped out the majority of life on the planet. Jade, our protagonist believes that she is the only survivor but her world is soon turned upside down once she discovers a baby who also possesses immunity to the virus. Things take a turn for the worse as she and the baby are pursued by SIRU a former Government organisation led by Jehovah, a man believing himself to be God and who has nefarious plans to remake the world in his image, plans to which Jade and the baby are key… 

So what else makes it special? Well for one Jade is a strong woman with a realistic anatomy who kicks ass and doesn't take prisoners and will do whatever it takes to protect what she loves. How often in comics are Women the victims and displayed in a gratuitous manner? We hate that in comics and Alone is a specific reaction against that. We also want to make a great story full of fun and thrills that gets you involved within the story and doesn't let you go until the stories end.

We have also provided below six pages of the comic for you to sample as well.

Well I Would Donate But I Don't Have Any Cash!

Hey these are tough times economically so don't worry about that. You can help in other ways including spreading the word on Twitter, Facebook and all those social media sites. Providing links in blogs is fine and we're also available for interviews online or over the phone if you like. Any kind of support is good support and we're just glad you checked out the page!

Alone Sample Pages
story_txt:
Special BleedingCool.com Promotion! As stated on the page, new perks have now been added and they are as follows: the first is lowering the price of a signed copy of the comic from $30 to $20 until Wednesday whilst the second is that if we reach our goal by Friday we will give every person who donates from now to Friday free digital copies of Alone issues one, two and three. The final perk is that if you donate fifty dollars or more by Friday you will get free digital and signed physical copies of issues one, two and three! $20 offer EXPIRED. You MUST pay $30 to recieve physical signed copy. 
Donating a SINGLE dollar nets you a free five page comic! Five Dollars gets you that AND a copy of Alone Issue 1! Donate today and help start the adventure!
Who we are
Hey there! Thanks for reading this page as we try to get funding for our four issue miniseries entitled Alone. Alone is written by the creative team of Tony Deans and Gabriel Rosswell who came together based upon a passionate desire to see a strong, realistic female character in a medium dominated by large-breasted, unrealistically proportioned and downright offensive portrayals of female characters. Indiegogo has begun to be dominated by major league publishers who don't want to have to pay for what they're selling despite having the money to do so. This isn't the case with us, instead we're two independent creators who have no agents, lawyers or publishing contract. Instead we want to cut out the middle man and bring our work straight to you, the reader and create a truly independent miniseries. 
So What The Hell Do You Want From Me?



When it comes to funding we believe that you deserve respect to know where your money will go and thus we provide the following break-down:
200 Dollars goes to the establishment of a website where we will independently distribute the comic via digital download
300 Dollars will go on the costs of a small publishing run of around 150 issues
300 Dollars will go onto marketing the comic to get it to reach a wider audience.
If we manage to break over our budget then all costs will go into marketing and potentially increasing the physical copies. Once we reach our target we will seek to have the website set up so that Alone will be released digitally in December, just in time for Christmas and in Janurary for a physical release.
Now we come to the part that you're most interested in, the perks! Well unlike those big companies we don't have thousands of dollars to give you action figures or toys. What we do have however are ways to communicate and interact with you the reader. That's why the initial perks will be as follows:
$1 - A thank you on the contributor’s page and a digital copy of Swine, our short five page comic story.
$5 -  A free digital copy of Alone and Swine and a thank you on the contributor’s page.
$10 - A free physical copy of the comic and a thank you on the contributors page and a free digital copy of our short story Swine.
$30 - All of the above of the above along with a signed copy of the physical copy of the comic!
$50 - All of the above along with having a signed copy of the original script!
$100 - All of the above along with having as having a character named after you in the comic and based on your likeness. (Limited)
$200 -  All of the above PLUS having Bruce the baby re-named after you AND getting a character re-named to something of your choice! (Limited)
The best thing about all these perks is that P&P is FREE on all of them no matter where you are (limited to Planet Earth of course unless you can arrange transport to the Moon to get the stuff to you). If more and more people become interested in donating then more perks will become available.

Providing links in blogs is fine and we're also available for interviews online or over the phone if you like. Any kind of support is good support and we're just glad you checked out the page!

story:
About this project

"Order of Procession" is the first child of Toronto-based illustrator Nathan Robert Enkel and writer Spencer Butt, otherwise known as the collaborative duo, "Digital Warlock Criminalz". It is the by-product of blue/black magic, fast food, digital hand-grenades and insomnia.  The final result will be an illustrated short story book about a young man who makes a bad decision.

The tale begins with the main, unnamed character, thrust into an unexpected, hostile situation when he suddenly realizes that he happens to have a knife on him. As a knee-jerk reactionary response, he pulls the knife out to defend himself and is forced to confront the harsh reality that he just made things a lot worse.

The book's contents will be black and white with a full-colour, paper back cover with a first run of 333 copies (half of the mark of the beast). Your funding will help us pay for both the production and distribution of the product.

Thanks so much for your time.

The Impact

This is just the start of something big. Our hope is that not only will the book be a success, but that, through that success, it'll enable us to produce more books in the future. Not only will will be able to put out books that we, personally are involved with but also creative projects that our friends create.

What We Need & What You Get

Our rough estimate for cost or printing the book is $2500. Your support will ensure that it gets made. The actual number is slightly less than that but if we aim high it will also subsidize the not only shipping costs but currency conversion as well. We will also be providing benefactors will certain perks and gifts (such as t-shirts, screen prints, poetry chapbooks, etc) and those cost money to make too. If we don't make our $2500 goal, then we'll still put whatever we did make towards printing.


The finished product will be a roughly 32 page, 7.5" by 7.5" graphic novel.


Think of this as a pre-order with incentives! You're gonna want to buy the book when it's done anyways, so why not buy it now and get bonuses?!

Other Ways You Can Help

We recently started a blog to keep people informed of our progress and will be updating it on a regular basis so that people know that we're not slacking. Both the illustrator and the writer of the book also have flickr/myspace/youtube pages that will be used to promote the project.

story:
The Story

Jamie (they/them) toils away in obscurity at their day job until the time comes around every couple months to travel to another place where they’re treated like a minor celebrity. No, Jamie’s not a comics creator; they’re a superhero!

Every couple months, Jamie takes time off from their day job to travel to the distant alien world of Lemuria where their inventing prowess and daring-do have turned them into the world's premier superhero. They fight invaders; spend time with their best friend, the princess Jada (she/her); investigate strange phenomena… And then they have to go home a few days later because prolonged exposure to Lemuria’s atmosphere will kill them. Yeah. That part is a bit of a bummer.

Things take a turn when Jamie is presented with an opportunity to do more superhero work back on Earth, putting their time on Lemuria and with Jada into question. And Jada's world begins to change as well as she gains more and more responsibility as an incoming leader, threatening the time she cherished spending together with Jamie. These two friends find themselves at a crossroads as Jamie must make a decision: stay comfortable with their current arrangement or risk it all for a shot at their dream.

With funding, contributors will be able to ensure that readers can follow Jamie all the way through on this strange journey about balancing work, life, and long distance relationships.

Meet the Team!

Writer - Mark O. Stack has been writing comics for a few years now, but he got his start by writing comics criticism for websites like Comics Bulletin. He currently works in education where he spends his days teaching college students to find their way around a good research essay. Comics Alliance described his all-ages comic Sail as containing "a skill and economy that knows exactly when to pause and take in a quiet or powerful moment."

Artist - Anne Marcano is a self-taught artist who first entered the world of being a freelancer four years ago. Comics is a new field for her, but she's ready to take on the challenge. PLUS ULTRA!!!

Letterer - Danny Djeljosevic is a comic book writer and occasional letterer based in San Diego, CA, who wrote the comics Final Derby, The Ghost Engine, Kids Rule!!, and Big Fucking Hammer.  

From left to right: Jamie's sister, Alex; Jamie; and Jada.

What We Need & What You Get

This is a no-frills campaign aiming to raise just enough money to fund the completion of the comic. As such, there will be no physical rewards associated with this campaign. Rewards will be strictly digital.

Backers will be able to receive rewards such as advance PDFs of each chapter upon completion, PDFs of Mark's previous comics work, access to a behind the scenes developmental blog, editing on the comics project of their choice, and even the chance to be drawn into the comic!

Pledge $10 and receive a copy of Mark's comic with Jean Pe, Sail.

Our funding goal breaks down as follows:

  • $4,500 for the creation of 60 pages of fully colored comics art
  • $900 for professional quality lettering
  • and $600 for IndieGoGo fees

Mark will be generating no income from this project as its writer and manager, and he has already invested as much of his own money as possible into the creation of these preview pages, the logo, and a domain for the comic. For him, this is all about making a project he really believes in into a reality.

If this campaign does not reach its goal, that does not mean the end for this project! The funds raised will be divided up in order to create as many complete pages as possible while the team pursues other means of funding the project. Every dollar you give will be an absolute benefit to this team.

The Impact

Financing this campaign will allow the creative team to be paid a fair wage for their work on a project that they want to be working on. Mark believes in paying collaborators for their work, but he would never be able to finance a project of this scale without years of penny pinching. Every dollar donated pushes this team closer to a new level of creative work.

Risks & Challenges

This is the team's first crowdfunding campaign, but the risks are relatively minimal. Due to the lack of physical rewards, production costs and shipping are a non-factor. The team's page rates are what they are. In the event of sickness or some other unforeseen circumstances, production of the comic may be delayed for a period of time, but our backers will be the very first to hear about it. Mark has plenty of experience with guiding comics projects from beginning to end, and the rest of the team has established an absolutely professional level of interpersonal communication regarding work.

Please share and recommend our campaign to others!

The only way a campaign like this can succeed is if people talk about it! If you share it on social media, write about it on your blog, or send a link directly to your friends then you will be directly helping this campaign raise awareness and funding.

story:
Hello!  We're Nicole & Adam - two Los Angeles based creatives that need your support! It's our dream to print and distribute our comic book, BRILLIANT WEIRDOS, to independent comic book stores nationwide.  We believe in makingdreams come true and not waiting around for a green light from anyone else but ourselves to make things happen.  Our philosophy is that you've got to make it to make it!  And thankfully, we live in a day and age when making big things happen independently is easier than ever before.  That's why we've decided to bring this vision here to the IndieGoGo community.  You guys get it!

About Us:

We love creating cool things.  From films to puppet and comedy shorts to live shows!

Nicole's background is in illustration, cartooning, writing and puppet making.  Herillustration work has been featured in national and international publications including The Los Angeles Times, BUST Magazine, and Buzzfeed.  She's an author for HelloGiggles.com, where she write a weekly illustrated interview feature called "Mail Order Interviews" and she's the editor-in-chief and founder of FUNBERGER.com, a lifestyle and entertainment webzine.

Adam's background is in comedy, writing and directing.  He's the creator, writer and star of the popular Los Angeles-based live children's stage show The Breakfast Show, which has had many celebrity guests including Bob Odenkirk, Maria Bamford and TJ Miller.  This past summer he wrote, directed and acted in a narrative short film with puppets (Yay!  Puppets!) called DUCKIE and his comedy work has been featured in LA Weekly and Heeb Magazine. 

Together, we created an independent pilot for a live-action kids show for adults called Yeti! Yeti! that will be released to the world this spring! 

Adam & Nicole In Yeti! Yeti! :

We have the best time creating original characters, worlds and stories.  That's why we're so passionate about BRILLIANT WEIRDOS!

About The Project:

There is something special and unique about comic books.  The fact that you can hold a comic book in your hands and page through an adventure makes readers - young and old - giddy with excitement.  Let's face it - comic books are awesome!  They can be meditative to create and read and are often times something that the reader will go back to over and over again much like a favorite outfit or restaurant.  We want to create this comic book because we love comic books ourselves!  Making a comic book seems like the right next step for our creative partnership and we hope that with your help we can make this next step a bountiful leap into magical realms beyond our imaginations!

David Lunch and Andy Warthog up to some no good scheming.

This comic book is also a good starting off point for bigger things.  Coming from a world of creating films and shorts together, we see a bright future for BRILLIANT WEIRDOS.  Our hope is that this project will gain legs much like the early Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles comics did and grow into an empire far beyond our wildest dreams.  You can help make this happen!  If all goes well, we plan on making BRILLIANT WEIRDOS into a live-action puppet short film.  

David Lunch's third eye sees success in our future.

BRILLIANT WEIRDOS is about three misfit teenage artists that work at a local small town diner called Double Chins.  The main characters - David Lunch (a sandwich-headed eccentric based off of dreamy filmmaker, David Lynch), Tim Burpin (a soda-headed visionary based off of iconic filmmaker, Time Burton) and Andy Warthog (a randy warthog based off of the infamous pop artist, Andy Warhol) can't seem to fit into their small town's teenage social hierarchy no matter how hard they try.  This story is for anyone that's ever felt like an outcast or different at some point in their life.  Guest characters include Pez Anderson (a Pez dispenser-corduroy suit wearing-story teller based off of director, Wes Anderson)!

Why We Need Your Support:

We need your support to make BRILLIANT WEIRDOS come to life!  Our hope is to print BRILLIANT WEIRDOS in full color, which is AWESOME, but also pricey.  We need all the support we can get to bring this comic book to life and share it with planet Earth!

Still wondering if you should support BRILLIANT WEIRDOS?

Tim Burpin on break at Double Chins Diner.

Don't worry, there's something in it for you too!

What You'll Get:

BRILLIANT WEIRDOS will feature 25 pages of full-color illustrated comic goodness! It's a weirdo ten course feast for your eyeballs!  If you're weird - If you're out there - If you're different - If you're a fan of David Lynch, Tim Burton or Andy Warhol - Then this comic book is for you!

  • For $2 you'll receive a thank you postcard in the mail for helping make Brilliant Weirdos a reality!

  • For $7 and above you'll receive a PDF version of Brilliant Weirdos delivered via email!

  • For $15 you'll receive a physical copy of Brilliant Weirdos delivered to your door via USPS Priority Mail!  Outside the US, add $10 for shipping.

  • For $30 you'll receive a signed 11"x17" Brilliant Weirdos
  • For $50 you'll receive a signed physical copy of Brilliant Weirdos and two 8.5"x11" mini posters designed by Nicole delivered to your door via USPS Priority Mail!  Outside the US, add $10 for shipping.
MINI POSTER DESIGNS:

   

  • For $100 or more you'll receive a signed physical copy of Brilliant Weirdos and a Brilliant Weirdos t-shirt delivered to your door via USPS Priority Mail!  Outside the US, add $10 for shipping.
  • If you'd like to order more than one copy of Brilliant Weirdos, simply add $15 per copy to your pledge total. Maximum ten copies per backer. Please be sure to select the correct rewards tier!

  • For wholesale inquiries, please contact us at hiadamandnicole@gmail.com!

Thank you for taking the time to learn all about this project, which is so dear to our minds and hearts.  Your support will help make a dream come true!  We hope that this comic will reach people who feel left out or out of place and make them feel like they're not alone!

weirdo ten course feast for your eyeballs!  If you're weird - If you're 
out there - If you're different - If you're a fan of David Lynch, Tim Burton or Andy Warhol - 
Then this comic book is for you!

For $2 you'll receive a thank you postcard in the mail for helping make Brilliant Weirdos a reality!

For $7 and above you'll receive a PDF version of Brilliant Weirdos delivered via email!
For $15 you'll receive a physical copy of Brilliant Weirdos delivered to your door via USPS Priority Mail!  Outside the US, add $10 for shipping.
For $30 you'll receive a signed 11"x17" Brilliant Weirdos 
For $50 you'll receive a signed physical copy of Brilliant Weirdos
 and two 8.5"x11" mini posters designed by Nicole delivered to your door
 via USPS Priority Mail!  Outside the US, add $10 for shipping.
MINI POSTER DESIGNS:    
For $100 or more you'll receive a signed physical copy of Brilliant Weirdos and a Brilliant Weirdos t-shirt delivered to your door via USPS Priority Mail!  Outside the US, add $10 for shipping.
If you'd like to order more than one copy of Brilliant Weirdos, simply add $15 per copy to your pledge total. Maximum ten copies per backer. Please be sure to select the correct rewards tier!

For wholesale inquiries, please contact us at hiadamandnicole@gmail.com!
Thank you for taking the time to 
learn all about this project, which is so dear to our minds and hearts. 
 Your support will help make a dream come true!  We hope that this comic
 will reach people who feel left out or out of place and make them feel 
like they're not alone!

story:
About Marcy

Hi there!
I am a 42 year old Mom and teacher.  I have a whole lot to say about life, love, and the world we live in.  I have a unique view about things and I will tell it like it is.  I want to call my Blog Marcy's Daily Flavor because I have a good sized following on a trading website called Listia and they love to have me post.  They always say they bid on my auctions just to read my posts and to see what color of Kool-Aid I feel like today.  
I am the mother of 2 children, and I have strong views on parenting and other topics.  Life has not been easy on me.  However, I am still very giving, loving, pure, and have a strong viewpoint on love, and how we should all have an authentic heart  We should be paying it forward and not be screwing each other.  Even though I have very little, I go out of my way to help others and do what I can to make this world a better place. 
I tell it like it is.  I want to build a site in which I can share my daily life in a frank, poignant, and humorous way.  I will build a following quickly, honestly, and earnestly.  I have a great work ethic and will dedicate time to this site.
I also want to have a place where people can share their experiences and build friendships on a board.  I want people to learn to pay it forward and work together in this harsh world.  
Unfortunately, this has become a cruel, unforsaken world, We need to get back to a world full of neighbors and helping each other with encouragement and having "good stuff" happening to us.

What I need:
For this to work:
I need to get a good solid website built with IT help and support.  I need to be able to have helpers and I want this to be something that really takes off and makes a "MOVEMENT IN OUR WORLD" ,  FOR that, I need to be able to get started without worry.  I am asking for $15,000 to help start the Marcy's Movement which I think is a hilarious name.  I want to do everything tongue in cheek.  WIth that, as a donator, you will be listed as part of Marcy's Movement on the thank you page!  Also, I am looking at eventually become as part of a site where cetain parts would be a subscription service.  I don't have all of the ins and outs figured out yet. But you would have the 1st year paid for.  This is a dream of mine.  I know I was put on this Earth to make a difference.  Please help!  Become part of Marcy's Movement.

The Risk and Challenges:
The Risk is that I won't get funded and that is just a pipe dream.
I was taught by my parents, that anything can be done, we just have to figure it out....I believe it can be done with funding.  On one income, my husband and I probably cannot do this!

The Impact!
I believe I can get the word out and with the tough way the world is today.  I believe even if for a while...I can make a small change. I also want to model to my children the difference you can make in the world.  And really to many people $15,000 is a drop in the bucket and this would change my life!!!!! So that I can help others.  If I get funded, I plan to branch out, get more media exposure and roll this into a wild ride to help others get help.....on a whole array of topics..not just one.  Just awareness in general.  I am not looking for my 15 minutes...I want to make a lifetime of impact.

Other ways you can help!
Donate...and live your life in a pure and helpful and kind manner!!!!!!!

PLEASE PLEASE!!!!! If everyone who reads this simply donates $1 we can make it!  That is a candy bar or a pop!  But you will be making a huge difference in my life and many lives.  PLEASE THINK ABOUT IT!!!!!!!!! Can you spare that dollar for this cause?  I would be ever so grateful!!!!!
Also, please share, share, share, Pass this link around as much as you can! Get the word out! If you know a newsperson, a media person, someone, please let's get the word out!!!!!!!
Thank you so much!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

story:
The "Indiana Jones in Ancient Rome" adventure continues! Get ready for a high-adventure trek through 3rd century North Africa, as a team of treasure hunters and outcasts uncover the secrets of Alexander the Great on the frontier of the Roman Empire!

KYRIE tells the story of ​a curious band of thieves, cutthroats, bookworms and traitors as they attempt to outsmart the North African authorities, while navigating their own dark and competing desires as outlaws of a dying Roman Empire.

Book Two of this unique graphic novel series is ready to be put into your hands! 

And once again  - all 152 pages are already finished and print-ready!




 

Book 2: Exiles in Wasteland






 

⚔️ BOOK 1: THE CURSE OF THE MACEDONIAN SCROLL ⚔️
116 story pages
(already published)
 

Chapter 1: Prologue
The book opens with an unlikely troupe of thieves, a duo called the Thunder Brothers and led by the treasure hunter Myra, as they race to escape Alexandrian Egypt with the Red Lady of Babylon - an infernal ruby coveted by both Roman and Persian Empires, containing an encrypted message from civilization's dawn.

Chapter 2: The Red Lady of Babylon
The robbers escape by stealing Senator Valerian's sailing ship, only to discover a prisoner aboard named Marcus, who knows how to reveal the Red Lady's message, and a scroll from Macedon which explains it. But is this mysterious prisoner more dangerous than the Roman naval authorities who are already hunting them down? 

 

⚔️ BOOK 2: EXILES IN WASTELAND ⚔️
116 story pages
(To be published with this campaign!)
 

Chapter 3: The Garamantian Desert
Exiles in Wasteland opens with the prisoner (Marcus), the treasure hunter (Myra), and a surviving Roman soldier (Tersius) washing up on the Libyan shoreline. Myra and Marcus agree to a temporary alliance, in order to hunt for the Red Lady of Babylon's origins - a forgotten oasis somewhere in the south Egyptian wastes. Tersius is dragged along as their unwilling prisoner.

Back in Alexandria, Gallienus explains to his father what he saw at Siwa after excavating the oasis, as well as what (or who?) possessed him.

Chapter 4: Jackal's Rest
Marcus reads the Macedonian scroll, and explains that the Red Lady was originally intended for Alexander the Great, on his quest to defeat the ultimate enemy - his own mortality.

Valerian hurries out from Alexandria with his son Gallienus and a military attachment. Marcus and Myra recount a bit of their childhood, and discover they both grew up in the same town, although at different times. The traveling trio enter a dangerous border town, in search of a wandering Berber tribe that can take them to Siwa.
 

This is an independently published graphic novel - meaning this book can only be printed with your pre-orders!

Securing a minimum number of pre-orders allows us to hire the printer, so that we can then distribute them to you.
 

BOOK PRINTING SPECS:

⚔️ 12 pt matte UV cover

⚔️ 80 lb matte coated interior pages

⚔️ 6.25"x8.574" at 128 pages


The more pre-orders we receive, the lower the cost of each book becomes. This in turn allows us to invest those savings back into the length of the book itself.
 

COSTS:
~ Printing 500 books - $4,200
~ Shipping 200 books - $900
~ Printing 250 posters (two types) - $250
~ Shipping Red Variant poster - free (included with book shipping)
~ Shipping Matt Cossin poster (50) - $250
~ Crowdfunding fees, artist commission fees, other misc. fees - $900

Total funds needed for printing and shipping: $6,500


 

CAMPAIGN STRETCH GOALS
(added for free to each printed book order):

Already achieved:
✔️ Map of KYRIE's Ancient North Africa by illustrated map expert Stephen Hesselman, to be printed across the inside cover of the book:


✔️ Spot gloss cover
~ like we achieved for Book 1!

✔️ Deluxe vinyl stickers:
~ illustrated by Will Tommo and Otto Arantes!

✔️Bookmark:
~ illustrated by Karat @karatnshtick:






KYRIE is a richly crafted longform comic, following in the best traditions of the classic high adventure storytelling. It's also a love letter to Ancient North Africa.

And graphic novels like this one just aren't (yet) available your local comic book shop or bookstore!

Purchasing this book helps get stories like this one onto the bookshelves of readers of all ages, all over the world. We just can't do it without your backing!

A crowdfunding campaign is the only available way to print Book 2 of KYRIE. Though every page of this book is finished, we cannot produce a printed version without your invaluable support.

We've successfully funded and delivered a Kickstarter campaign for KYRIE's prologue back in 2014, as well Book 1 on Indiegogo in 2019. We are confident we can do so again.

Thanks to the printer, we can get this book efficiently and reasonably printed and delivered to myself or the distributor in just a few months. 

No one is charged if this Indiegogo campaign doesn't fund. If for some reason the campaign funds but I cannot deliver the book, I will fully refund the campaign.

We're sure you'll love this book! And we are making every effort to ensure your book will get to you safely and on time. We want you to be more than satisfied with your purchase.

Have questions or concerns?My contact info is in the Q&A section. Just ask!

Some people just can't contribute. We understand ! But that doesn't mean you can't help:

⚔️ Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Tell your friends!
⚔️ Social media works! Share this campaign online.
⚔️Use the Indiegogo share tools!

So that's the pitch! Let us know if you'd like any more info. See you after the campaign!

story:
FUNDED! We've reached our funding goal! The book is definitely happening now! You have until the end of the campaign to secure a copy (by claiming a perk) or regret it for ever ;)

[UPDATE: NEW PERK! Elysium Online iPhone skins and cases! See the "What do we need & What do you get" section below, the Perks sidebar or the Updates section]

[UPDATE: Backers can now upgrade their claim to the Original Page Pack for NO extra money!]

[UPDATE: You can now read the first 12 pages of Elysium Online at the Gallery section!]

 

Hello and welcome to our campaign!

 ELYSIUM ONLINE is a full color, 96 page graphic novel by Ilias Kyriazis.

It’s a sci-fi, horror drama that is as much about the way society deals with mortality as it is about disaster movie type mass destruction.

 It's an ambitious project we've been working on for quite some time. Currently the book is almost halfway finished. We thought that now was the time to present it to the online community, hoping we can get you as excited for the world or ELYSIUM ONLINE as we are!

 

"Just when I thought it was impossible to come up with a fresh, original concept in horror, Ilias Kyriazis has done it. And he drew it beautifully too. Someone needs to tell him there's such a thing as being TOO talented!"

Christos Gage, writer (Avengers Academy, X-men Legacy)

"ELYSIUM is a stunning piece of work.  A fresh concept with wonderfully striking artwork."
Michael Allred, writer/artist (Madman, X-Statix, FF)

 

The story is about Elysium, a revolutionary social network. By logging in you’ll be able to interact with your deceased loved ones who now exist in a digital afterlife. It’s October 2021 and everyone is eagerly anticipating its official release.

What no one imagines is that the Elysium dead hate us. Just for being alive. And they’re biding their time until they get online. The moment they do, they’ll take over the internet and use anything with net access, from cars to aircraft carriers to wipe out the living.

Paul is an Elysium developer more at ease with the dead than the living. His estranged sister, Anne, is longing to see again her late husband online. Zarya is a goth, teenage beta tester that sees death as an adventure. Together, they’ll have to survive the nightmare that follows the Elysium Release Day.

 

 "A much scarier and more emotionally hard-hitting version of a Roland Emerich movie!"
Mike Carey, writer (X-Men Legacy, Lucifer)

"I've worked with some of the greats in the comic book business, so trust me when I say that Ilias is one of them! He writes, he draws, he colors - and he's a master at all of it. No throw some cash in the kitty, because we're all going to benefit from seeing this gorgeous and horrific graphic novel come to life! Or is that come to afterlife?"
Scott Lobdell, writer (Superman, Uncanny X-men)

About the creators

Ilias Kyriazis has been working in comics since 2001. He's had a successful career in Greece, winning a series of awards and creating much-loved books like MANIFESTO, BLOOD OPERA and BLAST Comics.

Lately he's been working mainly for U.S publishers. He's worked together with Scott Lobdell on two mini series, GALAXY QUEST: GLOBAL WARNING and GHOSTBUSTERS: DISPLACED AGGRESSION, and he wrote and drew the graphic novel FALLING FOR LIONHEART (published in Greece as MIA KARDIA GIA TON LEONTOKARDO) for IDW. He also created MELODY for DC/ Zuda (that was nominated for a LULU award for Best Female Character). Recently he drew the 2012 VAMPIRELLA annual for Dynamite. Currently he's doing inks and pencils for an as yet unannounced mini series for the same publisher.

 Joining Ilias is Dimitrios Kasdaglis. He will be drawing a series of “mock Elysium ads” that will be appearing throughout the book in crucial moments.

Dimitrios has been illustrating children's books professionally for more than a decade but always had a sweet tooth for comics.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 To make ELYSIUM ONLINE a reality we're going to need your help. We've set a goal of $7500. These funds (after taxes) will cover the printing costs, artists' fees and shipping. In return we have a variety of perks.

Here are the various items you can get as a “thank you” for being part of Elysium.

Check the sidebar on the right to see how they' re combined in “packs” and how to apply for them.

NEW PERK: iPhone skins and cases

In collaboration with www.BeSkinky.com  (going live next month), we’re offering iPhone skins and cases as a perk!  Available for iPhone 4, 4S and iPhone 5. 

Skins
- Designed to fit perfectly on the devices
- Photo quality printing with overlamination
- Innovative, Premium quality material used
- Easy to apply and remove with no residues left.
- Long lasting (years) even under outdoor use
- Invisible, scratch resistant, bubble free screen protector included
- Does not interfere with device functionality
- Adds style on the device
Cases
- Slim size providing total protection
- Designed to fit perfectly on the devices
- Photo quality, scratch resistant printing
- Innovative, Premium quality material used
- Long lasting (years) even under outdoor use
- Invisible, scratch resistant, bubble free screen protector included
- Does not interfere with device functionality
- Manufactured from heat resistant hard polymer used on the space industry

With each case or skin you get a premium quality - wet applicable - invisible screen protector  for free!
The pack will include the required jigs for perfect application, i.e. microfiber cloth, credit card type spray, and squeeze.

There are two ways to acquire one of these beauties.
-You can claim the iPhone Skin or Case Pack (see Perks sidebar)
-If you’ve already claimed a perk you can send an extra contribution for $15 (if you want the Skin) or $30 (if you want the case) and send a message or comment specifying your iPhone model.
There’s an extra $5 shipping charge for the skin or case. From that we exclude what you already paid for shipping. For example if you’ve claimed the $30 Sketch Pack, you live in USA and you want the skin, then from the $5 we exclude the $3 you already paid for shipping so you have to send $15 + ($5 -$3) = $17.
The skins and cases will be available a month after the campaign's end. We can send them to you  then for an extra shipping charge of $5 internationally or $3 just for Greece. Otherwise they will be sent along with the book and the other items you ordered.

Social Media Membership Pack (“Guest” / “Resident”) (SMMP/RSMM)

As small token of our appreciation ALL Funders get one of these. It includes ten different Facebook Covers, seven Twitter Backgrounds and a special .PSD and .TIFF template you can use to transform your Profile Picture in you favorite social media and proudly declare your support of ELYSIUM ONLINE!

 The “Guest” version includes only the Covers, the Backgrounds and the green, “Guest” version of the template.

The “Resident” version includes all of the above, plus the blue, “Resident” version of the template AND three ELYSIUM ONLINE wallpapers.

 You receive the Social Media Membership Packs within hours after you send your contribution regardless if the project reaches its funding goal or not.

ELYSIUM ONLINE Graphic novel

The main perk offered is a high quality edition of the comic. Printed in full color, 17x24 cm (6.7x9.4 inches) in size, the 96 pages book features the complete story as well as concept sketches, behind the scenes material and pinups.

You have the opportunity of having the book signed and having one of two types of sketches drawn inside. Option A is an inked head shot of one of the book characters and Option B is a more detailed inked sketch, a half figure / head and torso shot of any character you want (not necessarily from ELYSIUM ONLINE).

 

This perk will be shipped as soon as the book is finished and printed, in the (most probably early) summer of 2013.

ELYSIUM ONLINE eBook

You can have a digital version of the graphic novel. A downloadable PDF file with the complete comic but without the extra, behind the scenes material.

 You will receive a link to download this perk as soon as the book is finished, in the (most probably early) summer of 2013. All printed copies of the book will include the same link.

Previous Works Digital Pack (PWDP)

 A collection of some of Ilias's earlier, out of print comics, now offered in PDF format. Many of them are previously unpublished. Unless otherwise noted all the comics are in Greek.

The stories included are:

  • 24 Hour Comic
  • Action Movies Are To Blame (+English version)
  • Alanes (Αλάνες)
  • Angouleme (Λίγες Μέρες Στην Ανγκουλέμ)
  • Blockbuster
  • Comic Calendar
  • Crossover Cartoons (in English)
  • Dick Blossom (in English)
  • Ena Tsigaro Xronos (Ένα Τσιγάρο Χρόνος)
  • How I Learned To Love French (Πως Έμαθα Να Αγαπώ Τα Γαλλικά)
  • Girl On Girl
  • It's My Party
  • JFGI
  • Monologue (Μονόλογος)
  • Omorfi Mera ('Ομορφη Μέρα)
  • Private Lives (+English version)
  • Report From Earth (in English)
  • Sinou No Xon
  • The Dragon And The Ghost (in English)
  • The Iliad In Sixteen Pages (in English)
  • Τhe One And Only Billy Shears (+English version)
  • There's another (Υπάρχει άλλη)
  • Valentine Rufas (Οδηγός Του Βαλεντίνου Ρούφα Για Την Ερωτική Επιτυχία)

...that's roughly 250 pages of comics!

 Also included: a collection of his illustrations from that time.

 You will be given an link to download this perk as soon as the project reaches it's funding goal (even if that happens before the campaign times out).

 Art print

A beautiful reproduction of the book cover, the image at the top of this page! Printed in 300gr quality paper, 33x50 cm (13x19.6 inches) in size, guaranteed to look amazing on your wall.

It can be shipped two weeks after the campaign's completion or you can wait and have it delivered along with the book and the rest of the perks to save on shipping costs.

If you wish for the art print to be mailed immediately the extra cost is $5.

Art commission

You have the opportunity of commissioning a sketch from the book's creator or one of the artists attached to the project. It'll feature one to two characters and be on a separate A4 thick, Schoeller paper (29.5x21 cm / 11.6x8.3 inches) fit to be framed.

The guest artists are :

Yannis "Rubus" Roumboulias, fan-favorite, multiple award winning artist and star of the upcoming film "Indomitable".

Dimitrios Kasdaglis, famous Greek illustrator and artist on the special ELYSIUM ONLINE “mock ad” pages. [update: booked]

Tassos Papaioannou, comic artist, comic book publisher, graphic designer and designer of the amazing ELYSIUM ONLINE logo. [update: booked]

Michael Dialynas, multiple award winning comic artist, Ilias's collaborator on books like Ghostbusters and Blast comics. [update: booked]

Since these commissions are limited (one per guest artist, four by Ilias) please specify who do you want but also include a second choice.

These can be shipped within a month after the campaign's completion or you can wait and have them delivered along with the book and the rest of the perks to save on shipping costs.

Original pages

A piece of ELYSIUM ONLINE! Original pages from the book are offered as a perk for collectors. It is the first time Ilias is letting go pages of his work. You can chose which one you want (assuming it's not already taken). They're drawn on A3 thick, Schoeller paper.

No Dimitris's pages are available.

This perk will be shipped as soon as the book is finished and printed, in the (most probably early) summer of 2013. It is assumed you may want to get the book first to chose which page you want, in that case the page will be shipped later. If you already have your eye on one (from the promotional images) it can be shipped along with everything else.

Retailer Pack

You want ELYSIUM ONLINE available in you comic book store? Exclusively for retailers we have a special perk. You get 15 signed copies of the book, 2 signed copies of the art print and more. Also, your store will be depicted in the book, destroyed, part of the book's post apocalyptic landscape.

If your store is in Athens, Greece we'll deliver them to you, if it's elsewhere in Greece contact us. Otherwise see the sidebar for extra shipping costs.

Be immortalized in comics!

As a higher end perk, you, a loved one, your comic book store of your business can be drawn in the comic, taking part in the amazing events that take place after the Elysium Release Day. (Check the Immortality, Grand Sponsor and if eligible the Retailer packs).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If at the moment you're unable to to support ELYSIUM ONLINE financially, you can always help by telling as many other people as you can about this funding drive, and ELYSIUM ONLINE generally. Add it to your favorites on Indiegogo and leave a comment. Use the Indiegogo social sharing tools, share this on Facebook, on Tumblr, on Twitter... help spread the word.

Don't forget to use the hashtag #Elysium_Online on Twitter.

(And Follow the Elysium beta tester, @ZaryaBeta :wink: )


Thanks!



Credits

ELYSIUM ONLINE logo design by Tassos Papaioannou / One Man Show studio

The opening video was shot and cut by Sergio Kotsovoulos www.apicproduction.com with Tind 

and featured the track “Do I Know You” by Pan Pan.
story_txt:
FUNDED! We've reached our funding goal! The book is definitely happening now! You have until the end of the campaign to secure a copy (by claiming a perk) or regret it for ever ;)
[UPDATE: NEW PERK! Elysium Online iPhone skins and cases! See the "What do we need & What do you get" section below, the Perks sidebar or the Updates section]
[UPDATE: Backers can now upgrade their claim to the Original Page Pack for NO extra money!]
[UPDATE: You can now read the first 12 pages of Elysium Online at the Gallery section!]
 
Hello and welcome to our campaign!
 ELYSIUM ONLINE is a full color, 96 page graphic novel by Ilias Kyriazis. 

It’s a sci-fi, horror drama that is as much about the way society deals with mortality as it is about disaster movie type mass destruction.
 It's an ambitious project we've been working on for quite some time. Currently the book is almost halfway finished. We thought that now was the time to present it to the online community, hoping we can get you as excited for the world or ELYSIUM ONLINE as we are!

 
"Just when I thought it was impossible to come up with a fresh, original concept in horror, Ilias Kyriazis has done it. And he drew it beautifully too. Someone needs to tell him there's such a thing as being TOO talented!"
Christos Gage, writer (Avengers Academy, X-men Legacy)
"ELYSIUM is a stunning piece of work.  A fresh concept with wonderfully striking artwork."Michael Allred, writer/artist (Madman, X-Statix, FF)
 
The story is about Elysium, a revolutionary social network. By logging in you’ll be able to interact with your deceased loved ones who now exist in a digital afterlife. It’s October 2021 and everyone is eagerly anticipating its official release.What no one imagines is that the Elysium dead hate us. Just for being alive. And they’re biding their time until they get online. The moment they do, they’ll take over the internet and use anything with net access, from cars to aircraft carriers to wipe out the living.Paul is an Elysium developer more at ease with the dead than the living. His estranged sister, Anne, is longing to see again her late husband online. Zarya is a goth, teenage beta tester that sees death as an adventure. Together, they’ll have to survive the nightmare that follows the Elysium Release Day.
 
 "A much scarier and more emotionally hard-hitting version of a Roland Emerich movie!"Mike Carey, writer (X-Men Legacy, Lucifer)"I've worked with some of the greats in the comic book business, so trust me when I say that Ilias is one of them! He writes, he draws, he colors - and he's a master at all of it. No throw some cash in the kitty, because we're all going to benefit from seeing this gorgeous and horrific graphic novel come to life! Or is that come to afterlife?"Scott Lobdell, writer (Superman, Uncanny X-men) 




About the creators
Ilias Kyriazis has been working in comics since 2001. He's had a successful career in Greece, winning a series of awards and creating much-loved books like MANIFESTO, BLOOD OPERA and BLAST Comics.
Lately he's been working mainly for U.S publishers. He's worked together with Scott Lobdell on two mini series, GALAXY QUEST: GLOBAL WARNING and GHOSTBUSTERS: DISPLACED AGGRESSION, and he wrote and drew the graphic novel FALLING FOR LIONHEART (published in Greece as MIA KARDIA GIA TON LEONTOKARDO) for IDW. He also created MELODY for DC/ Zuda (that was nominated for a LULU award for Best Female Character). Recently he drew the 2012 VAMPIRELLA annual for Dynamite. Currently he's doing inks and pencils for an as yet unannounced mini series for the same publisher.
 Joining Ilias is Dimitrios Kasdaglis. He will be drawing a series of “mock Elysium ads” that will be appearing throughout the book in crucial moments.

Dimitrios has been illustrating children's books professionally for more than a decade but always had a sweet tooth for comics.
 
 
What We Need & What You Get
 To make ELYSIUM ONLINE a reality we're going to need your help. We've set a goal of $7500. These funds (after taxes) will cover the printing costs, artists' fees and shipping. In return we have a variety of perks.
Here are the various items you can get as a “thank you” for being part of Elysium.
Check the sidebar on the right to see how they' re combined in “packs” and how to apply for them.
NEW PERK: iPhone skins and cases

In collaboration with www.BeSkinky.com  (going live next month), we’re offering iPhone skins and cases as a perk!  Available for iPhone 4, 4S and iPhone 5. 
Skins - Designed to fit perfectly on the devices - Photo quality printing with overlamination - Innovative, Premium quality material used - Easy to apply and remove with no residues left. - Long lasting (years) even under outdoor use - Invisible, scratch resistant, bubble free screen protector included - Does not interfere with device functionality - Adds style on the device Cases - Slim size providing total protection - Designed to fit perfectly on the devices - Photo quality, scratch resistant printing - Innovative, Premium quality material used - Long lasting (years) even under outdoor use - Invisible, scratch resistant, bubble free screen protector included - Does not interfere with device functionality - Manufactured from heat resistant hard polymer used on the space industry With each case or skin you get a premium quality - wet applicable - invisible screen protector  for free! The pack will include the required jigs for perfect application, i.e. microfiber cloth, credit card type spray, and squeeze. There are two ways to acquire one of these beauties.  -You can claim the iPhone Skin or Case Pack (see Perks sidebar) -If you’ve already claimed a perk you can send an extra contribution for $15 (if you want the Skin) or $30 (if you want the case) and send a message or comment specifying your iPhone model. There’s an extra $5 shipping charge for the skin or case. From that we exclude what you already paid for shipping. For example if you’ve claimed the $30 Sketch Pack, you live in USA and you want the skin, then from the $5 we exclude the $3 you already paid for shipping so you have to send $15 + ($5 -$3) = $17. The skins and cases will be available a month after the campaign's end. We can send them to you  then for an extra shipping charge of $5 internationally or $3 just for Greece. Otherwise they will be sent along with the book and the other items you ordered.
Social Media Membership Pack (“Guest” / “Resident”) (SMMP/RSMM)

As small token of our appreciation ALL Funders get one of these. It includes ten different Facebook Covers, seven Twitter Backgrounds and a special .PSD and .TIFF template you can use to transform your Profile Picture in you favorite social media and proudly declare your support of ELYSIUM ONLINE!
 The “Guest” version includes only the Covers, the Backgrounds and the green, “Guest” version of the template. 
The “Resident” version includes all of the above, plus the blue, “Resident” version of the template AND three ELYSIUM ONLINE wallpapers.
 You receive the Social Media Membership Packs within hours after you send your contribution regardless if the project reaches its funding goal or not.
ELYSIUM ONLINE Graphic novel
The main perk offered is a high quality edition of the comic. Printed in full color, 17x24 cm (6.7x9.4 inches) in size, the 96 pages book features the complete story as well as concept sketches, behind the scenes material and pinups.
You have the opportunity of having the book signed and having one of two types of sketches drawn inside. Option A is an inked head shot of one of the book characters and Option B is a more detailed inked sketch, a half figure / head and torso shot of any character you want (not necessarily from ELYSIUM ONLINE).

 

This perk will be shipped as soon as the book is finished and printed, in the (most probably early) summer of 2013.
ELYSIUM ONLINE eBook
You can have a digital version of the graphic novel. A downloadable PDF file with the complete comic but without the extra, behind the scenes material.
 You will receive a link to download this perk as soon as the book is finished, in the (most probably early) summer of 2013. All printed copies of the book will include the same link.
Previous Works Digital Pack (PWDP)

 A collection of some of Ilias's earlier, out of print comics, now offered in PDF format. Many of them are previously unpublished. Unless otherwise noted all the comics are in Greek.
The stories included are: 

24 Hour Comic
Action Movies Are To Blame (+English version) 
Alanes (Αλάνες)
Angouleme (Λίγες Μέρες Στην Ανγκουλέμ)
Blockbuster
Comic Calendar 
Crossover Cartoons (in English)
Dick Blossom (in English)
Ena Tsigaro Xronos (Ένα Τσιγάρο Χρόνος) 
How I Learned To Love French (Πως Έμαθα Να Αγαπώ Τα Γαλλικά)
Girl On Girl
It's My Party 
JFGI
Monologue (Μονόλογος) 
Omorfi Mera ('Ομορφη Μέρα)
Private Lives (+English version)
Report From Earth (in English)
Sinou No Xon
The Dragon And The Ghost (in English)
The Iliad In Sixteen Pages (in English)
Τhe One And Only Billy Shears (+English version) 
There's another (Υπάρχει άλλη)
Valentine Rufas (Οδηγός Του Βαλεντίνου Ρούφα Για Την Ερωτική Επιτυχία)
...that's roughly 250 pages of comics!
 Also included: a collection of his illustrations from that time.
 You will be given an link to download this perk as soon as the project reaches it's funding goal (even if that happens before the campaign times out).
 Art print

A beautiful reproduction of the book cover, the image at the top of this page! Printed in 300gr quality paper, 33x50 cm (13x19.6 inches) in size, guaranteed to look amazing on your wall.
It can be shipped two weeks after the campaign's completion or you can wait and have it delivered along with the book and the rest of the perks to save on shipping costs.
If you wish for the art print to be mailed immediately the extra cost is $5.
Art commission

You have the opportunity of commissioning a sketch from the book's creator or one of the artists attached to the project. It'll feature one to two characters and be on a separate A4 thick, Schoeller paper (29.5x21 cm / 11.6x8.3 inches) fit to be framed.
The guest artists are :

Yannis "Rubus" Roumboulias, fan-favorite, multiple award winning artist and star of the upcoming film "Indomitable".

Dimitrios Kasdaglis, famous Greek illustrator and artist on the special ELYSIUM ONLINE “mock ad” pages. [update: booked]

Tassos Papaioannou, comic artist, comic book publisher, graphic designer and designer of the amazing ELYSIUM ONLINE logo. [update: booked]

Michael Dialynas, multiple award winning comic artist, Ilias's collaborator on books like Ghostbusters and Blast comics. [update: booked]
Since these commissions are limited (one per guest artist, four by Ilias) please specify who do you want but also include a second choice.
These can be shipped within a month after the campaign's completion or you can wait and have them delivered along with the book and the rest of the perks to save on shipping costs.
Original pages

A piece of ELYSIUM ONLINE! Original pages from the book are offered as a perk for collectors. It is the first time Ilias is letting go pages of his work. You can chose which one you want (assuming it's not already taken). They're drawn on A3 thick, Schoeller paper.
No Dimitris's pages are available.
This perk will be shipped as soon as the book is finished and printed, in the (most probably early) summer of 2013. It is assumed you may want to get the book first to chose which page you want, in that case the page will be shipped later. If you already have your eye on one (from the promotional images) it can be shipped along with everything else.
Retailer Pack
You want ELYSIUM ONLINE available in you comic book store? Exclusively for retailers we have a special perk. You get 15 signed copies of the book, 2 signed copies of the art print and more. Also, your store will be depicted in the book, destroyed, part of the book's post apocalyptic landscape.
If your store is in Athens, Greece we'll deliver them to you, if it's elsewhere in Greece contact us. Otherwise see the sidebar for extra shipping costs.
Be immortalized in comics!

As a higher end perk, you, a loved one, your comic book store of your business can be drawn in the comic, taking part in the amazing events that take place after the Elysium Release Day. (Check the Immortality, Grand Sponsor and if eligible the Retailer packs).

story:
Come and see our art work at www.TitansAndGods.com

We are run this campaign until NOVEBER 28TH!

Short Summary

We are three friends that got together and decided to make a book. Josh created the universe over the last five or so years. He also has some college background from Full Sail University in Computer Animation as well as some fine arts training while growing up. Joshua has been telling stories since he could talk, and good ones too. As for myself, Rebekah, I am currently attending Camden County College for a fine arts degree and have accomplished all of the required art related classes.

The goal is to see our first book in print. We have designed a unique world with spirits that live in the clouds of space and speak the language of truth, called, True Tongue, to which Josh constructed. This is just the beginning of what we have created and it would be our pleasure to share it with you.

We need help in order to obtain, hardware, printing the books, posters, promotion, copyrights, funds in order to place it in your hands, and the funds to achieve our small business in making more graphic novels.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking $40,000 to cover printing costs of the book and our poster, legal fees such as: Copyrights, Trademarks, ISBN numbers, and Start up business costs, Hardware and Software to make the digital art we need for the story, and to help support Josh so that he can work full time on drawing and writing the rest of the book in a timely manner.

Everyone who donates will get their name placed in the special thanks page as well as full access to our website and an E-book. You could even have there very own character interact with our hero. We will be producing books and posters signed in True Tongue in addition to original art pieces. Said perks depend on the amount you wish to help contribute to our funding, so the more you help fund us the better the perks. Even if you are unable to donate money, please be sure to spread the word to help get our dream off the ground.

The Impact

This book starts you off in a medieval fantasy world, but is the genesis for a much later Science Fiction universe. You will see a newly formatted graphic novel which will tell more story and show larger pictures. There will be great depth to world content for those of you who love to dive into other worlds with a thrilling interdenominational adventure through the passing of time and an entertaining story for everyone to enjoy. By contributing to this project you are counted among those who have helped our story begin. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate your support even if you can't donate. We will provide a flyer for you to hand out or email to friends and family. Please be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!


Video by Stasia Renaud
