story:
GAYSAR COMICS

We are more than just a comic book company. We are a company fighting for gay rights in an artistic way.  We are sharing our stories and showing our different phases of life while helping our community in many ways.


At GAYSAR Comics, we have created gay characters with special powers - known as gay-heroes. They may be fictional, but we are empowering all aspect of our community and celebrating our differences. How? GAYSAR will donate 2% of its bi-monthly comic book issue sales to international and national gay nonprofit organizations.


We represent all sides of our queer community. Our characters are gay, lesbian, transgender and bisexual, and feature sub-communities such as leather, bear, drag queen and twink.


Before we created these characters, we met with high school LGBTQ students to understand the issues they face and to inspire stories that reflect our community.

"GAYSAR, where anyone can be a hero"

Each character represents current issues that affect each of us, inside and outside of our community. For example, transgender issues; what these people are going through and have to face in a daily basic. Also, in Uganda gay people are being punished with life imprisonment or to death penalty. Kids in Honduras are being exploited and used for drug cartels. The global political issues we cover also include social justice, AIDS/HIV, love, awareness and acceptance.

With your donation

We will release the first comic book November 7 at Bent-Con expo in LA. In addition, with your donation you will be able to choose any of the Perks available.

The Impact

GAYSAR will impact our community in different ways, but most importantly in bring awareness, education and entertainment. We are also going to be releasing our gay-heroes logos where we will have them on clothing such as shirts and underwear. We will become a strong voice for the issues of our community.



Characters descriptions

Phase 2 - final design to be release on november 7 together with each gay-hero logo.


Erón

Leather-Latino Hero

He is an HIV Positive Honduran young men who imigrated to United State trying to run away from the drug cartel where he was used and abused sexually.  While escaping, an accident created an electric wave that generated a blast of brain waves; they activated parts of his brain that none of the human population has never been able to use before. Now,his brain gives him the power to do unexplainable things; his overall skills become limitless as his brain percentage goes up. He uses his abilities to do what seems right to him, despite what others think. He is torn between good and evil.


Height 5'9"

Weight 175 lbs.

Age: 19


Powers

Eron can use his mind to do basically anything. He see things you can’t see. His powers become limitless as his brain percentage goes higher, such as flying, traveling through time and dimensions, and breathing underwater.


Abilities

During the day he works in a coffee shop. At night he searches for a cure for HIV and solves issues that our minds are not able to resolve.


Stand-For

He stands for what's fair and right, and defeat at no cost those who do wrong.





Dr. Neveah

Scientist Transgender Hero

She super genius who has revolutionized gender affirmation by using hormone treatment that stimulates stem cell transformations. Due to a mistake in her laboratory, her transformation became unstable and gave her the ability to change into anyone she comes in contact with. She works for a secret army from the Human Rights Campaign, and uses her power to infiltrate and spy on other anti-gay organizations, all politicians and dictators to rescue gay people from persecution.


Height: 6'1"

Weight: 165 lbs.

Age: 30


Powers

Dr. Neveah can transform into other people.


Stands For

Transgendered awareness and acceptance. Instead of changing ourselves let’s change society’s views on us.





KIAN

Irish Bear Hero

Based on an ancient Irish fairy tale,  the white fairy cursed him with the strength and wisdom of the lost and fallen Irish bears of the kingdom. Prince Kian doesn’t realize he is an alien experiment.  He was created by Queen Izar’s ex-boyfriend, who was experimenting with human DNA with the last bear of Ireland to create a strong species to bring back to his planet.  Kian teaches the art of love and happiness; a bridge between man and animal; the bridge of love to men and women as they were one.


Height: 5'11

Weight:  278 lbs.

Age: 42


Powers

Hearing - he can hear beyond what he can see, his smell ability is 100 times more powerful than a normal human. His arm strength is as powerful as a machine. he is gifted with superhuman strength 



Abilities

Hiding this lower bear body, he is a motivational speaker for the gay community, promoting happiness and love in any way, and helping those coming out of the closet to have a safe place to come where they can be free and happy.


Stand For

The right of happiness to all without any boundaries. The sexual and love freedom.


Jaseri

African Lesbian Hero

She belongs to a hidden coven. She represent a new generation of powerful warlocks. Her grandmother chooses her to carry on her magic. Called Jaseri now, she is in a journey to defend the rights of women and children in Uganda. Using her powers, she vowed to fight for the weak and to teach them to be a warrior of their own.


Height: 5'6"

Weight: 135 lbs.

Age: 34


Powers

She is one with planet earth. She controls everything in nature, from plants and water, to volcanos.



Abilities

She was taught how to be a warrior, fighting now for exploited women and children.  She also rescues queer people from the society and  governments.


Stand For

She stand for the rights of women and children


Nami

Asian Twink Hero

His wealthy parents own a tech company. They implant a nano technology to save his life from an incurable disease.  The nano evolved and uncontrollably reproduces itself within his body causing him to be able to control all computer and technology wirelessly. He now helps third world countries develop technology that will help them be sustainable.


Height: 5'7

Weight: 140 lbs.

Age: 23


Powers

Technology. Control machines, devices, and electricity.


Ability

He has the ability to speak to computers and invent brand-new software and devices.


Stand For

Ending poverty and giving the right of a better life to the less fortunate.



Queen Izar

Drag Queen Hero

She is an ancient alien scientist. Together with her partner, they shape life on planet earth in order to keep the balance of the universe - death and life. She possesses cosmic powers. In an effort to feel human, she lives and entertains as a Drag Queen, fighting for gay rights.


Height: 6'

Weight: 160 lbs.

Age: 1 Million 


Powers

Cosmic power. In order to give life, she must take one life, and vice-versa. It’s the key of the balance of the universe. She can fly through the energy particles of life that surround us.


Abilities

She has the ability of connecting through the universe and stars. She performed as a drag queen to be able to experience different kinds of human lives throughout her characters and performances, giving her a bigger scope of the human experience.



Stand for

Love, rights and equality.

Age: 19
Powers
Eron can use his mind to do basically anything. He see things you can’t see. His powers become limitless as his brain percentage goes higher, such as flying, traveling through time and dimensions, and breathing underwater.
Abilities
During the day he works in a coffee shop. At night he searches for a cure for HIV and solves issues that our minds are not able to resolve.
Stand-For
He stands for what's fair and right, and defeat at no cost those who do wrong.



Dr. Neveah
Scientist Transgender Hero
She super genius who has revolutionized gender affirmation by using hormone treatment that stimulates stem cell transformations. Due to a mistake in her laboratory, her transformation became unstable and gave her the ability to change into anyone she comes in contact with. She works for a secret army from the Human Rights Campaign, and uses her power to infiltrate and spy on other anti-gay organizations, all politicians and dictators to rescue gay people from persecution.
Height: 6'1"
Weight: 165 lbs.
Age: 30
Powers
Dr. Neveah can transform into other people.
Stands For
Transgendered awareness and acceptance. Instead of changing ourselves let’s change society’s views on us.


KIAN
Irish Bear Hero
Based on an ancient Irish fairy tale,  the white fairy cursed him with the strength and wisdom of the lost and fallen Irish bears of the kingdom. Prince Kian doesn’t realize he is an alien experiment.  He was created by Queen Izar’s ex-boyfriend, who was experimenting with human DNA with the last bear of Ireland to create a strong species to bring back to his planet.  Kian teaches the art of love and happiness; a bridge between man and animal; the bridge of love to men and women as they were one.
Height: 5'11
Weight:  278 lbs.
Age: 42
Powers
Hearing - he can hear beyond what he can see, his smell ability is 100 times more powerful than a normal human. His arm strength is as powerful as a machine. he is gifted with superhuman strength 
Abilities
Hiding this lower bear body, he is a motivational speaker for the gay community, promoting happiness and love in any way, and helping those coming out of the closet to have a safe place to come where they can be free and happy.
Stand For
The right of happiness to all without any boundaries. The sexual and love freedom.


Jaseri
African Lesbian Hero
She belongs to a hidden coven. She represent a new generation of powerful warlocks. Her grandmother chooses her to carry on her magic. Called Jaseri now, she is in a journey to defend the rights of women and children in Uganda. Using her powers, she vowed to fight for the weak and to teach them to be a warrior of their own.
Height: 5'6"
Weight: 135 lbs. 
Age: 34
Powers
She is one with planet earth. She controls everything in nature, from plants and water, to volcanos.
Abilities
She was taught how to be a warrior, fighting now for exploited women and children.  She also rescues queer people from the society and  governments.
Stand For
She stand for the rights of women and children






Nami

Asian Twink Hero
His wealthy parents own a tech company. They implant a nano technology to save his life from an incurable disease.  The nano evolved and uncontrollably reproduces itself within his body causing him to be able to control all computer and technology wirelessly. He now helps third world countries develop technology that will help them be sustainable.
Height: 5'7
Weight: 140 lbs.
Age: 23
Powers 
Technology. Control machines, devices, and electricity.
Ability
He has the ability to speak to computers and invent brand-new software and devices.
Stand For
Ending poverty and giving the right of a better life to the less fortunate.






Queen Izar
Drag Queen Hero
She is an ancient alien scientist. Together with her partner, they shape life on planet earth in order to keep the balance of the universe - death and life. She possesses cosmic powers. In an effort to feel human, she lives and entertains as a Drag Queen, fighting for gay rights.
Height: 6'
Weight: 160 lbs.
Age: 1 Million 
Powers 
Cosmic power. In order to give life, she must take one life, and vice-versa. It’s the key of the balance of the universe. She can fly through the energy particles of life that surround us.
Abilities
She has the ability of connecting through the universe and stars. She performed as a drag queen to be able to experience different kinds of human lives throughout her characters and performances, giving her a bigger scope of the human experience.
Stand for
Love, rights and equality.

story:
The project

If this is the best of all possible worlds, what are the others? —Candide

Everybody wants to rule the world, and they’ll spin the facts as needed. The biggest spin has always been to suggest the world is perfect just the way it is. “Don’t worry, be happy.” But there is no Santa, and you’d better watch out—and take care of what’s near and dear to you. So it goes. That’s the message of the classic novel by Voltaire.

We want to turn that always-relevant book into an awesome graphic novel for a new generation. We’ve got the talent, the passion and the experience to produce a great result if enough people like you think it’s worth doing. In return we’re offering great previews and premiums for every level of contributor.

Candide is a sheltered young man suddenly cast out into a cruel world. The book runs its hero Candide through a gauntlet of woes as he slowly grows disillusioned with his teacher’s sunny philosophy that this is the best of all possible worlds. Voltaire was one of the greatest thinkers of the 18th-century, and Candide became his most well known work despite the uproar after publication. The book was banned and burned across Europe because it took on all the sacred cows—politics, religion, sex and more. It still blazes.


Why We Want To Do This, Why We’re Right For Candide

I’m Jamaal Taylor and I love to read. Candide has been one of my favorite books  and this is a project that I have wanted to do for a while. This is a project that I've commited to seeing through to the end. 

I’ve lined up an up-and-coming artist/designer/adapter for this project, Mark Martel. He’s done comics for writers around the world, adapted screenplays to comics and even created comics to promote a New York Times bestseller and a National Geographic documentary. With a background in advertising and marketing, Mark knows all the spin doctor tricks (and how to put some reverse-spin on them for Candide). He’s an unusually versatile stylist who understands the interplay of word and image in the unique medium of comics. He’s already done extensive visual research into a similar historical era. See the Gallery for examples of his work. We’ll be adding sketches for Candide so check back.

Be In On The Creative Process

Together we have adapted the first few pages of Candide. See how the script and original compare with actual comic pages as they’re created. As a contributor you’ll receive updates and previews as the work progresses. Be ready to be hooked.

Why Candide Is Still Necessary

It’s a story that has been around for 200 years, yet still totally relates to today. Candide falls in love, gets tricked into the army, survives wars, a massive earthquake, bounces all over the globe and ends up dodging fanatics in the Middle East. Candide gets starved, beaten, shipwrecked, swindled and nearly flayed alive before he wises up. Despite the massive satire the tale still rings true about human nature. Which is why it’s a classic.

Making The Best Possible Adaptation

For Candide we’re going for a contemporary “Marvel Comics” look and feel to appeal to younger and mainstream comics readers. Don’t worry—Candide isn’t going to become some superhero. But we’ll use the vividness, dynamics, and visual storytelling of top comics to grab the reader and pull them along on this wild tale.

It’s also perfects for a comics adaptation. Many “graphic novels” only run 10 pages. Or they’re a 32-page “adaptation” of a 400-page novel. What’s the point in that? Candide is already a short novel of a mere 100 pages. So we can make a true graphic novel adaptation, staying true to the original while coming in at a length that allows for great art, professional printing and a satisfying reader experience. When you’re done reading it you’ll feel you’ve watched a great movie that was just the right length.

What You Get—Perks & Previews!

Money raised will go toward adapting the book to script form and creating all of the artwork. That will take us about 6 months. Funds raised will also go to the first printing of the book for initial orders to comics shops and other outlets. Once on the market, the book can become self-sustaining through print-on-demand. That’s how other independent comics classics like Bone and XYZ made it.

So we need your help to get to that point.

 

Other ways you can help

Spread the word

Use social media etc

Leave comments & leads on who to talk to

Email us

Thank you for taking your time to read our proposal!

 

Private misfortunes are public benefits; so that the more private misfortunes there are, the greater is the general good. —Dr. Pangloss

story:
Dive into the the dark fantasy world of NO MANS WORLD, after a mysterious event the world of the great plain splintered into 10 different plains of reality! Now the scattered evil of the 10 plains fight and kill to obtain power in the newly formed reality!

24 FULL COLOUR PAGES OF AN ACTION PACKED ADVENTURE!  

 

Story and Art by Bailey Webster-Nokes

With Colours by Charis Pollard

 

COVER INKS

COVER COLOURS

 

The Story : Grizzled bounty hunters, Alden, Jax and Moop struggle to stay on two feet With the constant dangers and challenges of the Altered Plain, One of ten plains of reality. When the three bounty hunters accept a job, bad turns to worse when faced with a dangerous beast which could end their bounty hunting careers for good.

PAGE 6,7,8 SAMPLES :

PERKS :

THE RIFT BUNDLE!

-ONE Signed Physical copy of chapter 1

-ONE Nathan Elliott variant cover

- TWO A4 POSTERS

-ONE Character Sketch Card :

2)

ONE PHYSICAL COPY AND A SKETCH CARD! :

ONE PHYSICAL COPY:

Meet the Heroes of the Altered Plain! :

story:
Are you excited! We're excited.... AT LAST! In response to virtually NO requests AT ALL... ASININE is now available for PURCHASE!

If you don't like to think for yourself before acting and always wish, "Can't someone else do it?", then this comic is not for you! If you are a person who deals with ASININE people on a constant basis and are fed up, READ ON!

This limited edition all female cast comic book is 32 pages with experimental colored pages. All line art was rendered via a paint brush and india ink (giving the comic an independent/underground look) and hand lettered with a rusty calligraphy nib. Just like they did it back in the days of Golden Age of Comic Books! The art style is a special blend of some of the great comic book cartoonists. Some examples are: BIll Elder, Wally Wood, Bud Sagendorf, Jack Davis, Sergio Aragones, just to name a few. The work was colored via Photoshop with paintings done by my swell wife, Julie Simack. This comic is now available for immediate purchase! This version will only be available through this campaign. Any future editions (if successfully funded) will be available through Print on Demand and will be available through Amazon.com. What are you waiting for?!

 Additionally, it should be noted that this comic has a Socio-political/Philosophical theme (look it up but basically commenting about life and social aspects) and some material may not be suitable for an audience younger than high school students. The material is for a mature audience. There is mild cursing and the main characters could be termed as drawn mildly voluptuously for younger readers. This is the first mature publication for Ink and Feathers Comics.

We have researched printing companies for quite some time and we found one that will satisfy this book's need. This comic has a nice shiny gloss cover and a nice glossy interior finish.

Where did the idea come from?

ASININE! has been a work in progress for a couple of years. It started first from a cover originally drawn by Steve Ditko, Space Adventures No. 12, published by Charlton Comics that I (Anthony)  happened upon while researching his work shortly after his passing. Due to my warped sense of humor, I saw it in a different light and had to draw what came to my mind's eye. That being an female astronaut taking a picture of herself with a smart phone thinking she looked cute in her astronaut suit oblivious that her boyfriend was getting attacked by killer robots in the background. My demented and frustrated brain starting thinking of situations that I have witnessed in this modern day, like people keeping their noses stuck to their mobile devices (while walking, driving, sitting in the same room with friends and family), which lead to me internalizing to myself, "This is funny and yet, ASININE!" Hence the title came about.

Being a big fan of Mad Magazine and the horror comics that came out of EC Comics (Tales of the Crypt, Vault of Horror, Impact, ect) & Warren Publishing (Eerie, Creepy, Vampirella, ect), and bronze DC & Marvel horror lines (House of Mystery, Unexpected, Witching Hour, ARRGH!, PLOP!, ect), we felt my short story ideas fit right into an anthology setting like those produced in the past. Most, if not all, had hosts for their stories hence the female astronaut became Candida Vanus. So, if you liked those comics from days long since past, you'll "moderately like" this comic!

I had already been working on the continuation of Terry Freedom's adventures and the idea for a future Critters adventure. However, somehow this project started to take over my drawing hand. Before I knew it, I typed up a 12 page short story, titled Immortal No More,  and inked it lickety-split. 

Immortal No More synopsis: An female artist of retiring age living in a not too distant future becomes a victim of identity fraud.

This led to thoughts about my daily drive to work and other encounters with the general public that continually ticked me off. Excursion was whipped out. 

My wife, Julie, came home one day and vented her frustrations with the current medical system. Poof! You're NOT Really Sick, Are You? was born. 

Though these stories are a venting of sorts, my hope is that they are also funny as well. The goal is that readers enjoying these stories will experience a plethora of feelings attuned to amusement and bewilderment. The bewilderment coming from that each story that Candida Vanus presents to her audience are loosely based on ACTUAL EVENTS! They are, of course on a small level, exaggerated but none the less true from a myopic point of view of myself and my wife's.  Hopefully, readers will also see a little of themselves in the main characters after the initial read.

To see glimpses of other pages, please like and visit our Facebook Page: Ink & Feathers Comics Facebook Page

Curious to see previous completed comics in black and white? Click on the link below:

ComicFury

Now for something completely different, a small history lesson on Ink and Feathers Comics...

In the Beginning...

Back in 1991, Myke Feinman produced The Mask Conspiracy, an adventure starring an intrepid reporter, Terry Freedom, set in the 1930's. It was done in a Popeye bigfoot art style similar to Bud Sagendorf. Since, Ink and Feathers Comics has produced several books in it's twenty nine year existence as well contributed some of the proceeds to future artists and writers via Art & Journalism Scholarships through local high schools. We are no strangers to printing and distributing books. Our hope is to continue publishing fun stories for the foreseeable future.

In continuing this tradition, we have pulled from our vaults the last remaining copies of some of our past publications for rewards to help fund, ASININE! This is your chance to not only catch up on our past OUT OF PRINT works but also contribute to future publications in the works. It is our hope to fund this small comic which will lead to the LAST adventure in the Terry Freedom saga as well and a new extended 40+ paged Critters adventure graphic novel, I'M FAT, and a 300+ paged sequel to The Teddy Bear Conspiracies. We may even reprint certain publications that have not seen print since their first inception (The Mask Conspiracy turns 30 in 2021).

Who are we?

Anthony Feinman has briefly studied at School of the Art Institute (SAIC) in Chicago, IL. His first published work can be seen in Myke Feinman's, The Mask Conspiracy. He helped his father with some page breakdowns as well as an illustration or two. His first solo venture, Escape in a Dirigible (2003), was his first graphic novel story that he co-wrote and illustrated. (Some lucky few may get to read this book if they choose the book as a pledge or get a Terry Freedom Package.) He followed that up with web comic Blitz Howser,  jointly produced with A-Z Studios, and the graphic novels, The Magic Press and Tears of the Prophets, the first Critters book and a prequel to the next Terry Freedom adventure. He also produced the anthology publication, Superlative Tales, a pulp era replica from the late 1940's. Anthony also assisted his father with The Teddy Bear Conspiracies novel and it's companion short publication, In Search of the First Teddy Bear. He was also one of the editors for Superlative Tales' followup, Tales of the Outlandish, produced by A-Z Studios. (A few copies of this publication can also belong to a few lucky backers via this campaign.) He spent over half a decade freelancing resulting in his illustrations and designs being seen nationally as well as internationally for limited audiences. He has also been a freelance photographer in his spare time commercially. He's a busy boy on some days...

Julie Simack studied and received her BA at Eastern Illinois University (EIU) in Charleston, IL in Art focusing on oil painting. She has done various shows off and on throughout her career throughout the Midwest. Some of her select paintings from over the past 25 years are showcased in this publication throughout the short story, Immortal No More, written by Anthony. She is also the editor, color/content consultant for ASININE and wrote the short story, You're Not Really SIck, Are You?  for this publication. This story will be her debut as a short story author.

REWARDS

All the book listed below are available for rewards. It should be noted that a few are only available in limited quantities. For more information, visit www.ifcomics.com and click on book link to view each books' summary through AMAZON.COM.

The Mask Conspiracy-80+ paged black and white graphic novel 
The Crystal Skull Files-80+ paged black and white graphic novel, sequel to Mask Conspiracy
Escape in a Dirigible- 80+ paged black and white graphic novel
Blitz Howser- 48 paged comic book
Superlative Tales-160 paged pulp anthology of short stories 
The Teddy Bear Conspiracies- 340+ paged young adult novel
Tales of the Outlandish- 66 paged sequel to Superlative Tales
The Magic Press- 48 pages of three short black and white comics
Tears of the Prophets- 40 paged black and white comic, prequel to the last Terry Freedom story

Special Tiers

Get a limited copy of the ARTIST EDITION to ASININE! Compare the original inked version of the first story, Immortal No More, to the final color version. This limited edition was made for a convention we were planning on attending but no one was able to see them due to the current epidemic.

Get a limited edition of Tales of the Outlandish by A-Z Studios as a reward. Anthony and Myke Feinman edited this volume for the same authors that worked with them on Superlative Tales. This 66 paged sequel to Superlative Tales has multiple short stories for the seasoned sci-fi reader and is not available for purchase ANYWHERE.

Anthony has selected a few 11x17 pieces that he has left from doing comic book conventions from the past two years. These are experimental pieces he created before he started inking ASININE to get the feel of how to use painting brushes. One of them could be yours for only $40 plus a SIGNED copy of ASININE! included! 

Add Ons

After you have placed a pledge, how about a nice print to go along with it? Julie has hand picked some of her favorites which she will graciously sign for anyone that would like to include a piece of art to hang on their wall. Get one or get them all! Each piece will be on heavy duty glossy card stock that will look dynamite on a glassed frame! After you add on a print, send us a quick email as to which one(s) you would like us to include.

Risks and challenges

This comic is available now. Like right now! If you select a reward tier, hit pay, we will be sending you books immediately! Don’t hesitate! Be the first on the block to own history in the making!

It is always a risk or leap of faith when you putting out work that has not been tested or reviewed. Even more so due to our current medical/political climate and asking folks for funds when it could be better spent on things like FOOD & RENT! (What!? You want to eat AND have a place to live while you read our books? Elitists...) Additionally, international shipping, like the title of this campaign, is ASININE! For that reason, we are limiting this edition to select international regions. (Any international pledgers wishing for phyiscal copies will be receiving some additional comics not available through this campaign.) Once this campaign is over and all pledgers receive their copies, we plan on making a POD version and making it available via Amazon for any foreign fans to order. It will be easier and cheaper to get it to those fans in this fashion as opposed to charging those fans $30-$50 for shipping which is ABSOLUTELY ridiculous. IF we manage to have a HUGE contribution base, for future projects, we will look into contacting a foreign distributor to send our publications for foreign distribution. We hope that the set rate is enough to cover all costs to get the books to backers safely and in decent condition. The plan is for all products to be protected by the best means necessary to ensure they are received in as pristine condition as possible. Unfortunately, we also can't control the current medical climate which could cause delays in mail being processed in a timely fashion.

Ink and Feathers Comics is hobby company (independent since 1991). We have mostly only ever done the convention circuit throughout the Midwest. Although all our books have been available through local and chain stores and via Amazon.com plus distribution systems such as Diamond and Ingram, we have never made a push to be seen globally. This campaign will enable fans, old and new from all over, the opportunity to discover or re-discover our past works and well as get on the ground floor of our first new work in half a decade.

The hope is that this will incite new excitement and potentially set the standard to entice fans wanting to see our additional works in progress such as as sequel to The Critters, Terry Freedom's world, and The Hug characters as well as the re-release of The Mask Conspiracy (it's turning 30 in 2021).

It's always been hard for independents to find audiences due to comic book fans' reluctance to try new and untested properties. I have been told specifically at conventions by potential fans that they will read MAIN STREAM comics ONLY and they refuse to waste their time on independents. Too bad MAIN STREAM comics are FAILING and have to cut back on publishing content.

It all comes down to trust. This is your chance to make a leap with us by pledging and letting us know if we should continue on writing and drawing new adventures. We hope you will join us on this new and exciting endeavor!

Hence the title came about.Being a big fan of Mad Magazine and the horror comics that came out of EC Comics (Tales of the Crypt, Vault of Horror, Impact, ect) & Warren Publishing (Eerie, Creepy, Vampirella, ect), and bronze DC & Marvel horror lines (House of Mystery, Unexpected, Witching Hour, ARRGH!, PLOP!, ect), we felt my short story ideas fit right into an anthology setting like those produced in the past. Most, if not all, had hosts for their stories hence the female astronaut became Candida Vanus. So, if you liked those comics from days long since past, you'll "moderately like" this comic!I had already been working on the continuation of Terry Freedom's adventures and the idea for a future Critters adventure. However, somehow this project started to take over my drawing hand. Before I knew it, I typed up a 12 page short story, titled Immortal No More,  and inked it lickety-split. Immortal No More synopsis: An female artist of retiring age living in a not too distant future becomes a victim of identity fraud.This led to thoughts about my daily drive to work and other encounters with the general public that continually ticked me off. Excursion was whipped out. My wife, Julie, came home one day and vented her frustrations with the current medical system. Poof! You're NOT Really Sick, Are You? was born. Though these stories are a venting of sorts, my hope is that they are also funny as well. The goal is that readers enjoying these stories will experience a plethora of feelings attuned to amusement and bewilderment. The bewilderment coming from that each story that Candida Vanus presents to her audience are loosely based on ACTUAL EVENTS! They are, of course on a small level, exaggerated but none the less true from a myopic point of view of myself and my wife's.  Hopefully, readers will also see a little of themselves in the main characters after the initial read.To see glimpses of other pages, please like and visit our Facebook Page: Ink & Feathers Comics Facebook PageCurious to see previous completed comics in black and white? Click on the link below:ComicFuryNow for something completely different, a small history lesson on Ink and Feathers Comics...In the Beginning...Back in 1991, Myke Feinman produced The Mask Conspiracy, an adventure starring an intrepid reporter, Terry Freedom, set in the 1930's. It was done in a Popeye bigfoot art style similar to Bud Sagendorf. Since, Ink and Feathers Comics has produced several books in it's twenty nine year existence as well contributed some of the proceeds to future artists and writers via Art & Journalism Scholarships through local high schools. We are no strangers to printing and distributing books. Our hope is to continue publishing fun stories for the foreseeable future.In continuing this tradition, we have pulled from our vaults the last remaining copies of some of our past publications for rewards to help fund, ASININE! This is your chance to not only catch up on our past OUT OF PRINT works but also contribute to future publications in the works. It is our hope to fund this small comic which will lead to the LAST adventure in the Terry Freedom saga as well and a new extended 40+ paged Critters adventure graphic novel, I'M FAT, and a 300+ paged sequel to The Teddy Bear Conspiracies. We may even reprint certain publications that have not seen print since their first inception (The Mask Conspiracy turns 30 in 2021).Who are we?Anthony Feinman has briefly studied at School of the Art Institute (SAIC) in Chicago, IL. His first published work can be seen in Myke Feinman's, The Mask Conspiracy. He helped his father with some page breakdowns as well as an illustration or two. His first solo venture, Escape in a Dirigible (2003), was his first graphic novel story that he co-wrote and illustrated. (Some lucky few may get to read this book if they choose the book as a pledge or get a Terry Freedom Package.) He followed that up with web comic Blitz Howser,  jointly produced with A-Z Studios, and the graphic novels, The Magic Press and Tears of the Prophets, the first Critters book and a prequel to the next Terry Freedom adventure. He also produced the anthology publication, Superlative Tales, a pulp era replica from the late 1940's. Anthony also assisted his father with The Teddy Bear Conspiracies novel and it's companion short publication, In Search of the First Teddy Bear. He was also one of the editors for Superlative Tales' followup, Tales of the Outlandish, produced by A-Z Studios. (A few copies of this publication can also belong to a few lucky backers via this campaign.) He spent over half a decade freelancing resulting in his illustrations and designs being seen nationally as well as internationally for limited audiences. He has also been a freelance photographer in his spare time commercially. He's a busy boy on some days...Julie Simack studied and received her BA at Eastern Illinois University (EIU) in Charleston, IL in Art focusing on oil painting. She has done various shows off and on throughout her career throughout the Midwest. Some of her select paintings from over the past 25 years are showcased in this publication throughout the short story, Immortal No More, written by Anthony. She is also the editor, color/content consultant for ASININE and wrote the short story, You're Not Really SIck, Are You?  for this publication. This story will be her debut as a short story author.REWARDSAll the book listed below are available for rewards. It should be noted that a few are only available in limited quantities. For more information, visit www.ifcomics.com and click on book link to view each books' summary through AMAZON.COM.The Mask Conspiracy-80+ paged black and white graphic novel The Crystal Skull Files-80+ paged black and white graphic novel, sequel to Mask ConspiracyEscape in a Dirigible- 80+ paged black and white graphic novelBlitz Howser- 48 paged comic bookSuperlative Tales-160 paged pulp anthology of short stories The Teddy Bear Conspiracies- 340+ paged young adult novelTales of the Outlandish- 66 paged sequel to Superlative TalesThe Magic Press- 48 pages of three short black and white comicsTears of the Prophets- 40 paged black and white comic, prequel to the last Terry Freedom storySpecial TiersGet a limited copy of the ARTIST EDITION to ASININE! Compare the original inked version of the first story, Immortal No More, to the final color version. This limited edition was made for a convention we were planning on attending but no one was able to see them due to the current epidemic.Get a limited edition of Tales of the Outlandish by A-Z Studios as a reward. Anthony and Myke Feinman edited this volume for the same authors that worked with them on Superlative Tales. This 66 paged sequel to Superlative Tales has multiple short stories for the seasoned sci-fi reader and is not available for purchase ANYWHERE.Anthony has selected a few 11x17 pieces that he has left from doing comic book conventions from the past two years. These are experimental pieces he created before he started inking ASININE to get the feel of how to use painting brushes. One of them could be yours for only $40 plus a SIGNED copy of ASININE! included! Add OnsAfter you have placed a pledge, how about a nice print to go along with it? Julie has hand picked some of her favorites which she will graciously sign for anyone that would like to include a piece of art to hang on their wall. Get one or get them all! Each piece will be on heavy duty glossy card stock that will look dynamite on a glassed frame! After you add on a print, send us a quick email as to which one(s) you would like us to include.Risks and challengesThis comic is available now. Like right now! If you select a reward tier, hit pay, we will be sending you books immediately! Don’t hesitate! Be the first on the block to own history in the making!It is always a risk or leap of faith when you putting out work that has not been tested or reviewed. Even more so due to our current medical/political climate and asking folks for funds when it could be better spent on things like FOOD & RENT! (What!? You want to eat AND have a place to live while you read our books? Elitists...) Additionally, international shipping, like the title of this campaign, is ASININE! For that reason, we are limiting this edition to select international regions. (Any international pledgers wishing for phyiscal copies will be receiving some additional comics not available through this campaign.) Once this campaign is over and all pledgers receive their copies, we plan on making a POD version and making it available via Amazon for any foreign fans to order. It will be easier and cheaper to get it to those fans in this fashion as opposed to charging those fans $30-$50 for shipping which is ABSOLUTELY ridiculous. IF we manage to have a HUGE contribution base, for future projects, we will look into contacting a foreign distributor to send our publications for foreign distribution. We hope that the set rate is enough to cover all costs to get the books to backers safely and in decent condition. The plan is for all products to be protected by the best means necessary to ensure they are received in as pristine condition as possible. Unfortunately, we also can't control the current medical climate which could cause delays in mail being processed in a timely fashion.Ink and Feathers Comics is hobby company (independent since 1991). We have mostly only ever done the convention circuit throughout the Midwest. Although all our books have been available through local and chain stores and via Amazon.com plus distribution systems such as Diamond and Ingram, we have never made a push to be seen globally. This campaign will enable fans, old and new from all over, the opportunity to discover or re-discover our past works and well as get on the ground floor of our first new work in half a decade.The hope is that this will incite new excitement and potentially set the standard to entice fans wanting to see our additional works in progress such as as sequel to The Critters, Terry Freedom's world, and The Hug characters as well as the re-release of The Mask Conspiracy (it's turning 30 in 2021).It's always been hard for independents to find audiences due to comic book fans' reluctance to try new and untested properties. I have been told specifically at conventions by potential fans that they will read MAIN STREAM comics ONLY and they refuse to waste their time on independents. Too bad MAIN STREAM comics are FAILING and have to cut back on publishing content.It all comes down to trust. This is your chance to make a leap with us by pledging and letting us know if we should continue on writing and drawing new adventures. We hope you will join us on this new and exciting endeavor!

story:
The next exciting graphic novel from the creator of JAWBREAKERS- LOST SOULS!

IRON SIGHTS is a hard-boiled action drama set on the border...told in the trashy tone and fun style of a 1990s Straight-To-Video DVD!

If you like Quentin Tarantino crime flicks, John Woo Heroic Bloodshed movies or modern films like NO COUNTRY FOR OLD MEN, HELL AND HIGH WATER or SICARIO, then you'll love IRON SIGHTS!

 

THIS IS THE POSTER YOU WILL GET.

 

List of Creators

Story by Richard C. Meyer and Carlos Ivan Silva

Script & Lettering by Richard C. Meyer

Art by Ibai Canales

Cover/Poster by Kelsey Shannon

 

THIS IS THE ART THAT WILL BE ON THE T-SHIRT.

 

Cast of Characters

RAMADI- an Iraq vet addicted to the thrill of combat.

 

WOODS- Veteran of numerous clandestine Special Forces operations in Central and South America in the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s. Worked for the cartels in Mexico for the past 20 years. Coming home to the United States for the LAST time.

 

ESME- a young woman targeted by the cartels. In desperate need of help from ANYONE.

 

ZICK- Former Marine Scout/Sniper. Wood's former protégé. Driven insane when Woods ripped his tongue out with a pair of pliers for giving away their position while on a contract.

In desperate need of help from ANYONE. ZICK- Former Marine Scout/Sniper. Wood's former protégé. Driven insane when Woods ripped his tongue out with a pair of pliers for giving away their position while on a contract.

story:
Come inizia la storia 

I fatti nudi sono pochi: Marco ha ricevuto la sua diagnosi di sclerosi multipla dopo una settimana in ospedale e in questa settimana ha disegnato. Ne è uscito fuori un diario che merita di essere letto, perché è pieno di disegni stupendi, perché parla sommessamente di come la malattia cambi molto ma non tutto, perché fa capire che la diversità, sia essa una malattia, una condizione, uno stile di vita, è solo un punto di vista. 

Questo diario ha già cambiato il nostro modo di affrontare le sfide della giornata, proprio perché abbiamo scoperto che le cose importanti non sono cambiate per nulla. Eravamo una coppia prima, lo siamo ancora oggi; Marco era pigro prima, lo è ancora oggi; sapeva disegnare e sapeva fare musica prima, lo sa fare ancora oggi. Forse è sempre stato malato, ha solo scoperto qualcosa che non sapeva di sé, e chissà quante cose non sappiamo ancora di noi!

Ma c'è qualcos'altro che questo diario può ancora fare: aiutare la ricerca.

Come va avanti 

E' il benefit maggiore della nostra campagna, aiutare AISM, l'Associazione Italiana contro la Sclerosi Multipla. 

La cifra complessiva a cui tende il Crowd Funding servirà a coprire le spese fisse di stampa del diario, alcune piccole spese per i bonus e un equo pagamento per le persone che hanno contribuito alla sua veste grafica finale. Tutto il resto verrà dato alla ricerca, nessuno degli autori (chi vi scrive, Claudio, e il vero autore del diario, Marco) terrà qualcosa in tasca. Per essere precisi, è probabile che ci rimarranno alcuni libri in salotto, ma questo dipenderà da quanti contributori riusciremo ad avere. Le nostre limitate capacità matematiche ci fanno anche dire che, a spanne, la percentuale di beneficenza per ogni libro acquistato non sarà mai inferiore al 40% . Durante la campagna e alla sua conclusione vi aggiorneremo sull'effettiva cifra che doneremo e sulle modalità di donazione.

Come speriamo continui ad andare 

Saremo in pochi a gestire la campagna. Cercheremo di tenere viva l'attenzione dei nostri contributori per renderli partecipi del progetto, per far comprendere che "Ciò che cambia e ciò che no" è solo una delle milioni di storie di malati di sclerosi multipla, una delle milioni di storie di fumettisti in erba, una delle milioni di storie di coppie gay nel mondo.

A questo scopo, parallelamente a questa pagina gestiremo una pagina di Facebook a questo indirizzo https://fb.me/ciochecambia

Un grazie speciale e gigantesco a Luca Briganti e Claudio Martino Begnis per averci donato il magnifico video promozionale. E la loro amicizia.

http://www.lucabriganti.com/

Seguiteci e spargete la voce.

story:
*Click HERE to download Chapter 1 of Trigger Men FREE!*

 

That's 23 awesome pages for you to read and check out! 

 

What is Trigger Men and who are we?

A little over two years ago Triptych Books was created by Mike Andersen and Kyle Winters with the goal of making great comics that they'd want to read without editorial meddeling. Our first comic was Trigger Men and it was brought to life with the help of Kickstarter and a group of lovely people.

Trigger Men is a dark comedy about two best friends who work as hitmen and their misadventures in the world of contract killing. The series follows Matt and Jason as they try and navigate their reentry in to the world of hitmen and the series of things that just keep going wrong and draw them deeper in.

The work speaks for itself better than we could (our fingers aren't nimble enough right now) so we've made the first chapter, 23 pages, free to download on this page. You'll find the PDF file friendly and DRM-free.

 

Why We Need Your Hard Earned Cash

Printing is expensive. Very, very expensive in fact. Our trade collection is being printed by a wonderful printer in downtown San Francisco on premium paper and with premium inks. This makes the printing even more expensive, but we feel that its worth it to produce a beautiful comic.

This isn't just a reprint of existing material. We've added a previously unreleased Christmas Special in to the mix as well as our now out of print 60 page long fourth issue.

With a successful campaign we could print a large volume of these beautiful collections and sell them at a price we can all be happy about. Being as small as we are it can be difficult to strike that balance, but its something we think is important.

With the amount we'll have left over from the printing costs we will be acquiring a high quality microphone and the gear necessary to record a DVD-style audio commentary for the book featuring, Mike (the writer), Kyle (the Producer), Stephanie (the editor), Heather (the artist), Rachel (the designer and letterer) and anyone else that has been involved in the creation of the series so far. We know this will be an awesome feature that will add even more value to this series.

Even More Information!

Without your support we wouldn't be able to print this collection with all of the extras, special features and quality we think it deserves. Two years ago our wonderful community helped us get started on this path and the momentum they provided let us produce almost two hundred pages of awesome comics. Now we need the help again to bring things to the next level and gain the momentum we need to go farther and faster that we've gone before.

What will we do if we exceed our goal?

Other than high-five in slow motion and play like six hours of air guitar? Exceeding our funding goal makes it so we can print more books, go to more conventions and bring more cool swag to you awesome people. One of the ideas that has been bouncing around in our heads is an interesting way to get the digital comic and the awesome audio commentary in to people's hands in a more tactile manner. At this point we're thinking they'd be a Kickstarter and convention only exclusive if they ever were made.

story:
ABOUT THE AUTHOR

I'm Frank B. Goodin, II - an accomplished independent film-maker with a serious passion for creating good stories.  I've been sitting on this story - LIFE OR DEATH - for some time now, waiting for the right time to make the movie.  It only recently hit me that the story is PERFECT for a graphic novel.  When the idea came to me, I literally was like WOW!  I couldn't believe I hadn't thought about it before now.  So here we are!

LIFE OR DEATH - A SYNOPSIS

LIFE OR DEATH is a crime drama that explores how characters reconcile their spirituality when faced with the harsh realities of urban street-life. In essence, the story recreates the gritty existence made popular by mini-series like HBO's 'THE WIRE' and blends a spiritual awareness that is absent from that series.

The story takes place in the urban ghettos of the South – think somewhere in Atlanta or one of several cities in Florida. It opens with an extremely dramatic event in Caleb's life, then proceeds to reveal the events that led to that moment, and the resolution thereafter, in non-linear fashion, similar to films like PULP FICTION, CITY OF GOD and AMORES PERROS.

Fundamentally, LIFE OR DEATH is a powerful narrative of one young man's struggle to do what he thinks is right when faced with tough choices. However, as the story unfolds we discover the rich, interconnected subplots of other characters who are also struggling, in their own ways, with their concepts of spirituality as they do what they feel they must in order to survive and progress in this ruthless underworld - the only world they know.

I Need Your Help!

I have worked very hard to craft an intricate story that many readers will not only find entertaining, but insightful.  Within the context of graphic novels, there is nothing currently out like this story.  Even in the world of film-making, this story is a well crafted blend of two seemingly unmatchable genres... which two genres I'll let you discover for yourself.

But I need your contribution to properly produce, publish and distribute this great story.  LIFE OR DEATH and it's audience deserve each other, so please help me if you can!

How Your Contribution Helps Me

LIFE OR DEATH will be produced in six separate comic book isues, creating a nice series.  After these are complete, I will then combine all six issues into a single, limited edition Hardcover graphic novel - Volume 1.

The budget to produce and independently distribute each issue the way I'm planning is $2,600 per issue.  After Indiegogo takes a small percentage, that will leave just enough to pay my very talented illustrator Youmin Park (a rising star whose style is perfect for this series), create and maintain the official website, print a small number of comics (mostly for perk rewards and promotional purposes), and organize a targeted advertising campaign for this graphic novel.  Every penny of your contribution will go towards this; if enough people love the story then any profit for me will come much later.

I'm focused on creating the best graphic novel I can for you, the readers, because you deserve it.  But I do need your help to make it happen, and I've set up some very cool perks at different donation levels to say thank you for helping me bring LIFE OR DEATH to the world!  Most of these perks will only be available here for you special contributors who supported this vision before it has manifested, so please take a short moment to browse through them.  If a particular perk jumps out at you, don't hesitate to send me your contribution.  I can't thank you enough for your decsion to support this project, but as you'll see from the perks, I can certainly have a go at it!

About Fundraising

I can't know for sure if I'll be able to raise this goal of $2,600.  I've kept the goal as low as I could to properly address the various costs I explained earlier.  It's possible that I might not hit this fundraising goal, but have no worries if this happens - I will complete Issue #1 and send all promised perks to you.  It might simply take a bit longer (I'll be saving a bit of my paycheck from my job for this).

It's also very possible that I not only hit the fundraising goal, but exceed it.  If this happens, all extra funding would go towards Issue #2 of the LIFE OR DEATH saga. Let's say by some amazing stroke of good fortune, I happen to raise enough for the first two issues ($5,200)... then the extra funding will be used for Issue #3, and will continue in this fashion towards all six issues of Volume 1.  When you check out the perks, you'll see that I've set them up in such a way that makes this possible.

I'm very optimistic that once Issue #1 is released to the public, readers will want to know what comes next, so as you can see I'm quite obviously hoping that the popularity of this series will grow over time.  If the series contained within Volume 1 is successful, I've already outlined two more Volumes for LIFE OR DEATH - a sequel and a prequel.  So I'm hoping that I'm at the start of something that has the potential to be quite popular, and I'm extending the opportunity for you to be right here with me at the starting line, so please support me if you can - I certainly need it!

If You Want To Help, But Don't Have Money...

There is a another HUGE way everyone can help this campaign - make a lot of noise about it!  Tweet about it to your friends - talk about it and share this page on Facebook!  Use the sharing tools right at the top of this Indiegogo page to spread the word that LIFE OR DEATH the graphic novel is coming soon, and that I'm raising funds right now.  If you use the sharing tools located here, I can keep track, and I will give various 'thank you' perks to those who are giving their time to spread the word to show that I appreciate you just as much as those who can help by contributing funding.

WE'RE EXCITED!

Youmin and I are so excited about this project that we've already started; we have complete faith that the funding will come.

So I want to share with you a bit of the process and one completed page of the actual story!

It All Starts With The Script...

Well, that's how the saying goes anyway.  :-)  It all really starts with a good idea that must be carefully crafted into a great script.  Most of the time, this is a very challenging & time-consuming process.  Ah, how great is the pain writers often experience as they work to produce something worth reading!  It can even be a bit lonely at times, but any successful writer will tell you that the reward is worth the challenge, hands down.

From developing the concept, to writing and re-writing the several drafts after reader reviews from screenwriting services & competitions, I have given many months to LIFE OR DEATH.  If I had to estimate, I'd guess it has taken somewhere between 12 - 18 months to develop the story to where it is now.

Once I share the all of the story fundamentals with the great Youmin Park, she does a few quick sketches of the main characters, some locations, etc. for me to approve.  Her work brings the story to life!

 

 

After we get on the same page about the fundamentals, we get to work on the comic pages.  Here's an example:

I send a page from the script:

Then Youmin will interpret the scene, sketch a quick visual layout, and make changes if necessary:

After we agree on the layout, Youmin commits it to ink:

The final step is a finished colored page with all the proper lettering!

I love Youmin's style!!!


One Final Note About Story...

I've mentioned several times how powerful I think this story is... please trust that I'm not saying this as hype.  I hold an MFA in Film-making from FSU's Graduate Film school - one of the top film schools in the country.  I've won an Emmy Award for my first independent documentary (called 'THE 904'), and I've won several film festivals with my first indie feature LOVE TRAP, which is currently on Netflix.  Please trust me when I promise to reward your support with a great graphic novel in LIFE OR DEATH.

But you don't have to take only my word for it... here is some of what a few industry readers had to say about LIFE OR DEATH:

"An excellent story! I recognize the effort and dedication put forth by the writer to move the translation process from base idea to solid premise, and finally to an entertaining story. Well done.  As stated, the story itself is not only entertaining – it is compelling. The characters are well thought out and evolve along with the telling of the story. There is an exciting flow and rhythm to this story – with sufficient beats to maintain audience interest." - Larry Miles, Red Inkworks

"The main characters are strong and much of the dialogue powerful.  In fact the writing here is excellent so I’m giving the script CONSIDER for the writer." - Reader "AP" from Coverage, Ink.

"LIFE OR DEATH is certainly a very competently written screenplay with a strong moral message, exciting sequences and really sharp dialogue... there is obvious writing talent on display here." - Reader "KO" from Coverage, Ink.

"Frank—Good job on your script. It was very realistic and gritty and an intriguing read.  I did feel that your story was very realistic and insightful and think that it does reach out across cultures.  You’ve hit a universal note in that it’s a part of the human condition to struggle between doing what’s right and doing what’s easy and not necessarily good.  Killer job on your dialogue! Your characters all have wonderfully unique voices.  Bravo!  Also, I noticed and appreciated great moments throughout your script but there was no chance to mention all of them in this critique."

- Cheryl Herring, A Feeding Frenzy Screenplay Competition

Of course, the story wasn't perfect.  All of these readers had various critiques for the story that I haven't listed here, but I have used to make the story even stronger than it was when they read it.  So please support me with the notion that you are supporting something great and deserving, because you are.  :-)

Thank You!!!
story_txt:
ABOUT THE AUTHOR
I'm Frank B. Goodin, II - an accomplished independent film-maker with a serious passion for creating good stories.  I've been sitting on this story - LIFE OR DEATH - for some time now, waiting for the right time to make the movie.  It only recently hit me that the story is PERFECT for a graphic novel.  When the idea came to me, I literally was like WOW!  I couldn't believe I hadn't thought about it before now.  So here we are!
LIFE OR DEATH - A SYNOPSIS
LIFE OR DEATH is a crime drama that explores how characters reconcile their spirituality when faced with the harsh realities of urban street-life. In essence, the story recreates the gritty existence made popular by mini-series like HBO's 'THE WIRE' and blends a spiritual awareness that is absent from that series.
The story takes place in the urban ghettos of the South – think somewhere in Atlanta or one of several cities in Florida. It opens with an extremely dramatic event in Caleb's life, then proceeds to reveal the events that led to that moment, and the resolution thereafter, in non-linear fashion, similar to films like PULP FICTION, CITY OF GOD and AMORES PERROS.Fundamentally, LIFE OR DEATH is a powerful narrative of one young man's struggle to do what he thinks is right when faced with tough choices. However, as the story unfolds we discover the rich, interconnected subplots of other characters who are also struggling, in their own ways, with their concepts of spirituality as they do what they feel they must in order to survive and progress in this ruthless underworld - the only world they know.
I Need Your Help!
I have worked very hard to craft an intricate story that many readers will not only find entertaining, but insightful.  Within the context of graphic novels, there is nothing currently out like this story.  Even in the world of film-making, this story is a well crafted blend of two seemingly unmatchable genres... which two genres I'll let you discover for yourself.
But I need your contribution to properly produce, publish and distribute this great story.  LIFE OR DEATH and it's audience deserve each other, so please help me if you can!
How Your Contribution Helps Me
LIFE OR DEATH will be produced in six separate comic book isues, creating a nice series.  After these are complete, I will then combine all six issues into a single, limited edition Hardcover graphic novel - Volume 1.
The budget to produce and independently distribute each issue the way I'm planning is $2,600 per issue.  After Indiegogo takes a small percentage, that will leave just enough to pay my very talented illustrator Youmin Park (a rising star whose style is perfect for this series), create and maintain the official website, print a small number of comics (mostly for perk rewards and promotional purposes), and organize a targeted advertising campaign for this graphic novel.  Every penny of your contribution will go towards this; if enough people love the story then any profit for me will come much later.
I'm focused on creating the best graphic novel I can for you, the readers, because you deserve it.  But I do need your help to make it happen, and I've set up some very cool perks at different donation levels to say thank you for helping me bring LIFE OR DEATH to the world!  Most of these perks will only be available here for you special contributors who supported this vision before it has manifested, so please take a short moment to browse through them.  If a particular perk jumps out at you, don't hesitate to send me your contribution.  I can't thank you enough for your decsion to support this project, but as you'll see from the perks, I can certainly have a go at it!
About Fundraising
I can't know for sure if I'll be able to raise this goal of $2,600.  I've kept the goal as low as I could to properly address the various costs I explained earlier.  It's possible that I might not hit this fundraising goal, but have no worries if this happens - I will complete Issue #1 and send all promised perks to you.  It might simply take a bit longer (I'll be saving a bit of my paycheck from my job for this).
It's also very possible that I not only hit the fundraising goal, but exceed it.  If this happens, all extra funding would go towards Issue #2 of the LIFE OR DEATH saga. Let's say by some amazing stroke of good fortune, I happen to raise enough for the first two issues ($5,200)... then the extra funding will be used for Issue #3, and will continue in this fashion towards all six issues of Volume 1.  When you check out the perks, you'll see that I've set them up in such a way that makes this possible.
I'm very optimistic that once Issue #1 is released to the public, readers will want to know what comes next, so as you can see I'm quite obviously hoping that the popularity of this series will grow over time.  If the series contained within Volume 1 is successful, I've already outlined two more Volumes for LIFE OR DEATH - a sequel and a prequel.  So I'm hoping that I'm at the start of something that has the potential to be quite popular, and I'm extending the opportunity for you to be right here with me at the starting line, so please support me if you can - I certainly need it!
If You Want To Help, But Don't Have Money...
There is a another HUGE way everyone can help this campaign - make a lot of noise about it!  Tweet about it to your friends - talk about it and share this page on Facebook!  Use the sharing tools right at the top of this Indiegogo page to spread the word that LIFE OR DEATH the graphic novel is coming soon, and that I'm raising funds right now.  If you use the sharing tools located here, I can keep track, and I will give various 'thank you' perks to those who are giving their time to spread the word to show that I appreciate you just as much as those who can help by contributing funding.
WE'RE EXCITED!
Youmin and I are so excited about this project that we've already started; we have complete faith that the funding will come.
So I want to share with you a bit of the process and one completed page of the actual story!
It All Starts With The Script...

Well, that's how the saying goes anyway.  :-)  It all really starts with a good idea that must be carefully crafted into a great script.  Most of the time, this is a very challenging & time-consuming process.  Ah, how great is the pain writers often experience as they work to produce something worth reading!  It can even be a bit lonely at times, but any successful writer will tell you that the reward is worth the challenge, hands down.

After we get on the same page about the fundamentals, we get to work on the comic pages.  Here's an example:
I send a page from the script:

Then Youmin will interpret the scene, sketch a quick visual layout, and make changes if necessary:

After we agree on the layout, Youmin commits it to ink:

The final step is a finished colored page with all the proper lettering!

I love Youmin's style!!!

One Final Note About Story...
I've mentioned several times how powerful I think this story is... please trust that I'm not saying this as hype.  I hold an MFA in Film-making from FSU's Graduate Film school - one of the top film schools in the country.  I've won an Emmy Award for my first independent documentary (called 'THE 904'), and I've won several film festivals with my first indie feature LOVE TRAP, which is currently on Netflix.  Please trust me when I promise to reward your support with a great graphic novel in LIFE OR DEATH.

There is an exciting flow and rhythm to this story – with sufficient beats to maintain audience interest." - Larry Miles, Red Inkworks

"LIFE OR DEATH is certainly a very competently written screenplay with a strong moral message, exciting sequences and really sharp dialogue... there is obvious writing talent on display here." - Reader "KO" from Coverage, Ink.

It was very realistic and gritty and an intriguing read.  I did feel that your story was very realistic and insightful and think that it does reach out across cultures.  You’ve hit a universal note in that it’s a part of the human condition to struggle between doing what’s right and doing what’s easy and not necessarily good.  Killer job on your dialogue! Your characters all have wonderfully unique voices.  Bravo!  Also, I noticed and appreciated great moments throughout your script but there was no chance to mention all of them in this critique."
- Cheryl Herring, A Feeding Frenzy Screenplay Competition
Of course, the story wasn't perfect.  All of these readers had various critiques for the story that I haven't listed here, but I have used to make the story even stronger than it was when they read it.  So please support me with the notion that you are supporting something great and deserving, because you are.  :-)

story:
About this Project

Help an Author and Artist publish their Comic Book!

Publishing and printing a comic book costs $. You can say that it's simpler to market online, but people want hard copies too. We also hope to bring our comic book to showcase at comic-cons and horror conventions.

So won't you help us reach our goal?

This is our comic book:

"The Guardian, Revenant, and Dominion" Comic Book/Graphic Novel is the comic book version of up-and-coming Horror Author Lia Scott Price's Vampire Trilogy Novel. Illustrated by Comic Book Artist Wendell Nelson, the Comic Book/Graphic Novel features Lia Scott Price's  unique and original "Serial Killer and Vampire Guardian Angels (TM)", disillusioned Guardian Angels who have become Mercy Killers and Vampires and who target people who specifically pray in despair to Angels.

The Comic Book will first be released online, and publication of the hard copy is planned for December 2011. In 2012, the goal is to market and promote the hard copy version of the book at Comic Book and Horror Conventions.

We are also helping a new, up-and-coming comic book artist Wendell Nelson get a start in hopefully what will be an awesome career in comic book illustration. We appreciate your help and support!

The Impact

You'll be helping support two very creative people in bringing a new comic book  with fresh, new, original ideas and you'll be supporting independent artists.

What We Need and What You Get


Funds are needed for the following:

1. Publication/Distribution of the hard copy version of the book. Although digital publishing is at a minimal cost, copies of the actual color comic book cost $.


Other Ways You Can Help

We welcome free publicity opportunities from Horror Blog Owners,  Online Radio Hosts,  Horror Convention Planners, and Journalists. Even if you can't donate, we appreciate professionals in the Horror Community and the Media spreading the word about the Comic Book. (Free publicity is always good!) If you prefer, you can always purchase Lia Scott Price Books and Films or Merchandise to help fund this project from www.liascottprice.com.

story:
Hello, my name is Nick Davis the Author of A Teddy Bear Tale - Unconditional
and I welcome you to the IndieGoGo Project for A Teddy Bear Tale II - Faithful.

This is the second Teddy Bear Tales book and it is a fully illustrated all ages tale of imagination and wonder that continues the story of our Heroic Teddy Bear Tristan as he protects his child from the Monsters in the night.

What is A Teddy Bear Tale II - Faithful about?

In A Teddy Bear Tale II we begin to explore more of Tristan’s unique world. First we meet a new companion a slightly nutty plushy Bunny called Wilma, the once cuddly toy of the Tristan's Boy’s sister. She is introduces a Boggle, a curious creature that repairs broken and discarded toys to pass on to other children who deserve them.

Together they wake up Tristan from his long sleep in the attic asking for his help to ward off a Giant Green Headed Monster that is stealing all the toys and is after the secret Boggle Toy Train.

Of course our heroic Teddy Bear agrees to help and with Wilma they set off in the Golden Goose, a bright yellow cardboard biplane that his boy once built him for a imaginative adventure, to get onboard the Toy Train before the Green Headed Monster and his Monster Minions capture it.

This brand new adventure featuring planes, trains, clockwork riding beasts, new Monsters and dashing deeds. As Tristan defends happiness and the Toy Train from the Green Headed Monster in beautiful full color illustrations...

Please enjoy the follow extract below...

All around him Tristan’s world began to shake; the jungle vista gave way to a messy boy’s room, strewn with toys, wooden blocks and a crashed cardboard yellow biplane. Then his world shook again the vision of the room vision melted to be replaced with a bluey inky darkness and the smell of a musty cardboard box.  Tristan could now hear voices. Was his boy finally coming back for him? Excitement grew inside the Teddy Bear very soon he would be reunited with his boy and be able to resume his role as the most faithful of companions. Tristan could feel a warm glow inside him soon he would feel the joy of being played with again. For it had been a long time since Tristan was packed away and left to slumber in the dark, and he was feeling very lonely. 

The tape on the box snapped, the lid opened and a yellow light shone in his face. Blinking Tristan could make out two shadowy figures, one shorter than the other and he raised his paw to shield his eyes from the light. He could see a grubby white furred Bunny, with light blue eyes, lopped ears tied with red ribbon, wearing a tatty pink tutu and holding silver handled flashlight. Almost immediately Tristan was seized up and hugged so tight he thought his eyes were going to pop out. The Bunny was Wilma, the cuddly toy that once belonged to his boy’s sister and she was the sometimes partner on his adventures. Wilma finally released Tristan and starting talking a mile a minute about how she was rescued from a very damp box and how they searched the entire attic for him once the Boggles had learned that Tristan was up here. Wilma’s introduced her companion an old Boggle, a crooked nosed creature that takes discarded and broken toys, fixes them and leaves them in the room of deserving children. Indeed this Boggle was the very same one Tristan had encountered many years ago sorting through his child’s old toys. The Boggle shook Tristan’s paw and to the Teddy Bear’s great surprise asked for his help.

Tell me more...

A Teddy Bear Tale II  - Faithful is the sequel to A Teddy Bear Tale where Tristan took on the Monsters under the bed and defeated the evil Bogeyman, click here to learn more about the first book.

Faithful will be the second fully illustrated children's book by Nick Davis written in the gleefully fun style of Roald Dahl. The artist from the first book Dan Nokes, who's concept sketches you can see in this pitch, is returning with his beautiful color ink illustrations. It is my hope to be able to produce a book that will be about 50 pages in length and feature up to 18 full color double page images.

The funds raised here go strictly to paying the Artist for the first set of illustrations for the book. The production and remaining share of costs are being carried by the books author Nick Davis.

How you can help

Please contribute, the first level of backing is really just a Pre-Order for the book and it comes signed by myself (the Author Nick Davis) and by the Artist Dan Nokes.

If you can’t become a Backer please help by spreading the word about about this new whimsical tale of a very adventurous Teddy Bear. Indie Go Go has some nifty share tools you can use to make this happen...

Now help Tristan Live!!!

Please Note - Any overseas Backers please add an additional $5 to your Backer amount to cover shipping costs.
