story:
Our Twitter hashtag is #cmcsthng - keep an eye out for new perks, swag and news

 


In David Lloyd's own words: "Those Vendetta pages are the 32-page sections that were separately printed as part of the printing process of the first edition of the collection - the graphic novel as it is otherwise described - the press check of which I attended at Ronalds in Montreal. Sections like these are collected and bound into the book, trimmed and wrapped around with the cover. These were some that were part of the prep for colour-checking. These things don't mean much to the printers, of course, and I'm sure that the ones I didn't take away with me as souvenirs were obviously trashed, but they mean a lot to me, and may mean something to others as rare items of a great book. I'm almost certain no-one but me has kept any, and no-one else has any but me, and there are just 25 of them left with me, including those 8 you have. So they are, I'd guess, a rare thing."

David Lloyd is the illustrator of V for Vendetta, and publisher of Aces Weekly, an exclusively digital comic art magazine which features some of the world's finest creators of comic art.

 


Comics Thing thanks David for his support!

 

 

Comics Thing is three different products: a digital comics reader for tablets and phones, a comics creator with its own format, and a backend technology to deliver those comics to readers around the world.

The Reader:

Comics Thing will be the first digital comics reader for tablets and phones letting readers combine CBZ and PDF comics with purchased works in a proprietary format. Readers will be able to access their comics across all their devices, and use Comics Things’ store to complete collections, organize libraries, and buy new series.

Indies and makers can set up their own app store, powered by Comics Thing, and selling their own comics, without having to give anyone half their money.

The Reader will work as a web widget and desktop app, as well as on phones and tablets across iOS and Android.

The Maker:

The Maker for Comics Thing will come in two flavors – as a plug-in for InDesign, and as a standalone app. Both will output a Comics Thing proprietary format comic book or graphic novel in a hybrid of HTML5 and native code.

This unique Comics Thing format will be released Open Source. If Comics Thing were to disappear, or fall into the hands of the man, your comics won’t – not the ones you bought, not the ones you made.

The app and the plug-in itself will function modularly, with other plug-ins and scripts. This way Comics Thing can provide the most popular tools to indies, artist and writers, while reserving some costly-to-produce industrial-scale technologies for big publishers who decide to leave the dark side for the light. (These will be things like serving dynamic ads, chunk-level analytics, automatic content repurposing from XML, downloadable files for 3D printers, etc.)

The standalone app will be as easy to use as PowerPoint or Keynote, but should feel as powerful as Flash (without the complexity of ActionScript) or Hype.

Comics Thing will run a private forums for contributors above $30, where you can input ideas, requests, suggestions, or rip our work apart. Comics Thing is for you.

And remember, The Maker and the Comics Thing format will be released Open Source, so if you want to create a plugin or improvement, Comics Thing will salute you! 

(photo: David Lloyd, V for Vendetta illustrator)

The Storm (stretch goal):

The Storm is Comics Things’ cloud engine. Your purchased comics will be stored locally, but also in the cloud, where they can be redownloaded any time, across all the devices.

The Storm is also where Comics Thing’s sustainable financial model lives. I’ve worked on apps brutalized by heavy loads during big events – like the live transmission of X Factor. Comics Thing will build The Storm to scale – cost-efficient for indies and artists, but robust enough to handle the distribution of, say, 7,000 free editions for every reader during a major music and digital event in a large Southern state. 

 

Here’s how it stands for artists and writers now. They make a digital comic book and take it to a publisher, who miraculously agrees to publish it:

  • Apple or Google take 30%
  • The distributor takes 50% of what’s left – 35%
  • The publisher takes 50% of the remaining 35% – 17.5%
  • The writer and artist split the remaining 17.5%, receiving 8.75% each.

8.75% of $2.99 is $0.26, and that’s just not enough.

Make no mistake -- this campaign is a direct resopnse to comiXology's growing monopoly.

Comics Thing will make it possible for artists, writers and indies to publish their own comics, and receive enough from the sale price to make it worth making more.

 

How will my money help?

Your money will help makers produce more and better comics for the whole comics community.


Isn’t there already an iTunes of comic books and graphic novels?

No. I know the reader you’re talking about, but it doesn’t let me read my CBZ and PDF comics. And they charge indie publishers and makers 50%. That’s 50% of 70%, after Apple’s take. As a maker, I can’t include videos in my comics, despite the cost. And they have editorial control over what I can publish and how I’ll sell it.

That’s not how I envision an iTunes of comics.

 

Did you say downloadable files for 3D printers?

Yeah, it’s a cool idea, isn’t it? Lots of print mags and (mostly non-English) comics have cover-mount freebies. I think files for 3D printers are the new swag.

 

Who are you?

Dr Charles Kriel (that’s me – the guy writing this). By day, I help entertainment companies dream up cool new games, programs and toys. By night, I’m a writer, musician, photographer, DJ and game designer. I’ll lead the Comics Thing team.

 

Why do you want to build Comics Thing?

Comic book and graphic novel publishing should be in the hands of artists, writers, indies and readers. I’ve written a few books, but I want to self-publish my graphic novels. There are tools out there, but I honestly either can’t afford them, or can’t live with splitting the profits 50 / 50 with a software developer.

And I want to include video, audio and live feeds in my books. I want an in-app browser with links. And I want it to be as technically easy to make a comic as using PowerPoint.

So I’m building Comics Thing, and then I’m releasing it open source.

 (photo: Glenn Fabry, The Preacher cover illustrator)

 

Why IndieGoGo?

I’ve worked with half of the Big Six publishing houses, and a couple of them have asked if I need money to build Comics Thing. I’ve heard the same from a couple independents. In every case, I’ve asked them to wait – let me try to crowdfund this first – I don’t want Comics Thing controlled by a couple of big companies.

In the 19th century, publishing was in the hands of writers, artists, indies and readers. That’s where it belongs in the 21st.

 

Are you the little guy fighting the good fight?

I hope so. When I’m not writing stories or making games, I travel to emerging democracies consulting free press startup news outfits, helping them keep their doors open, training journalists and photographers. In the last six months, I’ve worked in Tbilisi and Kosovo with journalists from Albania, Azerbaijan, Armenia, Serbia and Kosovo.

 

Are you qualified to do this?

Yes. I conceptualize and produce games and apps for a living, and in the last few years, I’ve worked on projects for the BBC, Disney, Aardman (who make Wallace & Gromit), FremantleMedia (The X Factor), ABC (US), UNESCO, Random House, CBC, Tate Britain, the Royal Ontario Museum, Mercedes Benz and lots of others. Many have won awards, including Emmys. I have a PhD from St Martins. You can check the bona fides on LinkedIn.

 

Are you doing this alone?

Not at all. I don’t think anyone could. Through my apps and games, I work with some of the best coders and designers in Europe, the US and Canada – most of the money will go to paying them for their hard work.

This campaign has support from indie writers, artists and publishers. We’ve had publicity and swag boosts along the way from indie publisher Markosia, indie distributor UK Comics and UK on Display, V for Vendetta illustrator David Lloyd, Resonance FM’s Alex Fitch and a lot of folks at comics conventions – not to mention the cosplayers.

We expect to add more bloggers, publishers, writers, artists and supporters – and more rewards! – so keep an eye out here.

 

Is that all the swag you got?

Stand back and watch while we bring it.

The swag has just begun. We'll announce more every week.

Once we reach our funding goal, we'll announce a number of very limited but very special prizes from our favorite artists (whose pictures might be on this page), writers and publishers. Keep an eye out, but please help us hit our goal as well.

 

Can I work on your project?

Yes, in four ways.

First, you can spread the word and help Comics Thing get funded.

Second, by contributing $30 or more, you’ll get access to a private forums where you’ll hear the latest developments, and can input your ideas, criticisms, and compliments.

If you’re a cracking coder or designer, we want to know about your work so we can try to find a way to make you part of the team.

And finally, when we go Open Source, you can work to build on the foundations our team will lay.

 

 

After we send out all the cool swag -- some of which has been donated or seriously discounted by artists, writers and indies -- we'll spend almost all of the money making Comics Thing. Most of that will go to paying the salaries of hard-working coders and designers. We won't pay for bricks and mortar. We won't rake profits. And we will publish updates and post-mortems in the forums, letting you know where the money's gone, and how the rest is going.

story_txt:
Our Twitter hashtag is #cmcsthng - keep an eye out for new perks, swag and news
 

In David Lloyd's own words: "Those Vendetta pages are the 32-page sections that were separately printed as part of the printing process of the first edition of the collection - the graphic novel as it is otherwise described - the press check of which I attended at Ronalds in Montreal. Sections like these are collected and bound into the book, trimmed and wrapped around with the cover. These were some that were part of the prep for colour-checking. These things don't mean much to the printers, of course, and I'm sure that the ones I didn't take away with me as souvenirs were obviously trashed, but they mean a lot to me, and may mean something to others as rare items of a great book. I'm almost certain no-one but me has kept any, and no-one else has any but me, and there are just 25 of them left with me, including those 8 you have. So they are, I'd guess, a rare thing."
David Lloyd is the illustrator of V for Vendetta, and publisher of Aces Weekly, an exclusively digital comic art magazine which features some of the world's finest creators of comic art.
 

Comics Thing thanks David for his support!
 
 
Comics Thing is three different products: a digital comics reader for tablets and phones, a comics creator with its own format, and a backend technology to deliver those comics to readers around the world.

The Reader:
Comics Thing will be the first digital comics reader for tablets and phones letting readers combine CBZ and PDF comics with purchased works in a proprietary format. Readers will be able to access their comics across all their devices, and use Comics Things’ store to complete collections, organize libraries, and buy new series.
Indies and makers can set up their own app store, powered by Comics Thing, and selling their own comics, without having to give anyone half their money.
The Reader will work as a web widget and desktop app, as well as on phones and tablets across iOS and Android.
The Maker:
The Maker for Comics Thing will come in two flavors – as a plug-in for InDesign, and as a standalone app. Both will output a Comics Thing proprietary format comic book or graphic novel in a hybrid of HTML5 and native code.
This unique Comics Thing format will be released Open Source. If Comics Thing were to disappear, or fall into the hands of the man, your comics won’t – not the ones you bought, not the ones you made.
The app and the plug-in itself will function modularly, with other plug-ins and scripts. This way Comics Thing can provide the most popular tools to indies, artist and writers, while reserving some costly-to-produce industrial-scale technologies for big publishers who decide to leave the dark side for the light. (These will be things like serving dynamic ads, chunk-level analytics, automatic content repurposing from XML, downloadable files for 3D printers, etc.)
The standalone app will be as easy to use as PowerPoint or Keynote, but should feel as powerful as Flash (without the complexity of ActionScript) or Hype.
Comics Thing will run a private forums for contributors above $30, where you can input ideas, requests, suggestions, or rip our work apart. Comics Thing is for you.
And remember, The Maker and the Comics Thing format will be released Open Source, so if you want to create a plugin or improvement, Comics Thing will salute you! 

(photo: David Lloyd, V for Vendetta illustrator)
The Storm (stretch goal):
The Storm is Comics Things’ cloud engine. Your purchased comics will be stored locally, but also in the cloud, where they can be redownloaded any time, across all the devices.
The Storm is also where Comics Thing’s sustainable financial model lives. I’ve worked on apps brutalized by heavy loads during big events – like the live transmission of X Factor. Comics Thing will build The Storm to scale – cost-efficient for indies and artists, but robust enough to handle the distribution of, say, 7,000 free editions for every reader during a major music and digital event in a large Southern state. 
 

Here’s how it stands for artists and writers now. They make a digital comic book and take it to a publisher, who miraculously agrees to publish it:

Apple or Google take 30%
The distributor takes 50% of what’s left – 35%
The publisher takes 50% of the remaining 35% – 17.5%
The writer and artist split the remaining 17.5%, receiving 8.75% each.
8.75% of $2.99 is $0.26, and that’s just not enough.
Make no mistake -- this campaign is a direct resopnse to comiXology's growing monopoly.
Comics Thing will make it possible for artists, writers and indies to publish their own comics, and receive enough from the sale price to make it worth making more.
 
How will my money help?
Your money will help makers produce more and better comics for the whole comics community.

Isn’t there already an iTunes of comic books and graphic novels?
No. I know the reader you’re talking about, but it doesn’t let me read my CBZ and PDF comics. And they charge indie publishers and makers 50%. That’s 50% of 70%, after Apple’s take. As a maker, I can’t include videos in my comics, despite the cost. And they have editorial control over what I can publish and how I’ll sell it.
That’s not how I envision an iTunes of comics.
 
Did you say downloadable files for 3D printers?
Yeah, it’s a cool idea, isn’t it? Lots of print mags and (mostly non-English) comics have cover-mount freebies. I think files for 3D printers are the new swag.
 
Who are you?
Dr Charles Kriel (that’s me – the guy writing this). By day, I help entertainment companies dream up cool new games, programs and toys. By night, I’m a writer, musician, photographer, DJ and game designer. I’ll lead the Comics Thing team.
 
Why do you want to build Comics Thing?
Comic book and graphic novel publishing should be in the hands of artists, writers, indies and readers. I’ve written a few books, but I want to self-publish my graphic novels. There are tools out there, but I honestly either can’t afford them, or can’t live with splitting the profits 50 / 50 with a software developer.
And I want to include video, audio and live feeds in my books. I want an in-app browser with links. And I want it to be as technically easy to make a comic as using PowerPoint.
So I’m building Comics Thing, and then I’m releasing it open source.

 (photo: Glenn Fabry, The Preacher cover illustrator)
 
Why IndieGoGo?
I’ve worked with half of the Big Six publishing houses, and a couple of them have asked if I need money to build Comics Thing. I’ve heard the same from a couple independents. In every case, I’ve asked them to wait – let me try to crowdfund this first – I don’t want Comics Thing controlled by a couple of big companies.
In the 19th century, publishing was in the hands of writers, artists, indies and readers. That’s where it belongs in the 21st.
 
Are you the little guy fighting the good fight?
I hope so. When I’m not writing stories or making games, I travel to emerging democracies consulting free press startup news outfits, helping them keep their doors open, training journalists and photographers. In the last six months, I’ve worked in Tbilisi and Kosovo with journalists from Albania, Azerbaijan, Armenia, Serbia and Kosovo.
 
Are you qualified to do this?
Yes. I conceptualize and produce games and apps for a living, and in the last few years, I’ve worked on projects for the BBC, Disney, Aardman (who make Wallace & Gromit), FremantleMedia (The X Factor), ABC (US), UNESCO, Random House, CBC, Tate Britain, the Royal Ontario Museum, Mercedes Benz and lots of others. Many have won awards, including Emmys. I have a PhD from St Martins. You can check the bona fides on LinkedIn.
 
Are you doing this alone?
Not at all. I don’t think anyone could. Through my apps and games, I work with some of the best coders and designers in Europe, the US and Canada – most of the money will go to paying them for their hard work.
This campaign has support from indie writers, artists and publishers. We’ve had publicity and swag boosts along the way from indie publisher Markosia, indie distributor UK Comics and UK on Display, V for Vendetta illustrator David Lloyd, Resonance FM’s Alex Fitch and a lot of folks at comics conventions – not to mention the cosplayers.
We expect to add more bloggers, publishers, writers, artists and supporters – and more rewards! – so keep an eye out here.
 
Is that all the swag you got?
Stand back and watch while we bring it.
The swag has just begun. We'll announce more every week.
Once we reach our funding goal, we'll announce a number of very limited but very special prizes from our favorite artists (whose pictures might be on this page), writers and publishers. Keep an eye out, but please help us hit our goal as well.

Yes, in four ways.
First, you can spread the word and help Comics Thing get funded.
Second, by contributing $30 or more, you’ll get access to a private forums where you’ll hear the latest developments, and can input your ideas, criticisms, and compliments.
If you’re a cracking coder or designer, we want to know about your work so we can try to find a way to make you part of the team.
And finally, when we go Open Source, you can work to build on the foundations our team will lay.
 

 
After we send out all the cool swag -- some of which has been donated or seriously discounted by artists, writers and indies -- we'll spend almost all of the money making Comics Thing. Most of that will go to paying the salaries of hard-working coders and designers. We won't pay for bricks and mortar. We won't rake profits. story:
Es un pequeño ebook recopilando 32 tiras cómicas, sin texto, que retratan con mucho humor, diferentes estados de ánimo, de la mente y del corazón por los que he pasado antes y a la hora de meditar.

No sé si todos los meditadores del mundo pasan por los mismos estados, lo que sí sé es que yo no soy un meditador perfecto, a veces me siento a meditar con el corazón hecho bolas, con la cabeza al revés, lleno de ira, sumido en la tristeza o con una deliciosa alegría, nunca es igual, es cierto que entre más medito más ecuánime es mi mente, pero en mis primeros años de meditar y en mis momentos de mayor caos, me siento como una bomba a punto de explotar o Hulk cuando me siento a meditar y es hasta que las cosas se acomodan durante la meditación que Juan se puede levantar del zafu mucho más en paz de como llegó.

Eso es lo que retrata el libro, el día a día de una práctica de meditación diaria, a la que me llevo lo que sea que traiga puesto en el corazón y el cerebro ese día.

La intención del libro es que te diviertas ojeándolo, que las imágenes te ayuden a reflexionar y con suerte, te inspiren a meditar más si ya lo haces o que te inviten a probarlo por primera vez.

No es un ebook con el chiste de moda, no tiene muñequitos manga, no tiene mujeres con senos enormes ni hombres musculosos, no tiene perros ni gatos, lo que sí tiene son garabatos divertidos, inteligentes y llenos de esa cosa que la vida te da cuando tienes casi 40 años de vida  y la mitad de ellos meditando…experiencia de vida.

Todo el trabajo ya está hecho, el libro ya está dibujado completo y está en proceso de formación para imprenta en manos de un querido amigo y alumno que generosamente está aportando su tiempo y conocimiento al proyecto, sin una lana de por medio.

¿Cómo voy a utilizar el dinero?

En cuanto Diego termine de formar el libro y el objetivo de aportaciones esté cumplido, mandaremos a imprimir 100 libros tamaño media carta y unas 2 semanas después tendremos los libros listos en nuestras manos para comenzar a entregar las recompensas físicas y hacer una presentación con musiquita, café y charla.

¿Por qué solo 100? Quiero tener 100 lectores reales, de corazón y a quienes pueda decirles “gracias” 1 a 1,  en vez de 1000 posibilidades de lectores en mi closet en una caja cerrada, esperando a que me convierta en un rockstar de la meditación o la ilustración.

Acerca del creador:

Mi nombre es Juan Silva alias kidbuda, soy conciencia infinita teniendo una experiencia humana…y mi experiencia humana es la de un melómano feliz,ilustrador, tatuador, fan del café, el cine, el silencio, el minimalismo, la filosofía zen,el budismo tibetano, taoísmo y la visión de los nativos americanos.

Practico meditación zen,budismo, reiki, artes marciales chinos internos, boxeo y yoga.. ¿Cómo le hago? Duermo poco y no veo la TV :).

¿Cómo y cuándo se entregarán las recompensas?

Las recompensas digitales se entregarán 24 horas despúés de que hagas tu aportación, las recompensas físicas, las comenzaremos a agendar 2 semanas después de que el libro entre a impresión, te notificaré vía correo electrónico cuando esté en camino tu recompensa y la forma de entrega.

¿Cuáles son los riesgos del proyecto?

Realmente casi ninguno, digo puede pasar que la imprenta cierre o tenga un accidente grave mientras imprimen el libro o una tormenta inunde mi casa y se mojen, pero fuera de los riesgos normales de la vida, no creo que el proyecto tenga otros.

story:
Thank You to all who Shared, told someone, contributed, and supported however you supported!!!! New Stretch goals added, lets keep pushing!! Keep spreading the word!!!  @ Stretch Goals have been reached!!!!! Let's keep pushing!! the 3rd goal can be reached with a special bonus to be announced!!!!!



The Reason(s)

My Name is wOlly McNair. I am a freelance illustrator and graphic designer from Charlotte NC.  I have worked on various projects as a character concept artist, designer, layout artist, story board artist, doing sequential pages, art shows, art books, tutorial art, and more. I am appreciative of even being able to say that I do things that I love for a living, but nothing brings greater joy than working against the odds to bring your own projects to life. I did a project for my book Legend of the Black Pandas last year, it wasn't completely funded, but every penny contributed helped to bring the book to life.  So this year I am back doing a campaign that holds a deeper place for me. This one is for my project Fairy Tale Knights. A story about Malia, the youngest, and most powerful knight in the Order of the Red Hoods, an organization of mostly female knights that protect the main regions of the Land of Imagination. Malia has a best friend, partner, and familiar named Patrick, who is a wolf. He protects her, though she would say she protects him lol, and together they work under the Order of Grannies to protect the Book of Tales which exist to protect the fairy tales and fables most grew up knowing and have possibly shared with their kids. This is a revised take on the classic core of fairy tales, red riding hood, a land of magic, knights, kingdoms, and a Book of Tales. All being illustrated by me with a story written by Jerale Clebourne, based off of my ideas, will come as a 100 page graphic novel in full color telling the tale of Malia and Patrick's adventures in the Land.....

Your support would not only help bring this completed story to life in print form, but it would help bring a super smile to my daughters Malia's face. See, the main character is named after, and modeled after my little girl, so for her seeing this all come to life has meant the world to her for many reasons.... 

The main reasons I began work on this book a while back was to create something for my little girl. Something with her namesake at first, then it blossomed into something more. I wanted her to be able to see a strong female character, but she wanted to see one that looked like her. She loves the DC and Marvel super ladies, and enjoys seeing them, but at 4 years old, she asked why most of the characters didn't look like her. The skin, the hair, etc. Same with her Barbies, at least the most shown and spoken of ones. So after a little father daughter chat, I made a decision. Why not rework the character and make it something she could and many other little girls could relate to. So I did, note the pic above. When she saw the designs, she had the hugest smile, making me the "bestest dad ever" lol.

Now with that said, I still wanted to make sure this was a good book. I wanted people to be into the story simply because it was a good story. So my goal became to give my daughter and other little girls something new to enjoy and relate to, while still making a book that an adult could pick up and dig for the story and art like many comics and graphic novels of today.  I wanted it to be a book that a parent could share with a young child, but also be a story that they an adult could pick up and enjoy for themselves.  So I partnered with a good friend and great writer Jerale Clebourne, to take my ideas and doodles, and make an epic tale!!





    Where it goes and how it happens...



    So my set goal is $1200. That's not a ton of money, but it is a ton of money at the same time. Every dime raised will go towards the cost to produce this book in softcover, full color, with a minimum of 100 pages in it. Once the funding is complete I may be able to slide a few more pages in as extras, but currently, at the least, it will be 100 pages of story. No ads, no promo for other books, just story and art.  Of course a percentage of any funds raised with also help cover the cost for some of the perks, but the over all with simply be to make the book happen, male my little girl smile, and show her that dreams and ideas can become reality.  Of course  I want to meet my goal, if not raise more, and do additional things like a hard cover version, but if I don't, the show doesn't stop there. As with my project before this, whatever isn't raised, I will figure out funding, and complete what is needed to make this book happen. I believe in the book, and at the end of the day, it is my job to be the example to my little ones, not anyone elses. So whatever i need to do to make this a reality, i will work to do, your support just makes it a little easier lol.... So on to the perks!!

    Perks are wide in price and range. I wanted to include as many options as I could thin of, so I asked people what they would like to see, and added some tried and tested things as well.
    First and foremost the book itself. The first volume is called:
    Fairy Tale Knights: The Book of Tales
    This book will be a 100 page soft cover in full color. (Hard Cover may become a future option)


     
    Options range from Custom Vinyls figures from my books, (samples of figures)



    ...to original pages from the book... (examples of possible page options)

    ...to tee shirts... (color options may vary)



    and even options for original art....



    The Impact
    So why should you support this project!?!  Well the simple reason is hopefully because you like it!! In honesty, I have my reasons for doing this book, but those reasons may not be why YOU support this project. People support things for different reasons, you may like the story, you may like the art, you may like the characters, or you may just want to support to put a smile on my little girls face from seeing the support. You may support simply relate to the reasons I did this, or whatever many other reasons. Whatever the case, I will appreciate you. I don't take for granted how important support is, and every ounce of support I receive means the world to me.  I thank you for even reading all this, looking at these pictures, or telling anyone else that this is happening. Your time is appreciated. I hope in some form or another you do support this campaign, I mean if you read this far, then you have already giving your attention if nothing. (but feel free to spread the word some more and maybe a little support in the area of selecting a perk if you can lol!!)


    Other Ways You Can Help

    I understand money is.... well money. You work hard for it, and this project may not be your cup of tea. But that doesn't mean someone you know, in real life or virtual, couldn't feel different. Please, spread the word to who ever you can, even if you feel they aren't into this type stuff, you never know. They may still support, or tell someone else about it who will. Everything helps. Word of mouth can bring attention that gives new platforms do to who information reaches. So please don't think that money has to be the only way to help. Let someone know who doesn't know, and remind some who do that this is happening and support in all forms goes a long way!!

I am a freelance illustrator and graphic designer from Charlotte NC.  I have worked on various projects as a character concept artist, designer, layout artist, story board artist, doing sequential pages, art shows, art books, tutorial art, and more. I am appreciative of even being able to say that I do things that I love for a living, but nothing brings greater joy than working against the odds to bring your own projects to life. I did a project for my book Legend of the Black Pandas last year, it wasn't completely funded, but every penny contributed helped to bring the book to life.  So this year I am back doing a campaign that holds a deeper place for me. This one is for my project Fairy Tale Knights. A story about Malia, the youngest, and most powerful knight in the Order of the Red Hoods, an organization of mostly female knights that protect the main regions of the Land of Imagination. Malia has a best friend, partner, and familiar named Patrick, who is a wolf. He protects her, though she would say she protects him lol, and together they work under the Order of Grannies to protect the Book of Tales which exist to protect the fairy tales and fables most grew up knowing and have possibly shared with their kids. This is a revised take on the classic core of fairy tales, red riding hood, a land of magic, knights, kingdoms, and a Book of Tales. All being illustrated by me with a story written by Jerale Clebourne, based off of my ideas, will come as a 100 page graphic novel in full color telling the tale of Malia and Patrick's adventures in the Land..... 
Your support would not only help bring this completed story to life in print form, but it would help bring a super smile to my daughters Malia's face. See, the main character is named after, and modeled after my little girl, so for her seeing this all come to life has meant the world to her for many reasons....  
The main reasons I began work on this book a while back was to create something for my little girl. Something with her namesake at first, then it blossomed into something more. I wanted her to be able to see a strong female character, but she wanted to see one that looked like her. She loves the DC and Marvel super ladies, and enjoys seeing them, but at 4 years old, she asked why most of the characters didn't look like her. The skin, the hair, etc. Same with her Barbies, at least the most shown and spoken of ones. So after a little father daughter chat, I made a decision. Why not rework the character and make it something she could and many other little girls could relate to. So I did, note the pic above. When she saw the designs, she had the hugest smile, making me the "bestest dad ever" lol. 
Now with that said, I still wanted to make sure this was a good book. I wanted people to be into the story simply because it was a good story. So my goal became to give my daughter and other little girls something new to enjoy and relate to, while still making a book that an adult could pick up and dig for the story and art like many comics and graphic novels of today.  I wanted it to be a book that a parent could share with a young child, but also be a story that they an adult could pick up and enjoy for themselves.  So I partnered with a good friend and great writer Jerale Clebourne, to take my ideas and doodles, and make an epic tale!! 



     Where it goes and how it happens...



So my set goal is $1200. That's not a ton of money, but it is a ton of money at the same time. Every dime raised will go towards the cost to produce this book in softcover, full color, with a minimum of 100 pages in it. Once the funding is complete I may be able to slide a few more pages in as extras, but currently, at the least, it will be 100 pages of story. No ads, no promo for other books, just story and art.  Of course a percentage of any funds raised with also help cover the cost for some of the perks, but the over all with simply be to make the book happen, male my little girl smile, and show her that dreams and ideas can become reality.  Of course  I want to meet my goal, if not raise more, and do additional things like a hard cover version, but if I don't, the show doesn't stop there. As with my project before this, whatever isn't raised, I will figure out funding, and complete what is needed to make this book happen. I believe in the book, and at the end of the day, it is my job to be the example to my little ones, not anyone elses. So whatever i need to do to make this a reality, i will work to do, your support just makes it a little easier lol.... So on to the perks!!Perks are wide in price and range. I wanted to include as many options as I could thin of, so I asked people what they would like to see, and added some tried and tested things as well. First and foremost the book itself. The first volume is called: Fairy Tale Knights: The Book of TalesThis book will be a 100 page soft cover in full color. (Hard Cover may become a future option) 
 Options range from Custom Vinyls figures from my books, (samples of figures)







...to original pages from the book... (examples of possible page options)


...to tee shirts... (color options may vary)





and even options for original art....



The Impact
So why should you support this project!?!  Well the simple reason is hopefully because you like it!! In honesty, I have my reasons for doing this book, but those reasons may not be why YOU support this project. People support things for different reasons, you may like the story, you may like the art, you may like the characters, or you may just want to support to put a smile on my little girls face from seeing the support. You may support simply relate to the reasons I did this, or whatever many other reasons. Whatever the case, I will appreciate you. I don't take for granted how important support is, and every ounce of support I receive means the world to me.  I thank you for even reading all this, looking at these pictures, or telling anyone else that this is happening. Your time is appreciated. I hope in some form or another you do support this campaign, I mean if you read this far, then you have already giving your attention if nothing. (but feel free to spread the word some more and maybe a little support in the area of selecting a perk if you can lol!!)
 


  Other Ways You Can HelpI understand money is.... well money. You work hard for it, and this project may not be your cup of tea. But that doesn't mean someone you know, in real life or virtual, couldn't feel different. Please, spread the word to who ever you can, even if you feel they aren't into this type stuff, you never know. They may still support, or tell someone else about it who will. Everything helps. Word of mouth can bring attention that gives new platforms do to who information reaches. So please don't think that money has to be the only way to help. Let someone know who doesn't know, and remind some who do that this is happening and support in all forms goes a long way!!

story:
Hackerstrip Volume-1

 Real Stories Real Hackers

First ever comic book based on the internet security industry!

Hackers Rejoice! You now have a new comic book that depicts your life as you experience it. 100% original, gritty, nail biting, heart racing 200 pages of complete action, hacker style; inspired by real security incidents and research work. If you’re in the Internet security industry, this will be the coolest comic book to own. Chock full of stories gleaned from real life incidents involving real hackers, this comic book approach to presenting case studies makes learning about and sharing major hacking quests more fun than ever before.


Why are we creating Hackerstrip Comics?

Because we think hackers are hugely misrepresented in popular media. People are often shown the dark side of hacking and think it's something far removed from their lives. But what if we showed real hackers as themselves doing what they do on a daily basis? Just everyday people called upon to do extraordinary things? What if we showed them that real life superheroes don't wear a cape and are just as real as you and me? Written and illustrated by the Hackerstrip team, the Hackerstrip comic book offers a glimpse into the world of Internet security as you've never seen it before. The techniques illustrated involve some of the most cutting-edge recent incidents in the security industry and they closely parallel the real world scenarios they depict. Detailed, practical and up-to-date, we want the Hackerstrip comic book to be the coolest thing you can have on your desk.

(The way we see it, Hackers are real life heroes and villains so the next
logical step is to have is a comic book about ourselves that can explain how we work and illustrate why we do what we do in a fun way. We founded Hackerstrip.com as a way to bring quality, realistic comic strip style stories of hackers into the limelight. The best thing about us? Free comic strips on our Website www.hackerstrip.com)

What are the highlights of Hackerstrip Comics?

For one thing, at Hackerstrip comics, we keep it real. We have zero interest in embellishment, so we strive to keep our stories real and as much to the point as possible. This helps us make comic book stories that are both gripping and filled with knowledge at the same time. We take a lot of care to ensure our story lines mirror the actual work flow of security researchers and real life hackers. So, our motto is to keep it as real as possible. Also our artwork is modern, the illustrations are almost real life depictions. This way, our core base of buyers and followers will be seasoned Internet security experts/ hackers and Hackerstrip comics will be entertaining as well as interesting to follow.


What does our first volume include?

Lots of interesting Internet security incidents and scenarios stories researched and contributed by our team. We’ve included some of them below so you can have a glimpse into the book before its fully done!

Some of the stories in Hackerstrip Volume.1

  • Timbuktu incident
  • Fuzzy realities
  • High finance
  • The Dark Cloud
  • Heart bleed saga
  • Mr.Xylit0l
  • The Brain virus
  • SilkR0ad
  • Inside TOR - struggle for anonymity

Pages from issue 1

Pages from issue 1



Here’s our plan

We need your support to raise $10,000 to make this book happen. These funds will be used to produce more episodes and to print the hard copies of the book. We're aiming to have this out by August 2015!

The 200 page comic book will be printed in beautiful full color on 90g/m2 illustration paper and will be bound in softcover. The dimensions of the book are 17cm by 22cm (6 1/2" by 8 1/2").

Free Shipping Worldwide on all orders


These are the only comics available on hacking and security, so invest in a chance to be involved in a project worthy of a hackers and security industry attention. Grab the chance while you can and drop us a line if you have any questions:

raak@hackerstrip.com

http://hackerstrip.com/hackerstrip.asc





Pages from Issue 3


      Page 2

story:
Funding Goals

EDIT: This campaign has now closed. Thank you so much for your support! If you'd like to make a contribution to help support the webcomic, consider subscribing on Patreon to help us reach new milestones and also unlock exclusive bonus content!

I am able to print as many or as few copies as needed. Thanks to Indiegogo's flexible funding, that means regardless of whether we reach our funding goal, everyone who pays for a copy of the book will receive one. However, if we do reach our funding goal or any of our stretch goals, there are a few extras that will be added as well!

UNLOCKED!!  $500 - Ine's Prank
Dil stuck an embarrassing photo of Ine in the back of each copy of Book 1. And now, it's payback time! Help Ine deliver Dil's comeuppance when we reach the book's campaign goal!

UNLOCKED!!  $750 - Updated Book 1 Cover
When I send Book 2 off to the printer, I'll also be reprinting a few copies of Book 1. If we reach this first stretch goal, we'll give it a bit of a face-lift first by updating the cover art to make it more consistent with the second book. Everyone who orders a copy of Book 1 through this campaign will get the updated version!

$1,000 - Backers Q&A Page
At this level, all backers will get the chance to submit questions to the characters in the comic, who will pick and answer them on an exclusive Backers Q&A Page that will be added to the book!

$1,500 - 1 Page Bonus Story
At this funding level, an extra story will be added to the book!  In addition, all backers will get the opportunity to vote on which character this bonus story will focus on.  Want to see more of a main character like June, Mally, or Chris? Or maybe you'd like to learn more about one of the secondary characters in the comic? Whoever backers choose, an exclusive one page story about them will be added to the book.  Want more than one page?  Well...

$2,500 - 3 Page Bonus Story
...at this next level the bonus story that was unlocked will be expanded to three pages!  Still not enough?  Hmm...

$3,000 - 5 Page Bonus Story
Then how about five pages!  The character chosen by the backers will get an entire chapter of new material!  Phew... that's going to be about as much as I can handle before sending the final version of the book off to be printed.  But what if we surpass even this lofty goal?

??? - Secret Goal!
This stretch goal will be revealed when we reach $1,000 in funding!

Perks

EDIT: This campaign has now entered InDemand. This means that even though the campaign has ended, you can still make contributions to help support it. Some of the rewards below are no longer available, such as a spot on the site's Thank You page and the book's Feathered Friend's page. When choosing a perk, please read carefully to see what's included. If you would like to make a contribution to help support the webcomic and also receive recognition on the site's Thank You page, or even as a cameo in the comic, consider subscribing on Patreon to help us reach new milestones and also unlock exclusive bonus content! Or to make a one-time donation, leave a tip on my ko-fi page!

To thank you for supporting Aww, Feathers!, backers will receive the following rewards based on their pledge amount:

$1 - Eager Egg
Thank you for your support! All backers who pledge at least $1 will have their name added to the website's Thank You page (if they choose).

$10 - Pixel Pupper
Minimalist, eh? It's cool! I'll hook you up with a DRM-free PDF version of Book 2 that you can read on whatever newfangled device the kids are using these days!

$15 - Digital Doggo
Wanna complete your digital Aww, Feathers! collection? Get Books 1 & 2 as DRM-free PDFs.

$20 - Learned Lizard
Get your physical copy of the book! Includes all pages from the webcomic chapters Game Day through Working Things Out in full color, as well as any bonus pages unlocked by our stretch goals! Each copy will be signed and numbered by me and include a complimentary sketch on the inside front cover of an Aww, Feathers! character of your choice. Also includes the PDF version.

$30 - Feathered Friend
In addition to a digital and physical copy of the book, your name and portrait will appear on the book's "Feathered Friends" page to show off your stellar support for the comic! The portrait may be a photo or drawing you provide, or for an additional fee you can commission me to draw your face after the style of the comic. I'll contact you about the details after the campaign ends.

$45 - Devoted Dolphin
Did you miss out on your chance to get the first book? Now's your chance! Get a digital and physical copy of both books, as well as your spot on the Feathered Friends page!

$50 - Artsy Avian
Back in 2016 and 2017 I released a monthly Aww, Feathers! themed postcard exclusively for Patreon backers. Now's your chance to get the whole collection! Send them to friends, or keep them as miniature art prints! Choose either the 2016 or the 2017 collection to be included with your physical and digital copy of Book 2.
Use the links below to preview the postcard designs:
2016 Collection
2017 Collection

$60 - Collecting Corvid
Can't decide on which postcard collection you want? Choose this option to receive all twenty-four exclusive Aww, Feathers! themed postcards with your book!

$75 - Hoarding Hawk
For those who really love collecting things, how about digital and physical copies of both books and both collections of postcards! (You decide where to put them all.)

$100 - VIP (Very Important Pancock)
In addition to everything in the Hoarding Hawk level, you and other VIP backers will get a special backstage pass to hangout and chat with the me while I work on an upcoming page of the comic, live! See the creative process from start to finish!

$200 - Distinguished Dragon
Want to own a unique piece of Aww, Feathers! history?! Our daring team of archaeologists have unearthed a rare treasure: the first drawing tablet I ever owned, and the one I used to create the first pages of Aww, Feathers! Using a sophisticated method of carbon dating, our experts have determined this to be a Wacom Intuos 3. Please note, there is no guarantee that this thing actually still works! If you want to try it out, be my guest. Otherwise, it's intended to be a collector's item only. I'll even draw a character sketch of your choice on the surface. No, that's not defacement, it's enhancement! There's only one of these, so get it before it's gone! (VIP Package included with this perk.)

Digital Art

I'm open for commissoins during the campaign! If you'd like an original piece of digital art along with your chosen perk, contact me at awwfeathers@gmail.com about creating a custom perk package that consists of one of the options to the right, plus an extra amount for an art commission. This will reserve your commission slot, which will be completed in the order received after the campaign ends. Commissions ordered in this way will contribute towards the campaign goal and stretch goals!

  • $5 - Full Body Sketch
  • $10 - Full Body Inked
  • $20 - Head or Bust Shot Colored
  • $30 - Full Body Colored
  • Something else in mind? Just ask!

The prices above are per character with limited props against a simple or abstract background. More complex pieces may incur an additional cost. I'll discuss the details with you after I receive your pledge (make sure your email address is correct). Also note that all art commissions must be safe for work (SFW) and are subject to the terms on my commissions page.

Do You AWU?!

Are you going to Anthro Weekend Utah this year? Let me know after making your pledge, and then stop by and see me at table #9 in the Dealer's Den on August 10th or 11th to pick up your book and other perks before anyone else! (If you don't come pick them up, they'll be shipped to you as normal.)

The Impact of your Pledge

Recently I've had some extra time to work on this book as well as new pages for awwfeathers.com, which has been great! I love telling these stories! And your support can allow me to continue doing so. There are plenty more stories to tell. After paying Indiegogo's fee, payment processing fees, and the cost of printing and shipping the books and other perks, anything leftover will go towards supporting the webcomic, including the cost of hosting, registration, supplies and equipment, etc. The more we raise, the more time I'll be able to dedicate to the comic in coming months.

By supporting Aww, Feathers!, you show your support for entertainment that is fun, family friendly, and that addresses topics in an honest and approachable way, even sometimes sensitive ones like trials, relationships, and religion.

Risks & Challenges

Printing and shipping rewards from the campaign for Book 1 went quite well, and I've learned a lot since then, so I don't anticipate any major problems. My goal is to have the book finalized and printed by Anthro Weekend Utah, August 10-11, 2018. It's possible I could miss that goal, but if so, I don't see it being delayed by more than a few weeks at most. And again, I can order as many or as few books as I need, so I see no reason why I couldn't fulfill every order.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every pledge, big and small, makes a big difference. In addition, there are other ways you can support Aww, Feathers!

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family!  Seriously, a personal recommendation is one of the best ways to spread the word.
  • If you haven't already, read the comic at awwfeathers.com!  It updates every Tuesday (including during this campaign).
  • Follow Aww, Feathers! on Facebook, twitter, or Instagram.
  • If you'd like to support Aww, Feathers! on an ongoing basis and receive cool extras like exclusive artwork and works in progress of each page, subscribe on Patreon!
  • Or, to make a one-time donation, leave me a tip on my ko-fi page!

Q & A

Q: What's the premise of the comic?
A: Aww, Feathers! is a slice-of-life comic, meaning it shares everyday experiences from the lives of the characters. It features a variety of characters, all based on animals, and follows their life through college and beyond. The tone is meant to be light-hearted and often humorous, but occasionally serious and thought-provoking.

Q: Is this comic family friendly?
A: Yes! While the intended audience is probably teen and up, my goal is for the entire comic series to be safe for anyone to enjoy. It's rated All Ages or probably about a PG rating.

Q: Is this an LDS comic?
A: Not exclusively. I am a member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints (aka "Mormon" or "LDS"), and occasional mention is made of the Church and Mormon culture. Several characters are members of the Church, and it is a very large part of their lives. However, not every story arc deals with LDS or even religious topics, and overall the comic is intended for a general audience. Mormon or not, religious or not, I think everyone can find something they can relate to.

Q: Why animal characters instead of humans?
A: There are a few reasons. I like animals and they're fun to draw. And with a nearly endless variety to choose from, coming up with new and unique characters is also easier and lots of fun. But it's also somewhat of an analogy. Many of the characters are so different in species. Sometimes this causes tension or awkwardness, but often they learn to get along. Shouldn't we be the same?

Q: Are the stories based on real events?
A: Many of them are. In fact, quite a few of the story arcs are based on my own personal experiences. A lot of the details are different however and some of the events are entirely fictional or only loosely based on reality.

Q: What are the dimensions of the printed version?
A: The book measures 7" x 10.5" and is currently 70 pages. Depending on what stretch goals are met however, a few more pages may be added.

Q: Will any of the bonus material ever be posted online?
A: Maybe someday, but if so it won't be until at least a year or two after the book's release.

Q: Who made the background music for your campaign video?
A: Glad you asked! That song is one track from the Aww, Feathers! Chiptune album by Bradley Korth, which is available on Bandcamp now!

Choose this option to receive all twenty-four exclusive Aww, Feathers! themed postcards with your book!$75 - Hoarding HawkFor those who really love collecting things, how about digital and physical copies of both books and both collections of postcards! (You decide where to put them all.)$100 - VIP (Very Important Pancock)In addition to everything in the Hoarding Hawk level, you and other VIP backers will get a special backstage pass to hangout and chat with the me while I work on an upcoming page of the comic, live! See the creative process from start to finish!$200 - Distinguished DragonWant to own a unique piece of Aww, Feathers! history?! Our daring team of archaeologists have unearthed a rare treasure: the first drawing tablet I ever owned, and the one I used to create the first pages of Aww, Feathers! Using a sophisticated method of carbon dating, our experts have determined this to be a Wacom Intuos 3. Please note, there is no guarantee that this thing actually still works! If you want to try it out, be my guest. Otherwise, it's intended to be a collector's item only. I'll even draw a character sketch of your choice on the surface. No, that's not defacement, it's enhancement! There's only one of these, so get it before it's gone! (VIP Package included with this perk.)Digital ArtI'm open for commissoins during the campaign! If you'd like an original piece of digital art along with your chosen perk, contact me at awwfeathers@gmail.com about creating a custom perk package that consists of one of the options to the right, plus an extra amount for an art commission. This will reserve your commission slot, which will be completed in the order received after the campaign ends. Commissions ordered in this way will contribute towards the campaign goal and stretch goals!
$5 - Full Body Sketch
$10 - Full Body Inked
$20 - Head or Bust Shot Colored
$30 - Full Body Colored
Something else in mind? Just ask!
The prices above are per character with limited props against a simple or abstract background. More complex pieces may incur an additional cost. I'll discuss the details with you after I receive your pledge (make sure your email address is correct). Also note that all art commissions must be safe for work (SFW) and are subject to the terms on my commissions page.Do You AWU?!Are you going to Anthro Weekend Utah this year? Let me know after making your pledge, and then stop by and see me at table #9 in the Dealer's Den on August 10th or 11th to pick up your book and other perks before anyone else! (If you don't come pick them up, they'll be shipped to you as normal.)The Impact of your PledgeRecently I've had some extra time to work on this book as well as new pages for awwfeathers.com, which has been great! I love telling these stories! And your support can allow me to continue doing so. There are plenty more stories to tell. After paying Indiegogo's fee, payment processing fees, and the cost of printing and shipping the books and other perks, anything leftover will go towards supporting the webcomic, including the cost of hosting, registration, supplies and equipment, etc. The more we raise, the more time I'll be able to dedicate to the comic in coming months.By supporting Aww, Feathers!, you show your support for entertainment that is fun, family friendly, and that addresses topics in an honest and approachable way, even sometimes sensitive ones like trials, relationships, and religion.Risks & ChallengesPrinting and shipping rewards from the campaign for Book 1 went quite well, and I've learned a lot since then, so I don't anticipate any major problems. My goal is to have the book finalized and printed by Anthro Weekend Utah, August 10-11, 2018. It's possible I could miss that goal, but if so, I don't see it being delayed by more than a few weeks at most. And again, I can order as many or as few books as I need, so I see no reason why I couldn't fulfill every order.Other Ways You Can HelpEvery pledge, big and small, makes a big difference. In addition, there are other ways you can support Aww, Feathers!
Share this campaign with your friends and family!  Seriously, a personal recommendation is one of the best ways to spread the word.
If you haven't already, read the comic at awwfeathers.com!  It updates every Tuesday (including during this campaign).
Follow Aww, Feathers! on Facebook, twitter, or Instagram.
If you'd like to support Aww, Feathers! on an ongoing basis and receive cool extras like exclusive artwork and works in progress of each page, subscribe on Patreon!
Or, to make a one-time donation, leave me a tip on my ko-fi page!
Q & AQ: What's the premise of the comic?A: Aww, Feathers! is a slice-of-life comic, meaning it shares everyday experiences from the lives of the characters. It features a variety of characters, all based on animals, and follows their life through college and beyond. The tone is meant to be light-hearted and often humorous, but occasionally serious and thought-provoking.Q: Is this comic family friendly?A: Yes! While the intended audience is probably teen and up, my goal is for the entire comic series to be safe for anyone to enjoy. It's rated All Ages or probably about a PG rating.Q: Is this an LDS comic?A: Not exclusively. I am a member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints (aka "Mormon" or "LDS"), and occasional mention is made of the Church and Mormon culture. Several characters are members of the Church, and it is a very large part of their lives. However, not every story arc deals with LDS or even religious topics, and overall the comic is intended for a general audience. Mormon or not, religious or not, I think everyone can find something they can relate to.Q: Why animal characters instead of humans?A: There are a few reasons. I like animals and they're fun to draw. And with a nearly endless variety to choose from, coming up with new and unique characters is also easier and lots of fun. But it's also somewhat of an analogy. Many of the characters are so different in species. Sometimes this causes tension or awkwardness, but often they learn to get along. Shouldn't we be the same?Q: Are the stories based on real events?A: Many of them are. In fact, quite a few of the story arcs are based on my own personal experiences. A lot of the details are different however and some of the events are entirely fictional or only loosely based on reality.Q: What are the dimensions of the printed version?A: The book measures 7" x 10.5" and is currently 70 pages. Depending on what stretch goals are met however, a few more pages may be added.Q: Will any of the bonus material ever be posted online?A: Maybe someday, but if so it won't be until at least a year or two after the book's release.Q: Who made the background music for your campaign video?A: Glad you asked! That song is one track from the Aww, Feathers! Chiptune album by Bradley Korth, which is available on Bandcamp now!

story:
Overview

This comic is a passion project for me. I believe in my son's vision so much that I wanted to share with the rest of the world just a small sample of his creativity. We may not set the world on fire but a fire only needs a spark to spread. This is our spark!

Our Goals & What You Can Expect

We are aiming for the story to be 48 pages with more pages for Fan Art and other supplemental content. Hopefully with stretch goals we can add an epilogue that will tie seamlessly into the regular series.

The comic is 85% done pencil and ink wise. My colorists Rajesh is working on getting pages colored.

Funds raised will be going to printing the book and bringing you a high quality comic experience. The interiors will be fully colored.  Any funds raised over our goal will be used to bring you more Pillowman and Blanketboy content in the near future. My son's imagination has no limit so there are many more adventures of Pillowman and Blanketboy to tell!

We have some very cool and unique perks, the likes you have never seen before with any other Indiegogo comic campaign.

Regular Cover

 

 

PAGE ART

 

 

Behind the Idea

Children have insanely wild imaginations and my son Parker is no exception. When he came to me over nine years ago with the original concept of Pillowman and Blanketboy I thought it was just the ravings of a three year old. Boy was I wrong. His ideas and stories have only grown and grown since then. We are excited to share with you PILLOWMAN AND BLANKETBOY: MAXIMUM VELOCITY!

With your help and generosity of funding this book, we will give you a story that you will enjoy for long time and also help us give you more Pillowman and Blanketboy comics in the near future!

Meet the Team

  • My name is Shaun Davis and I am the artist and co-writer for Pillowman and Blanketboy. I am a father who is turning his eleven year old son's ideas into reality. 
  • Parker Davis is an eleven year old and is the brains behind the whole operation and also happens to be a co-writer. Without him there would be no Pillowman and Blanketboy.
  • Rajesh Kumar is a phenomenal colorist and a fantastic person.  There's nothing this guy can't color.  I thank him for making my art look good!

The Impact

We want you to enjoy Pillowman and Blankeboy as much as we do. These stories are for all ages but that doesn’t mean it’s just for kids. Adults will enjoy it as well. Making Pillowman and Blanketboy a household name is something that we hope to do, and with your help we will!

Stretch Goals

We have some exciting things lined up for stretch goals but that depends on you. If you want to get some great stuff we need your help to get us over our goal. After we hit our main goal, stretch goals will be announced!

 

Risks & Challenges

Sadly, if we are unable to complete our campaign goal, we will not let that stop us.  We will retool, learn from our mistakes and come back bigger and better than ever.

Other Ways You Can Help

Lastly, if you are unable to back our campain, we ask that you share our campaign far and wide!

story:
CELEBRATE AMERICAN DEMOCRACY!

America welcomes the 46th President and new Vice President of the United States to office!  Wednesday 1/20/21 a new administration will be sworn in bringing with it new approaches and a number of historic firsts!  Joe Biden and Kamala Harris will take the oath to protect and serve the United States and begin their historic first 100 days.  The opportunity every four years for the people to vote and determine the direction of the country is what makes America so great.  It doesn't matter what side of politics you may support - we all have the same voice in the process and the opportunity to be heard. 

CELEBRATE THE HISTORIC BIDEN & HARRIS INAUGURATION WITH COLLECTIBLE LIMITED EDITION COMICS!

Is there any more exciting program than the one that delivers a truly limited edition collectible that can be the gem of your collection?  This timely edition of Project Superpowers features incredible creative teams, the changing of the guard of heroes, and printed to order rare covers featuring Joe Biden and Kamala Harris alongside the stalwarts of the Project Superpowers universe!

PROJECT SUPERPOWERS #1 JOE BIDEN LIMITED ED COLLECTIBLE COVER

This incredibly limited edition introduces Project Superpowers and a new Commander in Chief in what is sure to be an incredibly rare and hard to find special printing of the first issue of Project Superpowers #1!  Features a story by Alex Ross and Jim Krueger with interior art by Carols Paul and is emblazoned with a Joe Biden commemorative cover by Gordon Purcell! 

"(I promise to be) a president who seeks not to divide but unify, who doesn't see red states and blue states, only sees the United States." - Joe Biden

 

PROJECT SUPERPOWERS VOL 3 #1 KAMALA HARRIS LIMITED ED COLLECTIBLE COVER

Add a true piece of history to your collection with this extremely limited edition collectible cover!  Vice President Kamala Harris is a true trailblazer as she takes office as the first female, first African American, and first South Asian American VP in US history!  This special printing of Project Superpowers Vol 3 #1 features a story by Rob Williams and art by Sergio Davila with with a Kamala Harris commemorative cover by Gordon Purcell!

“My mother would look at me and she’d say, ‘Kamala, you may be the first to do many things, but make sure you are not the last.’ That’s why breaking those barriers is worth it. As much as anything else, it is also to create that path for those who will come after us.”  -Kamala Harris

 

CASH IN WITH COMMEMORATIVE UNITED STATES CURRENCY!

What better way to commemorate the historic US history firsts of Kamala Harris' inauguration as the Vice President than with real collectible currency!  These non-circulated half-dollar coins feature full color images of Joe Biden & Kamala Harris to commemorate the inauguration!  The coins come with a clear protective case, a certificate of authenticity, and a base to display them in your collection!  Don't take any wooden nickels when you can have a real customized fifty cent piece to celebrate these historic firsts:  Kamala Harris - First Female Vice President, first African American VP, and first South Asian American VP! 

Also for consideration are two beautiful commemorative $2 bills featuring Joe Biden & Kamala Harris!  The first is a beautiful team shot of Joe Biden & Kamala Harris commemorating the inauguration of this dynamic team.  And the second is a solo piece focused on Kamala Harris as she breaks barriers and achieves new firsts in American politics!  Both bills come in a protective display sleeve with a full color certificate of authenticity.  Don't fall for any malarkey, this is the real deal!

We are living through history and you can commemorate it now with these incredible collectibles!

story:
My name is Chad Blakely, and I have a story to tell.  I have been writing and illustrating comic books since 2011. Some of my credits include "Kidnapping Kevin Smith" and "The Con Job (Professional Thieves).

I am from Wyoming, born and raised.  This story of corrupt police, gangland violence, and the undercover cop who tried to bring it all down is inspired by true events here in Wyoming.  

If you donate to my campaign, you will be helping me self-publish this book, helping me achieve the dream of sharing my story with the world. 

What We Need & What 

Plain and simple, I need money to get my book printed.  Printing a quality book ain't cheap, so every bit helps!

I appreciate every dollar you can send my way and to prove it, I am offering some pretty cool incentives! Signed comics? check! Signed print? check! Custom made to order artwork? Checkity check CHECK! Me coming to your house to bbq for you and your friends?!? Bet your a$$ CHECK!

The Impact

This story is uniquely relevant to folks from Wyoming and the West, but if TV shows like "Longmire" and movies like "Windriver" can teach us anything, folks are hungry for content set in the Cowboy State!  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate anything, you can still help me out by sharing this campaign and spreading the word! Use the Indiegogo share tools, it's that simple!

Thank you!!!

Thank you!!!

story:
Cos'è BLossom?

BLossom è un volume antologico autoconclusivo, che raccoglie 5 storie yaoi e shonen ai inedite a cura di 6 autrici differenti del collettivo artistico Kyōdai Manga (Irwing Phan, Lumi Niemi, Sayuki Nanaji, Ketsu, Ross1216 & Ivy), più una galleria di illustrazioni a colori (Giulia "Domicipher" Cenci, Enne, Lawrence Wendigo, Elena Toma, Matteo "Dodo" Brizio, Cristina Kokoro, Kanenki e Federica Di Meo). BLossom sarà pubblicato in formato tankōbon (13x18) e consterà di 194 pagine di cui 13 a colori.

Il tema di BLossom è, come si può intuire dal nome, il linguaggio dei fiori: tutte le storie e le illustrazioni sono ispirate a un fiore e al suo significato, creando un vero e proprio mini-dizionario dei fiori dal sapore yaoi/shonen ai. Potete leggerne una preview qui: https://issuu.com/kyoudaimanga/docs/preview-blo... 

Il volume uscirà ufficialmente al Cartoomics 2018 a Milano, dal 9 all'11 marzo. Preacquistando BLossom qui, potrete ritirare la vostra copia direttamente al nostro stand in area self (Padiglione 16, tavolo 58). In alternativa, potete contattare il team Kyōdai Manga per concordare una consegna a mano inviandoci una mail a kyoudaimanga@gmail.com: vi ricontatteremo con una lista precisa di zone in cui è possibile ritirare il volume o eventuali fiere in programma. Per la consegna a mano, selezionate gli specifici perk recanti "CONSEGNA A MANO" nel titolo e non vi saranno addebitati costi aggiuntivi.

UPDATE: i volumi sono pronti!

Storie

Wolf's Song

Possono due spiriti, separati da tempo immemore, incontrarsi di nuovo per vivere il proprio amore? Scopritelo nel segno della rosa rossa, in una storia scritta e illustrata da Lumi Niemi!

Last Breath

Possono coesistere una partenza per vivere il proprio sogno e un amore nato tra le note delle canzoni dei Myosotis, la band in cui Kyle e Darren suonano? La risposta è tra le pagine di Last Breath, storia ispirata al non ti scordar di me scritta da Ivy e illustrata da Ross1216!

Liturgia

Una vita votata alla fede e alla castità può essere ardua, specie quando le tentazioni sono dietro l'angolo, e Gerard e Joseph lo sanno bene... Scritta e disegnata da Ketsu, Liturgia è una storia di peccato e redenzione al profumo di viola.

Bliss Point

A volte uno straordinario a lavoro non è così spiacevole, specialmente se c'è l'opportunità di rimanere da soli col proprio capo... Cosa succederà nella pasticceria di Matt e Fab? Scopritelo in Bliss Point, la dolcissima storia di Irwing Phan ispirata alla mimosa!

My Best Enemy

Può il tuo più acerrimo nemico diventare il tuo amante? Koga, un vampiro, e Lars, un licantropo, si troveranno a fronteggiare questo interrogativo, in una storia al profumo di giunchiglia scritta e illustrata da Sayuki Nanaji!
 

Chi siamo? Cos'è Kyōdai Manga?

Kyōdai Manga è un collettivo di fumettiste nato con l'intento di partecipare a eventi come fiere e presentazioni e di imprimere su carta quelle opere che non avrebbero spazio nelle case editrici. Il collettivo è composto da:

  • Irwing Phan, autrice di Rebel's Identity;
  • Lumi Niemi, autrice di Dirty Waters per Mangasenpai;
  • Sayuki Nanaji, autrice di Tidal Lock per Mangasenpai;
  • Ross1216 e Ivy, autrici di Fr33d0m per Upper Comics;
  • Ketsu, autrice di Deep Green per Reika Manga e Il Noce di Malevento per Kasaobake;
  • Giulia "Domicipher" Cenci, insegnante presso la Lucca Manga School.

Rewards

  • Al raggiungimento dei 200€ rilasceremo una speciale preview di BLossom: https://issuu.com/kyoudaimanga/docs/preview-blo...
  • Al raggiungimento dei 400€ sveleremo l'illustrazione di Kanenki; 
  • Al raggiungimento dei 700€ sveleremo l'illustrazione di Federica di Meo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1B2STb9dlF9oTBL...
  • Al raggiungimento degli 800€ sveleremo l'illustrazione di Matteo Dodo Brizio: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aYl26XcH4s82qQ...
  • Al raggiungimento dei 900€ sveleremo l'illustrazione di Cristina Kokoro: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uRirnm-bPQViaN...

FAQ - Domande e risposte

  • Vorrei ricevere il mio perk per posta, come faccio? Al momento dell'acquisto, seleziona "spedizione in Italia", che ammonterà a 2€ in caso di acquisto del volume e 5€ nel caso di volume + gadget.
  • Come posso fare per ritirare a mano BLossom? Puoi venirci a trovare al Cartoomics 2018 a Milano, oppure concordare preventivamente con noi un ritiro a mano, scrivendo al team all'indirizzo mail kyoudaimanga@gmail.com per avere una lista delle zone in cui questo è possibile. In questo caso seleziona i perk con "CONSEGNA A MANO" nel titolo.
  • Ho acquistato un perk con un contenuto a scelta, come esprimo la mia preferenza? Scrivici una mail all'indirizzo kyoudaimanga@gmail.com! In conclusione della campagna, ci accerteremo che tutti abbiano scelto il proprio gadget, ricontattando eventualmente chi non ha espresso la propria preferenza in precedenza.

Contatti Social

  • Kyōdai Manga: https://www.facebook.com/KyodaiManga/
  • Ketsu: https://www.facebook.com/ketsuofficial/
  • Giulia Domicipher Cenci: https://www.facebook.com/giuliadomicipherart/
  • Ross1216: https://www.facebook.com/ross1216art/
  • Lumi Niemi: https://www.facebook.com/luminiemi93/
  • Sayuki Nanaji: https://www.facebook.com/SayukiNanaji/
  • Irwing Phan: https://www.facebook.com/irwingphan/

StorieWolf's SongPossono due spiriti, separati da tempo immemore, incontrarsi di nuovo per vivere il proprio amore? Scopritelo nel segno della rosa rossa, in una storia scritta e illustrata da Lumi Niemi!Last BreathPossono coesistere una partenza per vivere il proprio sogno e un amore nato tra le note delle canzoni dei Myosotis, la band in cui Kyle e Darren suonano? La risposta è tra le pagine di Last Breath, storia ispirata al non ti scordar di me scritta da Ivy e illustrata da Ross1216!LiturgiaUna vita votata alla fede e alla castità può essere ardua, specie quando le tentazioni sono dietro l'angolo, e Gerard e Joseph lo sanno bene... Scritta e disegnata da Ketsu, Liturgia è una storia di peccato e redenzione al profumo di viola.Bliss PointA volte uno straordinario a lavoro non è così spiacevole, specialmente se c'è l'opportunità di rimanere da soli col proprio capo... Cosa succederà nella pasticceria di Matt e Fab? Scopritelo in Bliss Point, la dolcissima storia di Irwing Phan ispirata alla mimosa!My Best EnemyPuò il tuo più acerrimo nemico diventare il tuo amante? Koga, un vampiro, e Lars, un licantropo, si troveranno a fronteggiare questo interrogativo, in una storia al profumo di giunchiglia scritta e illustrata da Sayuki Nanaji! 
Chi siamo? Cos'è Kyōdai Manga?

Kyōdai Manga è un collettivo di fumettiste nato con l'intento di partecipare a eventi come fiere e presentazioni e di imprimere su carta quelle opere che non avrebbero spazio nelle case editrici. Il collettivo è composto da:


Irwing Phan, autrice di Rebel's Identity;

Lumi Niemi, autrice di Dirty Waters per Mangasenpai;

Sayuki Nanaji, autrice di Tidal Lock per Mangasenpai;

Ross1216 e Ivy, autrici di Fr33d0m per Upper Comics;

Ketsu, autrice di Deep Green per Reika Manga e Il Noce di Malevento per Kasaobake;

Giulia "Domicipher" Cenci, insegnante presso la Lucca Manga School.


Rewards

Al raggiungimento dei 200€ rilasceremo una speciale preview di BLossom: https://issuu.com/kyoudaimanga/docs/preview-blo...

Al raggiungimento dei 400€ sveleremo l'illustrazione di Kanenki; 

Al raggiungimento dei 700€ sveleremo l'illustrazione di Federica di Meo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1B2STb9dlF9oTBL...

Al raggiungimento degli 800€ sveleremo l'illustrazione di Matteo Dodo Brizio: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aYl26XcH4s82qQ...

Al raggiungimento dei 900€ sveleremo l'illustrazione di Cristina Kokoro: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uRirnm-bPQViaN...


FAQ - Domande e risposte


Vorrei ricevere il mio perk per posta, come faccio? Al momento dell'acquisto, seleziona "spedizione in Italia", che ammonterà a 2€ in caso di acquisto del volume e 5€ nel caso di volume + gadget.

Come posso fare per ritirare a mano BLossom? Puoi venirci a trovare al Cartoomics 2018 a Milano, oppure concordare preventivamente con noi un ritiro a mano, scrivendo al team all'indirizzo mail kyoudaimanga@gmail.com per avere una lista delle zone in cui questo è possibile. In questo caso seleziona i perk con "CONSEGNA A MANO" nel titolo.

Ho acquistato un perk con un contenuto a scelta, come esprimo la mia preferenza? Scrivici una mail all'indirizzo kyoudaimanga@gmail.com! In conclusione della campagna, ci accerteremo che tutti abbiano scelto il proprio gadget, ricontattando eventualmente chi non ha espresso la propria preferenza in precedenza.


Contatti Social


Kyōdai Manga: https://www.facebook.com/KyodaiManga/


Ketsu: https://www.facebook.com/ketsuofficial/


Giulia Domicipher Cenci: https://www.facebook.com/giuliadomicipherart/


Ross1216: https://www.facebook.com/ross1216art/


Lumi Niemi: https://www.facebook.com/luminiemi93/


Sayuki Nanaji: https://www.facebook.com/SayukiNanaji/


Irwing Phan: https://www.facebook.com/irwingphan/

story:
Sin Peaks is back and bigger than ever!

We are looking for donations for our opening night/gala fundraiser and we are hoping you can help. Sin peaks is Vancouver's only live improvised soap opera company and has produced 11 unique series to date. Our seasons are self-created combining parody, satire, live music, singing, and dancing all made up on the spot. Sin Peaks has grown so much over the last five years that we are moving to a larger theatre! We are throwing a fundraiser for our opening night on March 7th. We are asking local businesses, friends, and family to please consider donating anything you can to help us open our new season with a bang! We are raising funds to help us with advertising, set creation, props, and setting up our new home to continue bringing laughs your way. Anything you can donate would help us immensely! We love you all and can't wait to expand our brand for you.  

Thank you for your time and consideration!

Sincerely,

 

Sin Peaks Cast, Crew, & Band Members
