story:
HAVE YOU SEEN THESE KIDS?

The Lost Kids: Seeking Samarkand Volume 2 funded on Kickstarter on day 1 in less than five hours and went on to unlock nine (9) Stretch Goals. This Indiegogo OnDemand campaign is designed to allow new readers a second chance to experience the books and other collectibles!

You will find both volumes that make up the full Lost Kids story available here! 

The hardcover editions were exclusive to Kickstarter backers only and are sold out already. However, every pledge towards a physical book to be sent in the mail will come with the following extra items and upgrades:


What is the Lost Kids: Seeking Samarkand?

The Lost Kids: Seeking Samarkand is a love letter to Goonies, the 80s cartoon Dungeons & Dragons and my all-time favorite game series Final Fantasy!

When a group of five teenagers is mysteriously transported to a world filled with magic and airships their only clue to return home is to find a mythical lost city - the city of Samarkand.

Volume 1 took the Kids and their traveling companions - a Thief, a Knight and a young Mage Apprentice - as far as Mitani, City of Mages as they look for the Rogue Princess Evelet. The second volume picks the story right up throwing readers right into one of the most exciting chase sequences you'll ever experience in comics!

Here are the specs of both The Lost Kids: Seeking Samarkand volumes:

Both books are also available in Digital Format as well.

Every backer on Indiegogo will have their name added to the Thank You section of Volume 2 and those pledging towards a physical copy of the books will get them signed by author Felipe Cagno (that would be me!)

Previews & Art Team

Volumes 1 and 2 collect all eight issues produced to tell the whole story and we truly had a talented team from all over the world on the Lost Kids: Seeking Samarkand, meet the team behind every issue:

Issue #1

Art by Ben & Joey Vazquez (USA) and colors by Everardo Orozco (Mexico)

Issue #2

Art by Rafael De Latorre (Brazil) and colors by Clonerh Kimura (Mexico)

Issue #3

Art by Wilton Santos (Brazil) and colors by Everardo Orozco (Mexico)

Issue #4 

Art by René Córdova (Mexico) & Luis Figueiredo (Portugal) and colors by Michael Perez (USA) & Derek Down (Scotland)

Issue #5

Art by Noel Rodriguez (Philippines) & Luis Figueiredo (Portugal) and colors by Clonerh Kimura (Mexico)

Issue #6

Art by Ivan Anaya (El Salvador), Luis Figueiredo (Portugal) and colors by Clonerh Kimura (Mexico)

Issues #7 and #8

Art by César Gaspar (Mexico) and colors by Eddy Swan (Australia)

Cover Gallery

Original covers by Genzoman (Chile), Bea Jackson (USA), Mark Taduran (Philippines), René Córdova & Clonerh Kimura (Mexico), Stanley Artgerm Lau (Singapore), Carlos Gomez (Spain) & Derek Dow (Scotland), Todd Nauck (USA) & Clonerh Kimura (Mexico) and Gina Chacón (Mexico).

Previewing Issue #1 

Previewing Issue #2

Previewing Issue #3

Previewing Issue #4

Previewing Issue #5

Previewing Issue #6

Previewing Issue #7 & 8

Add-Ons & other Lost Kids products

Because this is an extension of the original Kickstarter campaign not every item is available at this point but once we start the fulfillment process through BackerKit you'll have a chance of adding the special edition Art of the Lost Kids, prints, previous unlocked items and more!

Shipping & Handling

We use hard cardboard photo mailers plus dust-free clear plastic bags and comic book sized card-boards. For the packages with both books we use Easy-Fold Mailers for maximum protection (this worked great for my last Kickstarter!)

 

Thank you so much for checking out The Lost Kids: Seeking Samarkand series! If you have any questions or inquiries please send me a message or shoot an e-mail at cagno100@gmail.com

This has truly been one heck of a ride and it's great to be able to share this story with a brand new audience.

Enjoy!

Felipe Cagno

story:
Thank you so much for making the print for HoD and Myre possible!

Together with you and every supporter who helped raise the funds for print via my store, this campaign reached beyond 100% with an unexpected amount of new people! I thank you from the bottom of my heart for making this possible!
Haunter of Dreams and Myre are currently printing. Everyone who supports this campaign after the 23rd of June 8.00 p.m (CEST), be aware that I had to close name collecting because of an unexpected deadline. You are now on the list of names for my next project, however. Your support is valuable to me.

I have extended this campaign by another 15 days for those who want to claim campaign exclusive specials and get their name on the lists as well. Thank you so much again! :)
 

Hello and welcome! 

Lores of Yria: The Haunter of Dreams is a spinoff comic of my main comic series, „Myre: The Chronicles of Yria“. It's a lore that I created alongside the making of the first volume of Myre and has now become a separate adventure on its own. While it plays in the same universe as Myre's story, it is not directly interwoven with the Chronicles of Yria. However, you will discover some connections and hints between the two stories.

The first pages of the story can be read here.

Haunter of Dreams leads you into the dreamscapes of a little boy who has to overcome his biggest fears and worries. In the format of a dream tale, this story touches profound and surreal plains which only dreamers might be able to experience.

It sprung up from my last campaign where I had a small side project in mind. However, over the years, the story grew exponentially and challenged me on all levels of creativity. From a mere 35 pages booklet, Haunter of Dreams turned into 80 pages in length and illustrates the immersive dream world of a little boy.

Alongside Haunter of Dreams, I want to re-print the first volume of Myre – Chronicles of Yria.

Because of each book's dimensions and printing technique, the costs are very high. I always strive to bring out the best print quality and colours for my creations and have you enjoy the books the best way possible.

 

 

 

If this campaign reaches its final goal, I will be able to add Myre Vol 1 for its second print run! After receiving many questions to when Myre will be back in my store, I saw the first volume still in demand and decided to add it here instead of making a single run for it. 

Myre - Chronicles of Yria I" is the first book of an ongoing graphic novel fantasy series which delves into the mysteries of a world called "Yria". The world of Yria has a mysterious past. Very few Yrians know of it, and still fewer seek it. But there are clues that this harsh desert planet once held a much different past.

As a wanderer, Myre is interested only in her own survival. Together with her lifelong dragon companion, Varug, she seeks merely the next crumb of bread. But her search will unwittingly send her into the deepest mysteries of Yria's history, and the ancient and terrible secrets it conceals.
Embark on a great journey alongside with Myre and discover the secrets of Yria.

In 2014, I had a successful crowdfunding campaign which helped me create the first volume and set the path for the whole series. 

After my successful print and release in 2017, Myre got also translated and published in German by Splitter-Verlag. Due to my work with Splitter, I remastered some of the pages of Myre and added a few more things for the story, making me learn so much more in regards about print and design.

I would like to do the same for the original re-print of the first volume.

 

 

 

Find me here:

story:
In the future, no one sleeps anymore thanks to a wonderful pill. Unfortunately for Drew Spencer, stapler-wielding office drone, he's allergic to it. Struggling to keep up with a society that no longer dreams, Drew slowly starts to realize there are sinister things lurking under the surface of the new and shiny world.


Power Nap is our online graphic novel, dynamically drawn by Bachan and written by yours truly, Maritza Campos. We have been uploading the story from the beginning at http://www.powernapcomic.com. Our wonderful readers helped us bring Vol. 1 into life, and now it's time for Vol. 2 to become a reality!

You can always catch up on Power Nap for free at  http://www.powernapcomic.com/d/20110617.html and see if you like it and would like to support it. Power Nap is completely author-owned by us two.

Plus, you can get a shiny, beautiful book too! We crowdfunded Power Nap Vol. 1 so we already have some XP points under our hat :) Everything went fine last time, and we expect to make this round even better!

What We Need

Basically, $10K for the print run, fees, and shipping. This is a full-color book, european-album (bd) sized. The first one turned ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS (you can see some pics in the gallery, although the book is even prettier in real life). So the new book has to be a worthy companion of the first volume in your bookshelf. ;)

Each softcover book is $30, but shipping IS included in the price, anywhere in the world. We're Mexico-based, so pretty much all our shipping is international fees anyway. We're going to have a limited number of hardcovers too, 150 or so, for $45. We have some combos with the first volume at a discount price. Our prices haven't changed since our last book, and it's recommended you get your book(s) in this indiegogo campaign, since we don't know if shipping fees are going to rise next year, which could affect the price.

What you get

Beautiful, beautiful books. We make small runs, so don't miss out!

And a neat combo!

Isn't it enough? What, do YOU want to be featured as an extra in our beautiful dystopia? Well, YOU CAN!


When am I getting my stuff?

We hope to start shipping the book before the year ends, possibly December 2015.
We're going to offer signed and sketched books too. In our last campaign, most books were shipped quite fast, but the sketched ones took a LONG time, almost a year. This was more a problem of getting the sketched books from Bachan to me. We lived in different states of Mexico, very far away. But fear not! Because this time it's going to be different. Bachan moved to my city this year, which ensures these sketched books are going to be shipped along with the rest!!

But I have no money!

One of the reasons our webcomic is free is so anybody can enjoy it. If you like it, you can still help us meet our goal by giving us a signal boost and spreading the news about our campaign. Any and ALL support is appreciated! Just copy and paste this handy link to twitter, email, facebook or tumblr! :)
http://igg.me/at/powernap2
Thank you in advance for all your support. 
Let's make the magic happen! :D

story:
Short Version

 

Our personal messages will be posted soon, but we needed to get this site up and running by 8/1 to meet our deadline. Sorry for the sloppiness... we will be fixing it shortly.

In 2011, 2 Comedians joined forces and traveled down to Ft Benning Georgia to entertain our troops.

At the end of a very successful show they vowed one day to launch a tour and travel through as many states as possible, bringing laughs to the massess....and causing beer to travel up through the nostrils.

Life, as it always does, got in the way. Kiley moved on to a successful career selling cars and Dave went back to working on an Ambulance. Two years have passed, and the two amatuer comedians have decided to take that shot and get out into the Heart of America and make some folks laugh. In this day and age there is no better medicine.  

We're not going to insult you with one of those , "How many of you have a dream"? Campaigns. We all dream of things, we all want to get out and do different stuff. Well, our stuff is a Comedy tour.

2 Comedians with Careers outside the laughing world, crammed into a tiny car for more than 2200 miles, doing jokes in tiny venues for little money. Dreamy huh?

Kiley Gray and Dave Wright make up the Cross eyed Comedy Tour. A week long adventure into telling jokes to strangers. 

 

7 days, 5 shows, 4 states and one smelly car.

We will be posting video messages over the next few days.... but for now, enjoy the sweaty underarm stylings of Comedian Dave Wright at the 2012 Rocky Top Comedy Competition in Knoxville, TN

 

 

 

This tour is something we've wanted to do since stepping on stage for the first time. Now, we have the opportunity to spread out and tell jokes to diverse crowds in 4 different states.

We are taking time off from our day jobs to chase down this dream.... we take this opportunity and your donation seriously.  

This schedule is ever changing... as show opportunities come up we drop open mic riuns. As of 8/1 we have 2 shows booked, waiting on a start time for another , and 2 are up in the air.  We are actively checking open mic times along the route to max our stage time.

 

 

 

Sunday September 8th   Out Front on Main     Murfeesboro, TN       8p.m.

Monday Travel Day Murfeesbro to Austin Tx.

Tuesday  show  tba, then a local open mic

Wednesday  tba

Thursday  tba

Friday 13th,   L.A's Bar and Grill    Jonesboro, Arkansas   8p.m.     

Saturday   Show in St Louis, then an open mic

Sunday tba

 

Why support amatuer comedians? Well, I would answer that with why do you support local bands, or artists? Comedians come in all shapes and sizes, and different skill levels. Not all of us will make it on to Comedy Central, and that's ok. The love of standup is what drives us, the laughs, the smiles and ultimately the joy of being on stage. Kiley Gray and Dave Wright have been performing for years. 

 

We love stand up comedy...and the people who support it.

 

 

THE IMPACT

 Hundreds of people will be able to laugh for a night through the gift of your donation. The economy has slowed, people are stressed and everyone could use a night out.

Honesty is always the best policy.... we can't do this without you.

 

Where does your donation go?

The Breakdown:

  • 2395 miles (est)  with fuel being an average of $3.50 a Gallon rounds to $300.00. (car gets decent gas mileage) 
  • Why not fly?  We are the John Maddens of Comedy...there is no way we're getting on a plane. Nope.
  • Hotels and Motels are on a 'where we find them' basis... no Double Tree resorts for us. 7 days, at around 60 bucks a night rounds to $420.  The extra $80.00 is a cushion for local taxes on hotels or higher gas prices in different states. 
  • We are not making a profit from your donation.
  • We're not going to ask you to feed us.

Why donate?  You're gonna be making money on the tour...right?:

  • Amatuer comedians make mostly ' door deal' money, which means we split the door revenue with the venue owner. If we were putting 300 butts in the seats at 8 bucks a pop we would be just fine. However, most venues seat between 35 and 50 people tops...and not every show will be a sellout. Getting your name and face out there requires playing smaller venues spread out over a vast area. Seinfeld played the comedy zone that was here in Knoxville in the early 90's...seated around 75 comfortably....and not every show sold out. 
  • With your help we will hit open mics in several towns....some where we have shows and some where we don't. This will help get our faces and style of comedy out to even more audiences and have valuable networking time with local venue owners, bookers and comedians.
  • We don't tour for a living, we have day jobs. So this is a risk for us as well as a golden opportunity to get out there and see how we match up against other comics. We want you to know that we are not taking this lightly. We are asking for an investment in art because standup is an art form....and we have tremendous passion for that.
  • Thanks for taking the time to look at our page!

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Help us spread the word though social media.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING LIVE COMEDY!
story_txt:
Short Version
 
Our personal messages will be posted soon, but we needed to get this site up and running by 8/1 to meet our deadline. Sorry for the sloppiness... we will be fixing it shortly.
In 2011, 2 Comedians joined forces and traveled down to Ft Benning Georgia to entertain our troops.
At the end of a very successful show they vowed one day to launch a tour and travel through as many states as possible, bringing laughs to the massess....and causing beer to travel up through the nostrils.
Life, as it always does, got in the way. Kiley moved on to a successful career selling cars and Dave went back to working on an Ambulance. Two years have passed, and the two amatuer comedians have decided to take that shot and get out into the Heart of America and make some folks laugh. In this day and age there is no better medicine.  
We're not going to insult you with one of those , "How many of you have a dream"? Campaigns. We all dream of things, we all want to get out and do different stuff. Well, our stuff is a Comedy tour.
2 Comedians with Careers outside the laughing world, crammed into a tiny car for more than 2200 miles, doing jokes in tiny venues for little money. Dreamy huh?
Kiley Gray and Dave Wright make up the Cross eyed Comedy Tour. A week long adventure into telling jokes to strangers. 
 
7 days, 5 shows, 4 states and one smelly car.
We will be posting video messages over the next few days.... but for now, enjoy the sweaty underarm stylings of Comedian Dave Wright at the 2012 Rocky Top Comedy Competition in Knoxville, TN
 
 
 
This tour is something we've wanted to do since stepping on stage for the first time. Now, we have the opportunity to spread out and tell jokes to diverse crowds in 4 different states.
We are taking time off from our day jobs to chase down this dream.... we take this opportunity and your donation seriously.  
This schedule is ever changing... as show opportunities come up we drop open mic riuns. As of 8/1 we have 2 shows booked, waiting on a start time for another , and 2 are up in the air.  We are actively checking open mic times along the route to max our stage time.
 
 
 
Sunday September 8th   Out Front on Main     Murfeesboro, TN       8p.m.
Monday Travel Day Murfeesbro to Austin Tx.
Tuesday  show  tba, then a local open mic
Wednesday  tba
Thursday  tba
Friday 13th,   L.A's Bar and Grill    Jonesboro, Arkansas   8p.m.     
Saturday   Show in St Louis, then an open mic
Sunday tba
 
Why support amatuer comedians? Well, I would answer that with why do you support local bands, or artists? Comedians come in all shapes and sizes, and different skill levels. Not all of us will make it on to Comedy Central, and that's ok. The love of standup is what drives us, the laughs, the smiles and ultimately the joy of being on stage. Kiley Gray and Dave Wright have been performing for years. 
 
We love stand up comedy...and the people who support it.
 
 
THE IMPACT
 Hundreds of people will be able to laugh for a night through the gift of your donation. The economy has slowed, people are stressed and everyone could use a night out.
Honesty is always the best policy.... we can't do this without you.
 


Where does your donation go?
The Breakdown:

2395 miles (est)  with fuel being an average of $3.50 a Gallon rounds to $300.00. (car gets decent gas mileage) 
Why not fly?  We are the John Maddens of Comedy...there is no way we're getting on a plane. Nope.
Hotels and Motels are on a 'where we find them' basis... no Double Tree resorts for us. 7 days, at around 60 bucks a night rounds to $420.  The extra $80.00 is a cushion for local taxes on hotels or higher gas prices in different states. 
We are not making a profit from your donation.
We're not going to ask you to feed us.



Why donate?  You're gonna be making money on the tour...right?:

Amatuer comedians make mostly ' door deal' money, which means we split the door revenue with the venue owner. If we were putting 300 butts in the seats at 8 bucks a pop we would be just fine. However, most venues seat between 35 and 50 people tops...and not every show will be a sellout. Getting your name and face out there requires playing smaller venues spread out over a vast area. Seinfeld played the comedy zone that was here in Knoxville in the early 90's...seated around 75 comfortably....and not every show sold out. 
With your help we will hit open mics in several towns....some where we have shows and some where we don't. This will help get our faces and style of comedy out to even more audiences and have valuable networking time with local venue owners, bookers and comedians.
We don't tour for a living, we have day jobs. So this is a risk for us as well as a golden opportunity to get out there and see how we match up against other comics. We want you to know that we are not taking this lightly. We are asking for an investment in art because standup is an art form....and we have tremendous passion for that.
Thanks for taking the time to look at our page!

story:
About Us
Antarctic Press is an independent comic book publisher that was founded in 1985 by Ben Dunn. Starting it in a converted garage with a brand new original Macintosh, Ben (with the help of friends) published Antarctic's first title,Mangazine. At that time, to publish a comic here in San Antonio, you had to print the cover at one location, the interior at another, and then get binding from a third. In the early years, as with most businesses, it was a struggle, but Ben managed to hang in there, doing titles like Extremely Silly Comics and Ninja High School. Since then, Antarctic Press has expanded. I (Ben’s brother, Joe Dunn) joined the fray in 1989, and we have been publishing continuously since then, coming out with a multitude of titles in a variety of genres which have endeared us to our fans.
 
Over the years, we have contributed to the industry with our unique brand of business. Being a creator’s rights-associated publisher, we have opened the door for numerous creators, many of whom had some of their first work appear under an Antarctic Press imprint. These include creators and artists like Terry Moore, Dave Johnson, Neil Googe, Esad Ribic, Yanick Paquette, Fred Perry, Rod Espinosa, Joe Wight, and David Hutchison, just to name a few. The gallery provides but a small sampling of titles we have published and the artists and creators who did them. We have seen every incarnation the industry has undergone during our existence, enduring its many ups and frequent downs, and through it all, we have persevered over time. We have stayed in business with hard work, dedication, sacrifice, and prayers from the people who have worked for us and have provided their creations for publication.
 
What Happened
While we have been in business for many years, it has never been a financial windfall; we made comics we wanted to read and share with the world. Over the past year and a half, we took the step of expanding into the mass retailer market—specifically, into retail stores like Wal-Mart. While this distribution channel gave us extensive exposure to a much wider audience, it was also very costly to supply it, mostly owing to necessarily large print runs. Our inexperience in this market resulted in us being ill-prepared for returns. This, in combination with the large printing bills, has placed us in a financial quandary. The bottom line is that all this hard work over so many years is now in jeopardy. Everyone here has sacrificed in their own way to help us stay in business, including taking business and personal loans to help us climb out of the hole we made for ourselves. Unfortunately, we still need help.  This situation could force us to make significant changes in our future publishing operations. This is where we hope you can contribute. Even a few of you could make a huge difference.
 
Help Us Keep Antarctic Press…Being Antarctic Press
So what is the money going for? The best way to describe it is paying down the debt incurred from the large print runs and heavy returns. It is always difficult to ask for help, but due to current circumstances, we have incurred over $70,000 in debt and costs from returns. We do not ask or want anyone to just pay our debt for us; we believe we have provided some great perks for your support. It is difficult to see things go south at this time; we have an extremely strong schedule coming up and would hate to see these projects not come to fruition. In addition, we are attending conventions, developing an app for our library of titles, and working on books and projects outside the comics industry, which will go towards righting our previous mistakes. However, all these projects will take time to implement, and right now we need your help to keep us going until then. That is why we are starting this campaign and asking for your support.  Many great titles like Strangers in Paradise, Ninja High School, Gold Digger, and Last Zombie, which are from lots of great creators, might not have been released without Antarctic Press. Now you can help us keep on doing what we do best.  And if none of these perks appeal to you, you can still visit our website to check out what other products we have to offer.
 
If you have been a fan since our inception in 1985, we do appreciate your support over the years, and if you are a new reader, thanks for giving us a chance. Wouldn't you like to see us continue our work for years to come? Wouldn't you like to see Fred do another 200 issues of Gold Digger, one of the longest-running creator-owned comics ever? We are asking for $3000, an amount that will help us eliminate one of our smaller loans and help “keep the AC on.” We do like it cold in the Antarctic.
 
If you can’t contribute…
We realize that things are tight for many, and if you are unable to contribute, we completely understand. If you are not comfortable pledging, donating, bailing out, or whatever you want to call it, we completely understand, but we hope you reconsider after seeing our long history of great and unusual comics in a multitude of genres. If you cannot contribute but want to help, you can get the word out about the campaign. Maybe you have a friend or family member who wants to get an instant comic collection. Use whatever social media you have at your disposal to help out.  Even if you are just thinking about us, we still appreciate your support.  Thanks for taking the time to read about our campaign.

WE HAVE A STRETCH GOAL OF $10,000 for the last week of the campaign. If we hit the goal we will provide another exclusive AP JAM print to all contributors above $25. Thanks for the support.

story:
Our Time in Eden, Chapter Two



Two lives, broken and cast out of paradise, spiral toward each other. Ellis, a lost and fading mystery, returns home in search of her childhood friend Tim, a reclusive drunk dodging any touch of the world around him. This is not a love story.

In this second chapter in the series, Innocence finds Ellis and Tim remembering their childhood together, the pains of home and the world as they bond together and promise to be friends forever. The visuals for this second chapter are strikingly detailed in finished pencil as we watch their memories unfold.

From author Gibson Twist and artist Ben Steeves, Our Time in Eden is a story of lost innocence, lost direction, and lost hope. The promises and lies of childhood, the endurance and heartbreak of friendship, and the bitter consequence of tasting the fruit of knowledge.

Here we are seeking funds to print the second chapter in this engrossing and deeply-emotional, Eight-issue comic series.


What's On Offer?

This is a simple campaign, free of bells and whistles. We're offering comics, copies of this 24-page black and white comic for $6 USD in the US and Canada, $8 USD for international backers. In addition, for those who missed our Chapter One campaign, this time around we're offering packages with both issues, Ch 1, Fatigue, along with Ch 2, Innocence, for $10 USD in the US and Canada, and $14 USD for international backers. We're also offering Retailer packages for either Ch2 or both chapters, so bug your local comic shop to come on out to the party.

The comic is ready to print, we're just waiting for funds to skyrocket into the universe! Backers of the second chapter will receive a unique bookplate reserved only for backers of this IndieGogo campaign.


The Story of The Story

Our Time in Eden began as a novel, written by Gibson Twist in 1995, then languished for many years. Gibson met Ben Steeves in 2005 at a local comic-making event, teaming up to win cash and prizes in a collaborative comicking marathon. A unique artistic connection formed quickly between them, and they began discussing a larger project. Ben chose Our Time in Eden.

The project was first posted online at ourtimeineden.smackjeeves.com in 2008, gaining critical acclaim and small, devoted audience. Ben and Gibson are now bringing the series to print, continuing with this second chapter, Innocence.

More of Ben's work, a satirical zombie-superhero saga ZomBen can be found at zombenstrikes.com Gibson's long-running comic Pictures of You can be found at picturesofyoucomic.com


GOAL ACHIEVED! SECONDARY GOAL ANNOUNCED!


Thanks to everyone who's helped us meet our initial funding goal. Now, we're looking at our Secondary Funding Goal of $750! When we hit that target, everyone will receive, for each comic they've ordered, an Our Time in Eden bookmark, along with an Our Time in Eden button featuring the Green Apple icon and Eden logo.

Art not final.

Thanks again, and we'll see everyone at $750 or bust. Cheers, keeping spreading the word.

story: Imagine Everything Comic Anthology is a project put together by I.E. Comics and Games to help artists and writers of all talent levels publish their very own comic book. Participants will be working closely with some top name writers, artist, and colorists, in the comic book industry. Such as: Ambrose Quintanilla, Jamie Sullivan, Jay Gates, Ralph Love, Shane Marquez and many more. This project is for everyone. No one will be turned away from participating. Attendees with be coached in writing styles and illustration techniques. The comic will be published bi-monthly in a comic book / magazine style format. The comic will consist of a minimum of 24 pages, possibly more depending on attendance. If we reach our funding amount we will furnish all supplies, pay for professionals time, and all publishing and distribution. This is something we have wanted to do for a long time and finally we can, with your help!

story:
Abbey Londer's having a pretty eventful week.

Tuesday afternoon, Abbey went to her friendly neighborhood Bank of the West ATM to take out some cash.  Bank of the West rewarded her 5 years as a loyal customer by giving her a $100 counterfeit bill!  When she politely brought this to Bank of the West's attention they confiscated it, called the cops and almost had her arrested!  She not only lost the $100 but the bank closed her accounts and banned her for life!

The following day, Abbey parked her car in Echo Park on a bright sunny street for 1 hour.  When she came back she was greeted with a smashed car window - just for fun!

Why are you doing this?
Have you ever watched a friend hit a rough patch and it felt like torture to just sit on the side and watch it happen. We've all had rough weeks, wouldn't it have been nice to do something cool for that person  in reaction to it?
Abbey is a kind friend. She is a sweet and hardworking person who spends all of her energy making things things. FUN things. Things that she made for the sake of the world being more delightful.  (For more on why Abbey rules, read this)
No one deserves to have a sucky week. Not even your worst enemy. Help us make just one week a little less bad with this.
#NiceThingForAbbey

story:
ABOUT ICARUS AND THE SUN

How it all started

A few years ago I was doing my 365 days of doodles challenge. It was supposed to be just one illustration, but I felt there was so much more to tell about their relationship. So I started to craft a story revolving around their tragic break up. To my surprise, the story resonated with a lot of people that started to follow my work. Because of that, I got a lot of opportunities to work as a comic book artist. I was never able to publish this book by myself, and this has been a personal goal of mine for a while. After lots of planning, I've decided to do a crowdfunding so we can make this happen together. I am reaching out to you, a fan of these characters, to join me on this campaign to launch their full story for the very first time.

 

The comic book

Icarus and the Sun will have around 60 colored pages and a soft cover (for now). You've already seen online some key moments of the story, this book will tie them up and give a closure to the story. With your support, I will be able to finish that, get it inked, colored and lettered. Dimensions are approximately 6.1x9 inches.

The images shown are for illustration purpose only. If funded, the comic book will have the same content as mentioned, but with print quality and new layout.

 

The campaign

I have prepared some cool perks to achieve our goal. Aditionally to the book, that you will be able to get either in a digital PDF format or a physical printed copy, I will offer an exclusive 3 prints set (A5 sized), sketched books and some campaign-only commissions.

The total funds are split between printing the comic books, the Indiegogo fee, credit card fees, and the payment to the professionals involved in this launch. I found it best not to include the shipping here, for that would most likely jeopardize the funding effort and minimize my control over how the packages are going to arrive for you.

I have planned this very carefully and chose professional partners to make this project as good as possible, but please bear in mind I am not a publishing house, I am bound to learn something with any possible rocks along the path. Still I think we're as prepared as it's humanly possible.

Thank you so much for your support and let´s make this happen, together!

 

STRETCH GOALS UPDATES

Hey, guys! I can not thank you enough for all your love and support. I am completely mindblown!!! To celebrate achieving 300k in less than 24 hours, I am upgrading all printed books to hardcover. 

And today I am launching our very first stretch goal. If we get to USD 340k, all tiers with the physical copy of the book will get a set of CACTUS STICKERS for free.

PS: I promise that if we get a new stretch goal, I will include something for the PDF copy of the book =

Aditionally to the book, that you will be able to get either in a digital PDF format or a physical printed copy, I will offer an exclusive 3 prints set (A5 sized), sketched books and some campaign-only commissions.The total funds are split between printing the comic books, the Indiegogo fee, credit card fees, and the payment to the professionals involved in this launch. I found it best not to include the shipping here, for that would most likely jeopardize the funding effort and minimize my control over how the packages are going to arrive for you.I have planned this very carefully and chose professional partners to make this project as good as possible, but please bear in mind I am not a publishing house, I am bound to learn something with any possible rocks along the path. Still I think we're as prepared as it's humanly possible.Thank you so much for your support and let´s make this happen, together! STRETCH GOALS UPDATESHey, guys! I can not thank you enough for all your love and support. I am completely mindblown!!! To celebrate achieving 300k in less than 24 hours, I am upgrading all printed books to hardcover. And today I am launching our very first stretch goal. If we get to USD 340k, all tiers with the physical copy of the book will get a set of CACTUS STICKERS for free.PS: I promise that if we get a new stretch goal, I will include something for the PDF copy of the book =

story:
Yonathan Saura's variant cover to Peerless #1:

 

Original artwork by Pablo Peppino from Peerless issue #1

 

LOGLINE: A Wing Chun master fights her way through NYC’s toughest gangs to stop the execution of her lover at the hands of an occult martial arts clan hell-bent on stealing her secret ancient martial art technique.

 

MASTER THEME: The past binds or braces, depending on how you choose to face it.

Having just completed a successful Kickstarter campaign for this project, we're here on Indiegogo to start our series as it was originally intended;

This Indiegogo is for a;

  • 24 page (32 pages if we reach $3,000)
  • Full color
  • Standard size American floppy comic. 

Issue 1 of 8.

We plan to print this book in the U.S.A. (Canada is our backup.)

 

Peerless is the love child of a professional music guy (Kris), and long-time story guy and comic writer (Nick), brought to life by the extraordinary illustrative talents of our friend from Valencia (Pablo).  

A true love letter to four very distinct things;

1) Kung Fu. 

2) Walter Hill's '79 cult classic; The Warriors.

3) New York City.

4) Attitude from strong female lead movies like Coffy and Foxy Brown.

 

We grew up with Saturday and late night Kung Fu theater, copious viewings of Shaw Brothers flicks, and big cinema Kung Fu productions from good ole Bruce, like Game of Death and Enter the Dragon.

These movies sparked our imaginations as kids and directly influenced who we are today.

The Dragons - Messing with these guys is just asking for trouble.

Art Caanan White. Colors Brett Weldele.

The Seven Skulls.
These psycho creeps don't appear till issue 2, but these are the gangs that lurk our series.
Art Caanan White. Colors Brett Weldele.

Underneath, Peerless is a deep, complex story, with TONS of heart. On the surface, it's a group of young adults fighting their way through a bunch of crazy themed gangs from the South Bronx. This central motif is a direct influence from the Warriors. With Nick being born and raised in the Bronx, falling in love with this story was a no-brainer.

Of course, many other movies and stories influenced the conception and direction of Peerless, we're not gonna mention them all, but we couldn't sleep at night if we didn't shout to Big Trouble in Little China. Kurt Russel's cult classic forever impressed on us the value of a fun, fast-paced story, with a touch of the supernatural heebie-jeebies.

Lastly but not least in our primary list of influences, is Kiara herself. The lead protagonist in Peerless; a lady Kung Fu master, who in the vein of the above mentioned movies, brings serious attitude and style. 

A fierce heroine in a loud and powerful, in-your-face-raw, adventure on the mean streets of Fear City!

In progress penciled page of Peerless Issue #1, original art by Pablo Peppino.

 

We're comic fans too.

So when we sat down to assemble an art team for this project, our motto was simple, "We don't want acceptable art... we want exceptional art." 

Our goal is to create a series and support material with art you get lost in. A real visual treat that gives something more every time you revisit. 

 

 

 

REWARDS:

We're breaking our reward tiers into three levels;

DIGITAL ONLY.

PRINT ONLY.

and COMBO, which includes both digital and print components.

---

On the print side we've got;

MINI-PRINTS

5"x7" Character Cards of the main villain of the series, Hu Lei and his three boss-level Tiger Clan henchmen, illustrated by French artist, Gilbert Han.  

Only one villain in all of China is bad-ass enough to take on all the Fists of Fate, single-handedly (see what I did there?)  An occult sorcerer like Lo-Pan (BTLC), except he can actually kick your ass in a fist fight too.

Hu Lei's young prodigy. What he lacks in skill and experience he makes up for with relentless energy.

Jiao Zhu is as deadly as she is beautiful. If we get the stretch goal, you get to see just how much so in issue 1.

"B" or Black Saber has an Iron Hand technique... Literally. You have to get through him to reach Hu Lei and that's why nobody reaches Hu Lei.

We're so happy with the way these came out, we're gonna have a stretch goal for a set by Gilbert illustrating Valentine's crew! (that's the good guys for all you folks in the back.)

 

PIN-UPS

Next up, we're offering a choice between 2 dynamite 8"x10" pinups of Kiara, 

The first is a Comic Style Pinup reward of Kiara, illustrated by Ariel Medel, colored in  gorgeous water colors of Brett Weldele. 

OR

If you prefer something a little on the risqué side, we've got this 8"x10" Sexy Pinup of Kiara, by Finland artist, Teemu Taiga. 

 

 

VARIANT COVER

Yonathan Saura killed this variant cover for us. Showcasing Kiara, Hu Lei and Sandy, as well as representing the two key villainous forces of the series; the Dragons street gang, and Hu Lei's Tiger Clan!

The variant cover is the cover we're showcasing at the top of this page.

This variant is a $4 add on. Just pop your pledge up $4 and select the variant option when you get the email at the end of the campaign.  <Hey, we know it's not a Jim Lee or J. Scott Campbell Variant, but remember, these kind of extra funds are one of the biggest boosts to a campaign.> 

Our fantastic interior artist, Pablo Peppino, will be doing the core cover. We'll post an update on his version soon.

 

GEARING UP

Expect a custom printed bandanna as well as a couple of NYC centric patches to slam onto your gang vest! <Come on, you know you have one in the back of the closet.>

Stay tuned.

 

DIGITAL

For folks who like their comics digital, for the COMPLETE DIGITAL tier, Incarnate Games was cool with us bundling another project Nick scripted, the Ascended Kings: the Fall of Empyrnea, graphic novel.    

This story is about as far from the South Bronx as you can get, but if Fantasy is your jam, you're gonna dig the colorful art from Renae De Liz, illustrator of The Last Unicorn, Peter Pan, and many others. Here's a look;

 

 

 

 

1969 New York City.

KIARA, a teen from the South Bronx gets mixed up with the most notorious street gang in the city, THE DRAGONS.  Not willing to let her only daughter spiral down a life of crime and  hardship, Kiara’s mother reaches for a lifeline and sends Kiara to VALENTINE, a local Vietnam vet/bar owner, who runs a Kung Fu dojo,  teaching and mentoring street kids in self-discipline and self-respect.

But things between the Dragons and Kiara only escalate. Framed for a horrible crime she didn’t commit, Kiara escapes to the safety of China, to study under Valentine’s Kung Fu teacher.

Years later, the twenty-something street kid from the South Bronx rises to become one of five elite Kung Fu masters, known as the FISTS OF FATE. Legendary warriors of China dedicated to fighting the sinister forces of the far East.

When Kiara’s boyfriend, another member of the Fists of Fate,  disappears during a trip to NYC, Kiara reluctantly returns to her old hood, determined to find him.

If it's coming into NYC by boat, it's coming through Cast Aways turf!
Art Caanan White. Colors Brett Weldele.

 

But NYC circa 1977 hasn’t changed… In fact it’s gotten worse. Much worse.

A mortal enemy of the Fists of Fate has taken up with New York’s CHINESE TRIADS, undermining the South Bronx, to make way for a new Triad heroin hub. The old, formidable foe from China’s mainland obsesses over learning the Fists of Fate’s secret Kung Fu technique known as the PEERLESS FIST. And having taken Kiara’s boyfriend he’ll stop at nothing to discover it.

With nowhere to turn, Kiara teams up with her old mentor’s current group of teenage Kung Fu students to free her boyfriend. A task far easier said than done, as her arch nemesis has united all the South Bronx’s deadliest street gangs to wipe out Kiara’s old neighborhood and anyone who stands in his way.

Set against the historic NYC blackout of 1977; a kick ass Kung Fu master and a bunch of wanna be Kung Fu teens, take on every bad-ass gang in the South Bronx, Chinese Triads, an evil Kung Fu master of the dark supernatural arts, and his three boss-level baddies. 

A true love letter to New York City before it was gentrified, Peerless is a deeply engaging story, wrapped up in an impossible-to-put down package of fun that will transport you back to couch surfing Kung Fu theater on weekends as a kid.

Everybody who knows, knows Hip Hop started in the Boogie Down Town (that's the Bronx to you nerds). Well, just as the Bronx had tremendous significance to music, music has tremendous significance to Peerless. 

Peerless actually spawned from Kris' love of (and involvement in) music. Willie Hutch, and Ennio Morricone provided the soundtrack for the heroes we made up when playing with kids in the neighborhood. 

Kris Morron: "In 2017, I started writing music for what I thought was going to be a new album. As the writing process proceeded, a narrative emerged that I became increasingly excited about. The music was funky and had some Chinese influences. It was sounding a lot like a soundtrack for a 1970s Kung Fu movie. I decided if I was going to write music for a story, I should know what story I was going to tell. A year later I had a script for Peerless."

The original vision for this series included two original soundtrack songs to accompany each issue. Kris wrote the music and brought together an incredible group of musicians. This was going to be a part of the core reward.

Then Covid-19 hit.

Literally, right when the team was set to record the theme song for the series, "High Above the Pain" in March, everything shut down. 

Skinny's go to studio for performance recording, as of this Kickstarter launch, has not reopened. Leaving us to find a new place to record, in an environment with limited options and jacked up costs due to demand. 

The musical passion is a big part of this project and we'd love to fight through the pandemic obstacles to get you some sweet tunes to read by. We've gone ahead and added the cost to cover studio time and reassembling the musical team as a stretch goal. 

This is a tough time for independent musicians.

By helping us reach this stretch goal you will not only be helping us fully realize our vision for this project, you will be helping musicians who are out of work and working really hard to get by.

In the meantime, Kris has written, performed, and recorded demos (which are kinda like first draft versions for all you writers out there). Check em out on his Soundcloud Page here, and yes, that's them playing in the background of our video.

We feel confident these demos will have you looking forward to more!

Kris "skinnyk" Morron: Kris has been a professional musician for nearly 25 years. His time in bands such as Mifuné and Revolution Brass Band (and many more) provided opportunities to tour the country and make music with a long list of incredibly talented people. While new to writing comics, this story is a direct result of years of working to tell compelling stories through music. For more information about "skinnyk" and to hear some of his music please visit www.skinnykmusic.com

Nick Macari: Nick is a freelance story consultant, developmental editor, narrative designer and writer–working primarily in indie comics and games for over two decades. His wide creative range can be seen in his novel works which include a prequel to King Arthur, Jidaigeki & Manga inspired Samurai fiction, Cyberpunk, and his current WIP, a Noir Horror circa 1940's. More recently noted for the award winning Tower of Time video game, translated into 9 languages. When Nick isn't working scripting and story mechanic'ing, he teaches creative writing craft on his two websites, http://NickMacari.com and http://StoryToScript.com

Pablo Peppino: Pablo is an artist from Argentina, focused on comic books. His work can be found in many well known publishers including Marvel, Vertigo, BOOM! Studios, Mythopoeia and others. He holds a degree in Fine Arts and enjoys approaching illustration and sequential art in a strong cinematic way.

We've successfully completed a Kickstarter campaign that ensures we have the funds to create and a 24-page print version of issue #1. Our initial goal for this campaign is to raise $3,000. When we reach that amount we will have the funds necessary to print the 32-page version of the issue #1. Once we surpass that amount we will start putting funds towards the following:

STRETCH GOAL #1 - $4,500:     Gilbert Han's, Valentine's Crew card collection. Digital version going to all backers. Print version available to everyone purchasing a printed copy of the book. 

STRETCH GOAL #2 - $7,500:     As explained in the MUSIC section above, we were prepared to record original music for the first issue in March. Then Corona Virus hit and closed down production. The studio we originally booked is not open yet. If we reach this stretch goal, not only will we be able to book studio time elsewhere, we will also be able to pay the musicians more. We have assembled an incredible group of professional musicians who are all working hard to get by. By paying them more we will all be helping them make ends meet.

STRETCH GOAL #3 - $17,500:    Anything we raise above $7,500 will be put in the bank and used as funds to start production on issue #2. $10,000 would cover most of the production costs and would allow us to set up a production schedule.

*** Before we get into it, for quick clarification; our discussion on budget below is not a sob story. We're not complaining how expensive indie comics are. We're not trying to gain sympathy showcasing how much money we've spent on this series.

We're sharing this information strictly for the independent comic creators who want more direct insight into the costs of OUR comic publishing journey.

There's more than one way to skin a cat. For us two writer creators, this is how we did it. ***


All that said, Nick always tells new comic creators, "makin' top quality indie comics is expensive." If you're not paying in cash, you're paying in time (but it's usually both).

As an active member of the indie comic community, he feels it's particularly important to be transparent and let folks see the money on this project. If you're a comic creator, buckle up, it's not pretty.

Here’s a breakdown of our costs:

$13,000.   Comic interior production based on full 32p issue. (Does not include a page rate to the writers and we saps have been working on this for over 2 years!)

$02,000.   Comic covers and reward art.

$02,500.   Printing (projected run of 2,000 books. We don't expect to get 2,000 backers, but printing costs drop significantly the more you print. More importantly, something many first time creators don't realize, overall production cost doubles each time you cut your print run by half. Comics are, and always will be, a numbers game.

$02,000.   10% Crowdfund fees (based on a $20k fund)

$02,000.   10% "Shit, we Fucked Up Our Math" Contingency

Sub total -   $21,500.

$21,500 / 2000 books = $10.75 cost per book  (YES, Indie comics are this expensive.)

The big elephant in the room is always shipping. One of the hardest things about crowdfund budgeting is that you don't know at the beginning what the actual units backed will be by the end. 

We're assessing packing materials and U.S. shipping costs at $4.50 per unit. 

This brings the total shipped cost per book to $15.25 per book. 

That's right, we're making .75 cents per print issue sold at the $16 tier. Or if we managed an entire sell through of all books, $1500 total profit. (Though in reality, it's even less, as there are a few ancillary costs unique to this project, we didn't bother to list above.)

This is the reality, or at least our reality, in indie comics. 

So there are really only 2 ways to reach sustainability in indie comics at this production level; 

1) get a killer audience and print more books, reducing your cost per book by half each time you double up your print run... or 

2) sell through a bunch of higher reward tiers that hopefully have a better profit margin.

We humbly request and hope for your support on both these fronts.

We've internally assessed the budget of this first issue at $20,000 and we're 100% committed to producing this series. So what we've done as creators, is basically funded the lion's share of the budget upfront. We'll make up the difference through crowdfunding and apply any additional money towards the next $20,000 investment, in order to fund the next issue. 

Peerless is coming at you as a completely independent venture. Our publisher is YOU, the fans. We are not looking to be picked up by a publisher along the way. Instead we hope the fans drive the series supporting comics as they'd like to see them; fun, exciting and meaningful.

For us two writer creators, this is how we did it. ***All that said, Nick always tells new comic creators, "makin' top quality indie comics is expensive." If you're not paying in cash, you're paying in time (but it's usually both).As an active member of the indie comic community, he feels it's particularly important to be transparent and let folks see the money on this project. If you're a comic creator, buckle up, it's not pretty.Here’s a breakdown of our costs:$13,000.   Comic interior production based on full 32p issue. (Does not include a page rate to the writers and we saps have been working on this for over 2 years!)$02,000.   Comic covers and reward art.$02,500.   Printing (projected run of 2,000 books. We don't expect to get 2,000 backers, but printing costs drop significantly the more you print. More importantly, something many first time creators don't realize, overall production cost doubles each time you cut your print run by half. Comics are, and always will be, a numbers game.$02,000.   10% Crowdfund fees (based on a $20k fund)$02,000.   10% "Shit, we Fucked Up Our Math" ContingencySub total -   $21,500.$21,500 / 2000 books = $10.75 cost per book  (YES, Indie comics are this expensive.)The big elephant in the room is always shipping. One of the hardest things about crowdfund budgeting is that you don't know at the beginning what the actual units backed will be by the end. We're assessing packing materials and U.S. shipping costs at $4.50 per unit. This brings the total shipped cost per book to $15.25 per book. That's right, we're making .75 cents per print issue sold at the $16 tier. Or if we managed an entire sell through of all books, $1500 total profit. (Though in reality, it's even less, as there are a few ancillary costs unique to this project, we didn't bother to list above.)This is the reality, or at least our reality, in indie comics. So there are really only 2 ways to reach sustainability in indie comics at this production level; 1) get a killer audience and print more books, reducing your cost per book by half each time you double up your print run... or 2) sell through a bunch of higher reward tiers that hopefully have a better profit margin.We humbly request and hope for your support on both these fronts.We've internally assessed the budget of this first issue at $20,000 and we're 100% committed to producing this series. So what we've done as creators, is basically funded the lion's share of the budget upfront. We'll make up the difference through crowdfunding and apply any additional money towards the next $20,000 investment, in order to fund the next issue. Peerless is coming at you as a completely independent venture. Our publisher is YOU, the fans. We are not looking to be picked up by a publisher along the way. Instead we hope the fans drive the series supporting comics as they'd like to see them; fun, exciting and meaningful.

story:
TENS is a graphic memoir by Vivian Chong

______________________________________________________________________________________

Vivian is a former graphic designer who suffered a rare TENS reaction to Ibuprofen (TENS stands for Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis Syndrome), which caused severe burns on her skin and organs. Near death, she was put into a medically-induced coma for two months. When she was revived, her eyesight was blurry and continued to deteriorate.After cornea surgery, she had a one-month period in which her vision improved enough for her to draw. She was driven during this month to create a graphic memoir. Vivian was able to complete 100 pages before site loss prevented her from drawing further. She tucked her graphic memoir away on a shelf, leaving it for fourteen years. At one point she almost threw it out while decluttering her apartment, feeling hopeless about ever being to do anything with the images. 

 

 

Dancing with the Universe

(and REAson d'etre dance productions)

_____________________________________________________________________________________

Award-winning choreographer Kathleen Rea met Vivian through Contact Dance Improvisation. Kathleen was inspired by Vivian as an artist. They started a collaborate on a dance-theatre production that will tell the story of Vivian’s illness and subsequent artistic re-birth. The production, called “Dancing with the Universe” will premiere in Toronto in Spring 2020.

As part of their research, Vivian showed Kathleen her unfinished graphic memoir. Kathleen was stunned by the emotional impact of Vivian's illustration. Kathleen realized she was holding an extraordinary piece of art that expressed human truths and represented the human urge to create and connect through extraordinary circumstances.

Finding a Collaborator in Georgia Webber

_____________________________________________________________________________________
After much searching, Kathleen and Vivian found Georgia Webber, a comics artist, known for her critically acclaimed graphic memoir, Dumb: Living without a Voice. Georgia having expressed her own health experiences related to chronic voice pain through drawing has unique insight into Vivian’s drive to complete her novel. Georgia's drawings have their own style, but there are similarities to Vivian’s work that will offer cohesiveness as well as creative opportunities; such as showing how the switch between artists represents the moment of Vivian's vision loss and the start of her new way of being in the world. 

Our Process

Because Vivian can't see what Georgia creates, and Georgia has a voice disability that sometimes prevents her from being audible to Vivian, the process for collaborating on this book is a learning process as well. Through trial and error, Vivian and Georgia have discovered the layers of work each of them has to contribute on top of the fun creative stuff, finding ways to connect through unique access needs.

The Grand Plan

______________________________________________________________________________________

Kathleen and Vivian will launch their show, Dancing with the Universe, in April 2020. The legendary Fantagraphics Books has agreed to publish TENS in tandem with the show launch, which means our deadline is coming up quick! In order for the artists to maintain a basic living wage while working on the project, funds need to be raised for the project to be a go ahead. We are looking to raise $16,500.00 to cover fees for services and materials. We are also seeking private philanthropic donations to reach the full amount we need, just over $23,500.00 to support everyone through the creation of this book, and the important work of access facilitation during the creative process.

______________________________________________________________________________________

We believe collaboration makes a kinder world. Help us to collaborate on this beautiful project! Thank you!

story:
I know this is a long shot!

But You never know until you ask, right?

So my pal, Mike.  He's selling off his huge G.I. Joe collection, and I want to buy it.  Not just because I want it, but I think it would be cool to set up a cool G.I. Joe museum.  Plus, this way we don't have to worry about these toys going to a complete stranger.  He can sell them to a guy he trusts, and know his toys will be well taken care of.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $1200.00 bucks to complete the deal.  Fairly simple.

WHAT YOU COULD GET?  Well there will no doubt be doubles since I have a fairly large collection already.  So I will be setting up some rewards for those who donate!  You could get yourself a neat toy!

story:
The Story

Toonaverse is a universe of characters I've created over the last few years to entertain myself. I've built stories around each set in comic book form. After sharing with a bunch of folk and getting some positive feedback, I'm ready to spread my wings with your help of course!

Here are a few samples of the characters and stories you'll see in a Toonaverse comic book.

Ranger Zak covers the task of an earthmade cyborg to protect earth as well as an intruding planet's natural resources from the Earthlings.

Stinky Joe is a slapstick look at the art of surviving in the wilderness.

The Freezy Show is about an intelligent snow beast who is discovered and turned into a reality show star.

Kung Foo Tales  If you have ever seen a Jackie Chan. Bruce Lee or any other Kung Fu movie you will love this story! It's a spoof of all things Kung Fu.

Visit the Toonaverse Comics page on FaceBook to see more fun images.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised would cover the following:

  • Final Production Costs
  • Printing Costs
  • Perks for all supporters
  • Want to develop some characters into a stand alone series
  • Make improvements to Toonaverse site

The Impact

I want to make Toonaverse Comics into a quaterly comic book anthology to preview comic book series featuring all of the Toonaverse characters in adventurous and interesting feel good stories that are also good for the whole family.

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to donate? That's okay! Spread the word and thank you for your support!

story:
Who the heck am I?

Hi Gang,

Me? I'm nobody actually but I'm working on that. My name is J.R. Mounts. I write, draw, print and promote my own parody comics for Scairy Tales Noir (we spell "scary" with an "i" for the "not so scary fairy tales"), a business I'm building little by little, having no one to answer to but myself (and I carry an IRON fist getting myself to work). It's awesome fun. It's hard work and I love it.

One of my most popular comics is "Fried Pickle Noir" (pictured above), a crime noir parody series where fried pickle Detective Q Cumbersome fights against the mob ingredients (Meatheads, Potatoheads, Melonheads, etc...) in a town called The Pits. Consider it "Sin City meets Veggie Tales" and you're in good territory.

The other title is "Scairy Tales: the Not So Scary Fairy Tales" (pictured above), a family friendly comic strip series about 1950's-type misfit kids who dress up as superheroes and monsters and later find out that real monsters live in the next town! Consider this "Calvin & Hobbes meets The Nightmare Before Christmas."  Happy days indeed!

I have a website for these comics at www.scairytalesnoir.com and on my Facebook page. I even dress up as Q (the fried pickle detective) when we're promoting the comics, as you can tell from the "Print the Pickle" campaign image pic!

Ever since I was a kid, I have always believed I could do something special with the crazy fun ideas that keep popping into my head, whether it was music that I wrote or characters and creatures that I drew. I can't help it, I love being an artist. I love love love seeing things I come up with become "real."  Most of all, I love making people laugh, smile and get in on the joke. My parody comics are done to the best of my ability and I have an awesome wife who is better than I deserve and encourages my silly little ideas. She's my second biggest fan. I'm the first! ha ha!.... Seriously.

 

What's the "dill"?

This campaign is my passion to get the comics I print at home published professionally so I can spend the precious time I have off work to create more comics! I appear at comic book conventions whenever I can and have found I'm getting a fond reception to my comics. The good problem is that they're starting to sell! The bad problem is that I print them from home and it takes me many long hours into the night to print just a few (that's not counting when I accidentally put the paper in the wrong way or the dang machine eats a perfectly good piece of art!). Before you know it, the weekend's gone and it's time to go back to my job.

To alleviate the situation, I have found a great comics printing company that can print my comics larger and on good quality paper. What this means is that I'd never have to spend my only time off work printing my life away when I'd rather draw, spend time with my family or SLEEP.  Having a professional print my comics means I can keep creating the next issue without losing precious family and creative time. I love my family. I love creating my comics. I kinda need them both. This campaign is the way to unburden myself from some of the labor.

If I reach beyond my goal something very special happens: funds will be allocated for the "Fried Pickle Noir" AUDIOBOOK and hopefully the MOTION COMIC!!! That's right, I've already begun the process of prepping for that too! This is all pie-in-the-sky stuff but know that there's BIG plans set for all things Scairy Tales Noir! Things are in place to get the ball rolling in as many ways possible to help these characters break into the public and it all starts here.

How much bread?

I'm shooting for $1500. Having better printed comics means I can take Scairy Tales Noir comics to the next level at conventions and for online sales. Good quality costs money. Cutting corners looks exactly like what it is: cheap. This cheapens your hard work and the potential of the ideas presented. The campaign price of $1500 is just to get me started with a few nice copies of each volume we've got so far. I'm not looking to get rich from backers' pockets. I'm merely asking if anyone is interested in getting in on the ground floor for a grassroots campaign to take Scairy Tales Noir to bigger and better places. It starts here. Who knows, this could be the next Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles or Peanuts or even the Harry Potter series if given the chance.

 I'm a dreamer. I'm a big kid. I'm an entrepreneur. I'm a "work my regular job so that I can do what I truly want to do in my spare time" kinda guy. The things I envision for my comics will happen one way or the other. Indiegogo can give me the opportunity to have a shorter financial road to hoe with this very first public step. I've done a lot on my own, with my wife (unpaid editor) and with my best friend/comic partner Chris Collins. It's a lot of hard work but I love every damn minute of it. I have big plans for the future of these comics. I've written musical episodes, theme songs, storyboarded an animated special, planned action figures,etc...but that's all for the future once I can get my comics off the ground. I'm asking YOU to be a part of this and whatever future is held for these characters I love so much.

Givin' you the goods!

But hey, I'm not lettin' you get away with helping me out without you getting something in return, buddy! Nope, I've got several perks to sweeten yer coffee like signed prints, sketches, even MAKING YOU A CHARACTER!!! That's right, even YOU can have a tussle with 'ol Q Cumbersome in a special Fried Pickle Noir episode! Plus, I'll even give you original art of your character. I'll make a special scenario that'll feature anyone going to such great lengths to help me out.  Each of you will be morphed into a food character and meet Q himself. The how's and what's will be your surprise!

Final thoughts...

Above all, THANK YOU. Thanks for looking, thanks for reading and thanks for your own precious time getting this far into my yapping. At this stage, I'm able to get into a few bigger conventions which gets exposure to a LOT more people. This means I need more product and they better look good because there's loads of awesome competition at theses cons. I look forward to the challenge. I think these characters and comics are every bit as good as anything else out there.

Even if you can't afford to contribute, simply spreading the word around about this campaign can do wonders. You'd be surprised what word of mouth has done for us in the past! Even going to our Facebook page and "liking" us helps to spread the word! So, tell your friends, tell your enemies, tell your MAMA! Every little bit helps, truly. Indiegogo even has some easy "share" tools right on the site.

The best I can say is that every action here will make a big difference. Not only can Indiegogo help my characters flourish but we could be making history with baby steps just like this.

I'm J.R. Mounts. Thank you, and goodnight.

story:
Welcome to The Tribulation TaskForce: Parables!

Parables will tell the quieter stories of Tribulation TaskForce 's most popular members.

Issue one starts off with our most enigmatic member...The Thief In The Night!

Eli "Royalty" Caldwell had it all. A successful Mixed martial arts career, money and girls, but when tragedy strikes his family, he is forced to re-evaluate what is important in life. Out of the chaos, a Hero is born!

Written by: Bill Raupp  Art: Rully Akbar

The backup story introduces The Silent Knights! Written by Star Cross Comics founder Joe Spicer, the story follows the most fierce mercenary force in the Tribulation TaskForce universe! Featuring stunning artwork by Brian Dawson!!

 

Who will like this series?

This is a classic superhero story! The hero who triumphs over adversity! It's perfect for those who like classic marvel and DC origins stories with a more introspective look! We are building a universe of Mature yet fun heroes!

Great for readers of:

Superheroes

Christian Fiction

Action

Fun!

 

CAMPAIGN GOAL

The book is about 75% complete. The funds will help finish the book and create capital for the next 2 issues in the Tribulation Taskforce universe!  We are committed to bringing new adventures and characters for you to enjoy!

 

 

LIMITED EDITION FOIL VARIANT

story:
The story of a young boy who suffered the crushing consequences of bullying, struggled through it, and survived. Tom's trauma is explored in this hard-hitting story, graphically illustrated by an award-winning artist, Edgar Bercasio. With educational sections that talk about how to spot bullying and what to do about it, help us make a difference across our city, our country. Starting with one story, one voice. No more secrets.

Once we have published our graphic novel, we look to expand our campaign using Tom's Secret as our tool - our sword and shield against the bullying beast. We wish to go around to local schools and have copies of our graphic novel to leave behind for the students and teachers to keep, speaking to anyone we come across along the way to share our story and passion in hopes that it will ripple across the city. We want to give a voice to those who are too scared to come forward or do not know what to do, to show them they are not alone. We want to help educate the public about the tragic effects of bullying in any way we can and hopefully make a change, no matter how big or small.

We know we cannot achieve it alone and we know bullying cannot be stopped by one but by many. We aim to have our published copies ready for our launching of the book in February 2016. Help us take those small steps forward towards change in our communities.
