With educational sections that talk about how to spot bullying and what to do about it, help us make a difference across our city, our country. Starting with one story, one voice. No more secrets.Once we have published our graphic novel, we look to expand our campaign using Tom's Secret as our tool - our sword and shield against the bullying beast. We wish to go around to local schools and have copies of our graphic novel to leave behind for the students and teachers to keep, speaking to anyone we come across along the way to share our story and passion in hopes that it will ripple across the city. We want to give a voice to those who are too scared to come forward or do not know what to do, to show them they are not alone. We want to help educate the public about the tragic effects of bullying in any way we can and hopefully make a change, no matter how big or small.We know we cannot achieve it alone and we know bullying cannot be stopped by one but by many. We aim to have our published copies ready for our launching of the book in February 2016. Help us take those small steps forward towards change in our communities.

story:
This is where the Becoming Hero Indiegogo Campaign Lived. You can read all about it, and its perks and prizes, below! Now this page is a place you can get and help create future comic books and translations of Becoming Hero.

$4677: Everyone who gave before this level gets a new, 4-page, exclusive bonus comic about one of the villains.

$5445: Translation to Spanish. Everyone who gave at/before this level gets to vote on the next storyline for the webcomic.

$6000: Translation to Japanese. Everyone who gave at/before this level gets to vote on the storyline for the next PHYSICAL comic.

Every $3000 after that: You all get a new 33-page comic.

~*~

Can anyone solve Skye's Puzzle? becominghero.ninja/skyes-puzzle/

~*~

   Well hello there!     

Man, we're super-glad to meet you! We're Skye, and Jace, characters from an upcoming superhero novel in which Skye wants to kill his author, and I have to choose whether or not to stop him. To do that, Skye's got to come out of the comic book world. To do that, he has to HAVE a comic book world.

That's where you come in. 

This is a campaign to pay for comics pages inside the 2017 Becoming Hero novel. It's a novel about a comic book, with a comic book in it! We want to pay a pro creator, so we've got to put up some pro money. This also pays for the audio rendition, which has some pretty cool differences from the novel version. It's read by two cool voice actors, one of whom was just nominated for a Canadian acting award!

We're both fictional characters written by professionally published science fiction author Jen Finelli. You can find her writing CV online if you google her, or just go to her site, at byjenfinelli.com. Long story short, she's a Codex member, she's 1/3 of the way to SFWA qualification, she's received honorable mention in Writers of the Future twice, and she's been paid to write over a hundred different fiction and nonfiction works. She wanted to play this novel indie-style so she could do cool stuff, like:

  • Run a charity contest along with the campaign so we can all be more super (more below!)
  • Get a cover made by DC and Marvel cover artist Lawrence Reynolds
  • Work with up-and-coming audio creator John Krissilas, who was just nominated for a Canadian voice award
  • Create crazy in-world rewards like a recipe book from Skye's superhero team, Valentine's Day "cards" starring the pairings of Skye's universe, a book of geeky superhero dates, and more
  • Offer a cash/jewelry prize to the first person to solve the math puzzle I solve in the book
  • Run a "story game" where different crowdfunders get different pieces of a prequel story--and have to work together to put it together, with prizes for the team that wins!
  • Run a referral contest, so the Sticker Army Member who brings in the most supporters gets an exclusive, one-of-a-kind pyrography of Skye's team by a skilled wood-burning artist from BurntMyselfOnce (Deets below! Always share this campaign with your unique URL!)
  • And more!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Pay a real artist so we don't have to put up with Jen's drawings: $2000
  • Pay two voice actors, one for me, and one for Skye: $810
  • Pay to print and send you the books in May: $737.50
  • Indiegogo fees: $364.75
  • Kindle downloads: $100

*Flexible Funding Caveat: If we do not reach our goal, we cannot pay a pro artist. However, we WILL still make the audiobook and the physical book WITHOUT comics. If we fail, everyone who ordered the physical "comic book within the book" novel will instead get a separate comic book. But Jen is not a good artist, so let's reach that goal!*

EVERYBODY WHO PLEDGES GETS:

  • The audiobook, if we reach our goal ($15-$17 value)
  • An e-mail from a superhero
  • 2/17 of a prequel story. Everybody gets the first part of the story, but to get the rest you have to work together! EACH WEEK we release FOUR parts of the story, distributed randomly amongst that week's new donors. (No donors, no more story) The first 17 people to piece together the story here, in order, will receive custom-drawn superhero portraits of themselves, and lifelong membership in the exclusive Society of the 17. What is the Society of 17? A superhero league? A secret group for unreleased fiction? Neither? Only the 17 will know.

People who pledge at really cool levels can get stuff like:

  • -A chance to become enshrined INSIDE the story
  • -An e-book full of extra superhero stories
  • -A superhero recipe book
  • -Superhero Valentines
  • -A trip to Puerto Rico
  • And more!

Let's Do Good

Because this is supposed to be a campaign about superheroes, we think it's time for us to get off our butts and become the heroes we read about.

  • Jen will be cleaning up the environment around her city during this Indiegogo. You can do the same in your own city! The SuperPeep who goes out and collects the most litter in their community will win a wood-burnt box by BurntMyselfOnce depicting Skye's superhero team. It's like the plaque, but it's a box. Like the plaque, there is only one. ONE BOX TO HOLD THEM ALL. Post your litter count and photo here.
  • We don't want to cramp your style: we want to help YOU discover the"doing good" life YOU'RE passionate about. So during this campaign, the Superpeep who volunteers the most hours at their favorite local, qualifying charity (no controversial nonprofits please) will get a cameo in the comic as a superhero of their design. E-mail me at jen (at) becominghero.ninja, Subject: Volunteer Hours to log!
  • Let's use comics to help the homeless, the handicapped, orphans, or those in prison! The SuperPeep who comes up with--and executes--the best comics/superheroes-related event/project for one of these populations will get a speaking role character named after them in the book. An inspiring superhero-movie-night and meal at the local shelter? A job fair to help folks become their own hero? An art benefit, where you sell your comics to buy them blankets? Or just street-performing in a superhero costume while bringing the homeless hot dogs? I'm excited to see what you come up with. Post your project picture and story in a comment here!
  • The coolest random act of workplace kindness done during the campaign will get a visual cameo in the comic as a helpful citizen. Post yours for voting here.
  • One day during the 3rd week of the campaign, a donation to a qualifying charity of your choice will get you the equivalent value of digital prizes from my campaign. Stay tuned on FB!

*Safety First. You are responsible for taking care of your own safety whatever you do. We do not condone or endorse dangerous behavior, or putting yourself into dangerous situations.*

    Other Ways You Can Join Us

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Referral contest for the Sticker Army! Sticker Army peeps who refer even just one patron to the campaign will get access to a secret perk no one else knows about, and the member who recruits the most $$$ worth of people will win THAT BEAUTIFUL PLAQUE you saw of Skye's team having a good time! How do you join the Sticker Army?
      • You wear a sticker like the one below, with your unique referral URL, and send me a picture of you doing that. And/or,
      • Always share this campaign using your unique referral URL. You can get it next to the "back this campaign" button.
    • THE PUZZLE. See becominghero.ninja/skyes-puzzle for details on the hardest puzzle ever released for literature.
    •  

     

    Risks & Challenges

    • Jen isn't a professional artist, so we need that artist, and if we don't reach our goal we cannot make the comic book pages. If that happens, you will get an outside-the-book comic instead.
    • Jen might die suddenly for no reason. If Jen dies, which is unlikely but not impossible, she hopes you will get your money back, but because she will be dead she may not have much control over that.

    Be sure to ask any questions you might have to jen (at) becominghero.ninja, or on Twitter @petr3pan. Jen is on all the socials, which you can find via http://becominghero.ninja/, but she checks Twitter the most.

    Thanks for reading. = )

story:
(UPDATE: 2/28/17) We've reached our first two STRETCH GOALS! That means a postcard MAP OF THE ISLAND that the comic is set on will be added to every perk tier $25 and up, with secrets to potential sequels and backstory not featured in the comic!

PLUS, an EXCLUSIVE Z-REX LAPEL PIN will be added to to every perk tier $50 and up! Not only that, the physical copy of the Chaos Theory comic will receive a prestige quality print run, which is how the writer always wanted to present the comic!

Now, with only days to go, we've added our FINAL STRETCH GOAL! If the campaign reaches $18k every perk tier $28 and up will receive an digital-exclusive, black and white, EXTRA 4-PAGE COMIC STORY featuring a NEW ZOMBIE DINOSAUR that contributors will get to vote on. That means you get to decide which dinosaur will be the next Z-Rex in this new chapter of the Chaos Theory saga!

To learn more about Chaos Theory and the other amazing perks we're offering just scroll down this page!

What is CHAOS THEORY: ZOMBIES VS. DINOSAURS?

CHAOS THEORY is like the crazy love child between Dawn of the Dead and Jurassic Park shoved into a blender with classic pulp comics like Xenozoic Tales, Tales from the Crypt, and Turok! 

A group of survivors, including mechanical mastermind Max and pregnant super-scientist Persy, try to escape the zombie apocalypse by sailing to an uncharted island. Unfortunately for them their new refuge has been host to mad science gone terribly wrong. Extinct dinosaurs have come back to life, hungry for new prey, and the undead aren't far behind! Max and Persy join forces with island survivor Zora and her Dakotaraptor companion, Goodall, as things go from bad, to worse, to totally badass for our heroes and their fight for survival and humanity's future!

The crazed mind behind this monstrous mash-up is DJ Wooldridge, co-host of the popular Only Stupid Answers podcast with Sam Bashor. Each week they dive into everything comics, movies, and TV with their fans. You may also know him as the resident comic book authority at SourceFedNERD on shows like Superhero Round-up and SuperSmack.

Along side DJ is an incredible team of artists, including up-and-coming talents Pietro Antognioni on interior artwork and M. Woods on colors, with a face melting cover by indie-comics legend Tom Neely (The Humans, Henry & Glenn Forever, The Blot)!

 

DJ and the immensely creative collaborators that have joined him to make this wild ride possible have a deep, undying passion for comic books and the stories that medium can produce. Now it's your chance to join the team and help them bring the craziest comic of 2017 to life!

Exactly how crazy is this comic? Zombie Tyrannosaur crazy! Meet our (very) Big Bad... the Z-REX!

What's Needed

This is an ALL-OR-NOTHING campaign. We either collect the money we need that makes this project possible, or we don't. There is no "part way". So if you want to see this comic happen please contribute what you can (even $1 helps) and share this page with anyone who will listen! 

There's a lot that goes into making a comic book. CHAOS THEORY's tremendous art team includes the main artist, the colorist, a letterer, and the cover artist.  All of whom need to get paid to keep the lights on and food on the table just like the rest of us. Then there are the amazing artists that contributed to our other perks, plus the cost of printing the comic, the other spectacular rewards we have to offer, and the service fees that come from any crowdfunding platform. Here's how it all breaks down!

The writer is not getting paid for this project. This is his labor of love and any funds raised above the goal will go towards extra rewards, a higher quality print run, or (if we go way above our target goals) towards future projects for you to enjoy. 

What You Get

No matter what perk tier you choose you will be getting the comic! All contributors get a digital copy of CHAOS THEORY, and anyone who chooses the $10 Paleozoic Pack or above will get a print copy personally SIGNED by the writer! That's not all, check out the other amazing perks we have to offer!

  • $5 - Get a DIGITAL COPY of the comic plus a digital copy of the writer's ORIGINAL SCRIPT! Get a first hand look at what changed from the original draft to the final page!

  • $10 - Get a PRINT COPY of the comic SIGNED BY THE WRITER! Plus you'll get the DIGITAL COMIC to read on the go and the DIGITAL SCRIPT!

  • $25 - YOUR NAME will go in the comic on a SPECIAL THANKS page! Not only that, you'll get a DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET with exclusive behind-the-scenes material like concept art and character backstories! You'll also get one of our EXCLUSIVE TRADING CARDS featuring a character from the comic, along with the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT!

  • $50 - Get an ART PRINT of the cover SIGNED by the artist, TOM NEELY! Plus get a pack of ALL 9 TRADING CARDS featuring the characters and creatures from CHAOS THEORY! This pack is the only way to get the RARE SUPER-CARDS featuring Only Stupid Answers hosts DJ and Sam! You'll also receive ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT!

  • $100 - Get MORE EXCITING COMICS published by my friends over at Art of Fiction with art from legendary creators like BRUCE TIMM (Batman: The Animated Series, Justice League Unlimited), EDUARDO RISSO (100 Bullets, Flashpoint: Batman, Moonshine),  PAUL POPE (Battling Boy, Batman Year 100), and MORE! You'll receive FIVE COLOR COMICS #1 (48 color pages) SIGNED BY THE WRITERS and DAMES OF THE ATOMIC AGE (64 color pages). PLUS you'll receive a SIGNED COPY of my Original Script PERSONALIZED for you! You'll also receive ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including SIGNED ART PRINT, ALL 9 TRADING CARDS, YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT!

  • NEW! - $200 - SOLD OUT! - Get DRAWN INTO THE COMIC AS A ZOMBIE. If you've ever wanted to torment the heroes in a monster movie, now's your chance! PLUS, you'll get the LIMITED EDITION NUMBERED PRINT of Sam and DJ as their favorite superheroes, SIGNED by them! You'll also receive ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including the BONUS ART OF FICTION COMICS, SIGNED SCRIPT, SIGNED ART PRINT, ALL 9 TRADING CARDS, YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT! This is a limited perk so ACT FAST!

  • $250 - SOLD OUT! - Only Stupid Answers fans, this is your chance to have a PERSONAL VIDEO CHAT with hosts DJ Wooldridge & Sam Bashor! We can discuss anything you want, CW Superhero shows, conspiracies, you name it we can talk about it! PLUS, you'll get the LIMITED EDITION NUMBERED PRINT of Sam and DJ as their favorite superheroes! You'll also receive ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including the BONUS ART OF FICTION COMICS, PERSONALIZED SCRIPT, SIGNED ART PRINT, ALL 9 TRADING CARDS, YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT! There's a limited number of this perk, so DON'T MISS OUT!

  • $500 - SOLD OUT! - Get DRAWN INTO THE COMIC! This is your chance to not only become a comic book character, but we can promise your character will get a gruesome death at the hands of either a zombie or a dinosaur! That's an experience we can confidently promise (we hope) you could never receive in real life. PLUS you'll get a PERSONAL THANK YOU shout out from the writer on an episode of Only Stupid Answers. You'll also receive ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including the PERSONAL VIDEO CHAT with Sam and DJ, the LIMITED EDITION Only Stupid Answers Hero Print, BONUS ART OF FICTION COMICS, PERSONALIZED SCRIPT, SIGNED ART PRINT, ALL 9 TRADING CARDS, YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT! There's a limited number of this perk, so DON'T MISS OUT!

  • $1000 - LIMITED - The mother load! Not only will you be drawn into the comic, your character will get a FEATURED TRADING CARD, one of the 9 Trading Cards we'll be giving out, and get a PERSONALIZED BACKSTORY created specifically for you by the writer! PLUS, you'll get a PERSONAL ART PRINT of you drawn as the superhero of your choice like the Only Stupid Answers Hero Print! You'll also receive THREE COPIES of the SIGNED COMIC (to share with friends or family) and ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including a PERSONAL THANK YOU shout out on an episode of Only Stupid Answers, a PERSONAL VIDEO CHAT with Sam and DJ, the LIMITED EDITION Only Stupid Answers Hero Print, BONUS ART OF FICTION COMICS, PERSONALIZED SCRIPT, SIGNED ART PRINT, ALL 9 TRADING CARDS, YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT! There's only one of this perk so DON'T MISS OUT!

Risks & Challenges

This comic is being brought to you by a dedicated team of creators with years of experience and a proven track record of meeting their deadlines.

PLUS, the production of this comic is already well under way. The writer has already put his own money towards making this comic happen and he and the artists are working hard to complete it RIGHT NOW! 

Anything can happen. The entire planet could explode Krypton-style tomorrow ... But barring that, or some other unavoidable personal mishaps or acts of God, we will do everything humanly possible to get this comic and the corresponding perks into your happy hands, and with your contribution we will have the means to make that happen.

Note that if you contribute to this project you acknowledge that the comic and any other perks you receive come "as is", and may not look exactly as presented here as some designs and art are still in the finalization process, or may change in the due course of production. There are no refunds once the campaign ends and the project is successfully funded. However, we're confident that you will be satisfied with the final product.

The writer himself has run successful crowdfunding campaigns in the past and is applying the lessons learned to make sure that this is another enjoyable experience for the contributors to this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have a dime to your name but still want to show some love to our project? Share this page! Tell all your loved ones! Hell, tell the people you hate, too! Get the word out to anybody and everybody you think would give a crap about a project like this. Go to Twitter/Facebook/Instagram/Snapchat/Tinder/Grindr and shout it from the social media rooftops. Support is support, and we appreciate you for it!

Along side DJ is an incredible team of artists, including up-and-coming talents Pietro Antognioni on interior artwork and M. Woods on colors, with a face melting cover by indie-comics legend Tom Neely (The Humans, Henry & Glenn Forever, The Blot)!

 

DJ and the immensely creative collaborators that have joined him to make this wild ride possible have a deep, undying passion for comic books and the stories that medium can produce. Now it's your chance to join the team and help them bring the craziest comic of 2017 to life!
Exactly how crazy is this comic? Zombie Tyrannosaur crazy! Meet our (very) Big Bad... the Z-REX!


What's Needed
This is an ALL-OR-NOTHING campaign. We either collect the money we need that makes this project possible, or we don't. There is no "part way". So if you want to see this comic happen please contribute what you can (even $1 helps) and share this page with anyone who will listen! 

There's a lot that goes into making a comic book. CHAOS THEORY's tremendous art team includes the main artist, the colorist, a letterer, and the cover artist.  All of whom need to get paid to keep the lights on and food on the table just like the rest of us. Then there are the amazing artists that contributed to our other perks, plus the cost of printing the comic, the other spectacular rewards we have to offer, and the service fees that come from any crowdfunding platform. Here's how it all breaks down!

The writer is not getting paid for this project. This is his labor of love and any funds raised above the goal will go towards extra rewards, a higher quality print run, or (if we go way above our target goals) towards future projects for you to enjoy. 

What You Get
No matter what perk tier you choose you will be getting the comic! All contributors get a digital copy of CHAOS THEORY, and anyone who chooses the $10 Paleozoic Pack or above will get a print copy personally SIGNED by the writer! That's not all, check out the other amazing perks we have to offer!

$5 - Get a DIGITAL COPY of the comic plus a digital copy of the writer's ORIGINAL SCRIPT! Get a first hand look at what changed from the original draft to the final page!


$10 - Get a PRINT COPY of the comic SIGNED BY THE WRITER! Plus you'll get the DIGITAL COMIC to read on the go and the DIGITAL SCRIPT!


$25 - YOUR NAME will go in the comic on a SPECIAL THANKS page! Not only that, you'll get a DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET with exclusive behind-the-scenes material like concept art and character backstories! You'll also get one of our EXCLUSIVE TRADING CARDS featuring a character from the comic, along with the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT!


$50 - Get an ART PRINT of the cover SIGNED by the artist, TOM NEELY! Plus get a pack of ALL 9 TRADING CARDS featuring the characters and creatures from CHAOS THEORY! This pack is the only way to get the RARE SUPER-CARDS featuring Only Stupid Answers hosts DJ and Sam! You'll also receive ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT!


$100 - Get MORE EXCITING COMICS published by my friends over at Art of Fiction with art from legendary creators like BRUCE TIMM (Batman: The Animated Series, Justice League Unlimited), EDUARDO RISSO (100 Bullets, Flashpoint: Batman, Moonshine),  PAUL POPE (Battling Boy, Batman Year 100), and MORE! You'll receive FIVE COLOR COMICS #1 (48 color pages) SIGNED BY THE WRITERS and DAMES OF THE ATOMIC AGE (64 color pages). PLUS you'll receive a SIGNED COPY of my Original Script PERSONALIZED for you! You'll also receive ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including SIGNED ART PRINT, ALL 9 TRADING CARDS, YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT!


NEW! - $200 - SOLD OUT! - Get DRAWN INTO THE COMIC AS A ZOMBIE. If you've ever wanted to torment the heroes in a monster movie, now's your chance! PLUS, you'll get the LIMITED EDITION NUMBERED PRINT of Sam and DJ as their favorite superheroes, SIGNED by them! You'll also receive ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including the BONUS ART OF FICTION COMICS, SIGNED SCRIPT, SIGNED ART PRINT, ALL 9 TRADING CARDS, YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT! This is a limited perk so ACT FAST!


$250 - SOLD OUT! - Only Stupid Answers fans, this is your chance to have a PERSONAL VIDEO CHAT with hosts DJ Wooldridge & Sam Bashor! We can discuss anything you want, CW Superhero shows, conspiracies, you name it we can talk about it! PLUS, you'll get the LIMITED EDITION NUMBERED PRINT of Sam and DJ as their favorite superheroes! You'll also receive ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including the BONUS ART OF FICTION COMICS, PERSONALIZED SCRIPT, SIGNED ART PRINT, ALL 9 TRADING CARDS, YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT! There's a limited number of this perk, so DON'T MISS OUT!


$500 - SOLD OUT! - Get DRAWN INTO THE COMIC! This is your chance to not only become a comic book character, but we can promise your character will get a gruesome death at the hands of either a zombie or a dinosaur! That's an experience we can confidently promise (we hope) you could never receive in real life. PLUS you'll get a PERSONAL THANK YOU shout out from the writer on an episode of Only Stupid Answers. You'll also receive ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including the PERSONAL VIDEO CHAT with Sam and DJ, the LIMITED EDITION Only Stupid Answers Hero Print, BONUS ART OF FICTION COMICS, PERSONALIZED SCRIPT, SIGNED ART PRINT, ALL 9 TRADING CARDS, YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT! There's a limited number of this perk, so DON'T MISS OUT!



$1000 - LIMITED - The mother load! Not only will you be drawn into the comic, your character will get a FEATURED TRADING CARD, one of the 9 Trading Cards we'll be giving out, and get a PERSONALIZED BACKSTORY created specifically for you by the writer! PLUS, you'll get a PERSONAL ART PRINT of you drawn as the superhero of your choice like the Only Stupid Answers Hero Print! You'll also receive THREE COPIES of the SIGNED COMIC (to share with friends or family) and ALL PREVIOUS PERKS including a PERSONAL THANK YOU shout out on an episode of Only Stupid Answers, a PERSONAL VIDEO CHAT with Sam and DJ, the LIMITED EDITION Only Stupid Answers Hero Print, BONUS ART OF FICTION COMICS, PERSONALIZED SCRIPT, SIGNED ART PRINT, ALL 9 TRADING CARDS, YOUR NAME in the SPECIAL THANKS, the DIGITAL BTS BOOKLET, the SIGNED COMIC, the DIGITAL COMIC, and the DIGITAL SCRIPT! There's only one of this perk so DON'T MISS OUT!

Risks & Challenges
This comic is being brought to you by a dedicated team of creators with years of experience and a proven track record of meeting their deadlines.
PLUS, the production of this comic is already well under way. The writer has already put his own money towards making this comic happen and he and the artists are working hard to complete it RIGHT NOW! 
Anything can happen. The entire planet could explode Krypton-style tomorrow ... But barring that, or some other unavoidable personal mishaps or acts of God, we will do everything humanly possible to get this comic and the corresponding perks into your happy hands, and with your contribution we will have the means to make that happen.
Note that if you contribute to this project you acknowledge that the comic and any other perks you receive come "as is", and may not look exactly as presented here as some designs and art are still in the finalization process, or may change in the due course of production. There are no refunds once the campaign ends and the project is successfully funded. However, we're confident that you will be satisfied with the final product.
The writer himself has run successful crowdfunding campaigns in the past and is applying the lessons learned to make sure that this is another enjoyable experience for the contributors to this project.

Other Ways You Can Help
Don't have a dime to your name but still want to show some love to our project? Share this page! Tell all your loved ones! Hell, tell the people you hate, too! Get the word out to anybody and everybody you think would give a crap about a project like this. Go to Twitter/Facebook/Instagram/Snapchat/Tinder/Grindr and shout it from the social media rooftops. Support is support, and we appreciate you for it!

Short Summary

  • I am Hüseyin Celal Koç a.k.a Celor, a comic creator based in Ankara, Turkey. I created Vamp issue 0 last year and I want to make it's second book now. Vamp is a speechless action comic about three main female characters as you can see them above. 
  • All pieces will be signed and comics will get a mini sketch by me.

This is the standard cover for Vamp #1

Here is some interior art from the upcoming issue.

Seems like Arinna have some trouble with the thing.


Yeah Lilit is doing her thing! Boy, she has no mercy!

Wow! isn't Inana mighty? Playing with hijackers like a toy!



Vamp girls sketches. If you want one of these original sketches, pick one of them or more select vamp girls sketches perk and PM me which one do you like.

story:
What The Indiegogo For?

 

Harpies #2 is a 32 page World War 2 espionage horror comic. The Indiegogo is to pay to finish the cost of inks colors and printing. 

Story

  The 2nd great war is almost over. The allies are closing in the Nazis. A desperate Hitler is rumored to have something up his sleeve. The allies aren't completely sure what it is. They send 3 spies that go by the code name Harpies to figure out what is it. The Harpies stumble upon tip that an occultist name Johanna is Hitler's new weapon. Now, they just have to figure out what it is that Johanna is capable of before its too late.  

 

 

A Look Inside

Take a look inside Harpies #2 in this preview:

story:
Our Project:

Stupid Time Machine is proud to announce our very first West Coast tour! After performing sold-out shows in Chicago SketchFest, Austin, and in New York City, STM will now be taking it's technology-themed sketch-comedy show All Beepers Go To Heaven to Los Angeles and the iO West Theater!


Donations will be used to help pay for expenses involved with taking a show on the road, such as registration fees, insurance, airfare, marketing, prop rentals, etc.

Our Show:

In a world where we find love online, and define friendship through Facebook, Stupid Time Machine asks, has human contact become obsolete?  Taking aim at society’s obsession with shiny gadgets, All Beepers is a loving tribute to Nintendo’s, Zach Morris Cell Phones, Grandmas and everything else we once loved but have no current use for.

story:
While shenanigans and gaming jokes are fantastic, this is also a creative vent for a lot of struggles I face with social anxieties and my agoraphobic tendencies. Because of this, I can't guarantee every comic will be funny. Join me as I run across the battlefield with a flamethrower, then sit in my room with me while I think about how I can cancel plans without seeming like a jerk. If you have any suggestions for that by the way, let me know. 

 

Why Indiegogo?

The purpose of the PComic Indiegogo project is to fund the first two years of the series. The update schedule (beginning in January2014) is set for every Monday for 100+ pages for the next two years (though the comic is expected to go for much longer- this is a fundraiser to start it up safely and consistently) The money goes towards domain, hosting, and the time it takes to make the webcomic itself over the next two years.

Every single comic page takes at on average 8 hours from sketch to final save, not including writing. A regularly updated full color webcomic with my other projects end up taking as much time as a full time job. This does not include funding for my other work.

[ Minimum wage ($7.79) x ( 8 hours per page x 104 comics) ] = $6,481 (not including web domain and hosting fees)

Frequently Asked Questions

 

Will you still be making the comic if you didn't reach the goal? What happens if you don't reach?

No matter what, I'll be making the comic. This isn't a pay-for-content campaign. This is a "help me out so I can do this without starving and worrying about paying the bills because I'm spending so much time on this that I can't afford to get a job while working" campaign. If this were an all-or-nothing, I'd be on kickstarter. 

$5000 for a webcomic is crazy!
For a few pages, it would be! Let's be honest, this project only covers the first two years of the webcomic. I actually need much more than 5k to keep it ongoing, as if this were a minimum wage full time job. That's money I've been saving for years. This campaign isn't demanding payment for content- I'll be trying my best to put out the content no matter what! It just helps to have some extra support. Even if I don't reach 5k, every bit is helping so I can keep things running smoothly and getting things on time.
 

You should be doing this for free! / Art shouldn't be something that costs money!

As I've said: I'll be doing this project no matter how much or little I get. This campaign is just to help out because the amount of time I'm pouring into this is time I can't work on other things or have a consistent paying job going. 

Also, do you not pay your plumber because you think they should be doing their job out of their heart? That's ridiculous thinking. Art takes years and years of refining your own skill and learning new things. It's not as fun and simple as many claim it to be. So when you have all those years behind you and you're still looking to improve every day, the last thing you want to be told is "It's easy and fun, why would you charge money?" - Even if a piece takes a week or 10 minutes it still took years of work behind the scenes. Pay artists for their time and skill.

You said it takes 8 hours per comic with a comic a week:
You only work for 8 hours a week then?
I wish. I only counted the main comic into the campaign's cost. When you start an indiegogo project it says "pick your goal and divide it by 10".  

If I were to work 2000 hours in a year (which would assume a 40 hour work week with my other projects) at minimum wage, it'd be about 31k for two years worth of work. The bar I set is literally only 5k to cover costs for the next two years. Truth be told, I can't live on this. I don't expect to. But I definitely can't afford to work for nothing at the same time.

Again, this campaign is for the next 2 years/volumes (instead of one, as most campaigns hold for)--  And this campaign is only for helping put out the free content.

story:
Note for English people: unfortunately this campaign is reserved only to Italian people (due to limited budget). In case of overfunding we will evaluate to release an English version and for information write to info@tatailab.com

Menu
  • Introduzione
  • I Perks
  • La storia
  • I personaggi
  • Il progetto
  • Come useremo questi fondi?
  • Come possiamo aiutare?


Introduzione

Ciao a tutti, mi chiamo Chiara e sono qui per presentare il mio progetto, Anima.

Ho iniziato a lavorare a questo fumetto alcuni anni fa e quando ho incontrato Emanuele Tenderini e Linda Cavallini, gli autori di Lumina, ho deciso di provare la strada del crowdfunding.
Inizialmente avevamo provato a realizzare una campagna su Kickstarter, ma il budget richiesto era troppo alto, però dagli errori si impara, non ci siamo arresi e così abbiamo deciso di riprovarci, ripromettendo la campagna e riducendo il budget al minimo (investendo anche qualche risparmio nella realizzazione).

Quindi, aiutata dal Tatai Lab, sono felice di presentarvi...

ANIMA è un fumetto di genere fantastico, ricco di personalità, emozione, colori e follia. 
Libro d’esordio di Chiara Zuliani, giovanissima autrice tout-court che ha curato ogni aspetto della sua idea: dal soggetto, alla sceneggiatura, dal disegno al colore.

Stilisticamente riconducibile ai moderni codici orientali, con un segno fresco che strizza l’occhio agli anime e un’impostazione narrativa tanto europea quanto giapponese, Anima è un libro vivace, fresco, pulsante.


I Perks

BOOK - Il libro a fumetti di Anima (92 pagine di colori formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) - IL LIBRO E' GIA' PRONTO!

BOOK + USB - Il Libro + una chiavetta USB 3d raffigurante il personaggio di Hormon realizzata da Maikii (contenente illustrazioni, disegni, wip e tanto altro)

BOOK + T-Shirt - Libro + T-Shirt a tiratura limitata realizzate da Kingyo Sukui 

BOOK + CUSTOM A4 - Libro + Commission personalizzata, in B&N in A4

BOOK + CUSTOM A3 - Libro + Commission personalizzata, in B&N in A3

BOOK + ORIGINAL - Libro + Tavola Originale di Anima

BOOK + SKETCHBOOK - Libro + Sketchbook 17,4 x 12,2 cm contenente 20 pagine di sketch e disegni originali di Chiara!


La storia

In questo primo libro seguiamo la storia di Marco, ragazzo incastrato in un’ossessiva e deprimente routine, che all’improvviso viene catapultato in una realtà alternativa, il Borgo, un luogo fantastico abitato da strane creature magiche dove la realtà è in continua e vorticosa trasformazione.

Anima, una caotica “cacciatrice di demoni”, costringerà il protagonista a confrontarsi con le sue più profonde paure, in un’oscura lotta che lo metterà di fronte ai suoi demoni interiori, con lo scopo di vincerli per diventare una persona nuova.

Tema portante del libro è la presa di coscienza sui propri limiti e il superamento di questi ultimi.

Nella sua completezza, Anima è un lavoro immenso e profondo: nel corso dei diversi volumi, conosceremo diversi protagonisti ognuno con i propri problemi e le proprie divertenti psicopatie. 
Un puzzle di personalità, di cui Marco è il primo tassello, che andranno a comporre un quadro sempre più grande e sofisticato.


I personaggi

MARCO

“...Meh.” -cit.

Dopo aver abbandonato l’università, Marco lavora come commesso al Suppa Market e conduce una vita noiosa e ripetitiva. É goffo ed impacciato e molto spesso finisce in situazioni imbarazzanti, dalle quali esce sempre con l’amaro in bocca. Da qualche anno la sua personalità ha preso una brutta piega, trasformandolo in una persona apatica e cinica. Qualcosa nell’ombra lo sta lentamente divorando, ma cosa?

***

ANIMA

“Voi umani siete tutti uguali, di continuo a lamentarvi senza fare nulla aspettando un qualcosa che vi salvi e vi sollevi dalle vostre sofferenze. Quando verrà il giorno in cui vi prenderete le vostre maledette responsabilità?” -cit.

Cacciatrice di Demoni caotica e imprevedibile. Anima porta distruzione, disinteressandosi delle conseguenze sugli esseri umani che, anzi, disprezza. A differenza dei suoi colleghi, non mira a distruggere i Demoni, bensì ad ammansirli e farli passare dalla sua parte, garantendole potere e protezione. È impulsiva ed infantile e sebbene le sue doti siano molte, è assolutamente negata a relazionarsi con il prossimo.

***

HORMON

“Non c’è abbastanza zucchero!” -cit.

Dal carattere altezzoso e dispotico, Hormon è una Musa, Demone che vive a stretto contatto con gli esseri umani e che ha sviluppato una personalità ed un ego propri. Trae forza dall’energia che scaturisce dalle persone in preda a forti emozioni e dai quintali di zucchero che ingerisce ogni giorno (preferibilmente sotto forma di marshmellow); è in grado di intervenire sugli stati emotivi altrui dando un improvviso senso di benessere seguito da un boost di energia. Si diverte a giocare con le emozioni delle persone, in particolare stimolandone la libido, dalle quali trae poi nutrimento. Sebbene il suo aspetto sia carino e coccoloso e inciti allo spupazzamento, vi conviene non allungare troppo le mani: morde.

***

OBLAK & NEBE

“Se voi seguiste le regole, il nostro intervento non sarebbe necessario.” -cit. Oblak

Gemelle estremamente legate, Oblak e Nebe sono state cresciute ed istruite per diventare dei sicari di alto livello. Eseguono sempre ogni missione in modo perfetto, quasi fossero dei robot, e sono estremamente devote al loro superiore. Seppure agiscano sempre in sincrono, chi ha l’iniziativa tra le due è Oblak, che dimostra di avere il carattere che invece a Nebe sembra mancare del tutto. Ultimamente sono sulle tracce di Anima che gli ha procurato non pochi problemi, macchiando il loro curriculum perfetto.

***

ALASTOR

“L’equilibrio è alla base dell’esistenza, va preservato ad ogni costo e per questo importanti scelte devono essere fatte. Se non siete in grado di giudicare, allora io mi farò giudice per voi. Affidate a me le vostre vite.” -cit.

Conosciuta come la “Strega di metallo” Alastor è un eterna guerriera, reputata da molti una semi divinità. Persegue il concetto di giustizia ed equità come nessun altro e non ha pietà per chiunque le sia d’intralcio; alcuni dicono che per il bene di questi ideali abbia gettato via il suo stesso cuore. Appartiene ad un’organizzazione che preserva e protegge la razza umana, ma, seppure riceva ordini, il suo giudizio sul campo di battaglia è del tutto imparziale. Agisce prevalentemente in solitaria, ma da qualche tempo ha un paio di apprendiste ai suoi comandi, le uniche che sono riuscite a sopravvivere al suo metodo disumano.

***


RAMA

“Dov’è il divertimento se non c’è sfida?” cit.

Considerato un genio, Rama è un cacciatore di Demoni dalla bravura eccezionale, ma dal carattere impossibile. Accetta solo incarichi se interessanti e/o se pagato profumatamente, non si fa problemi ad abbandonare una missione se la ritiene sotto ai suoi standard di “sfida” e non ha alcun rispetto per le persone che non siano per lui fonte di divertimento.  Seppure i suoi fan (e le sue amanti) siano numerosi, conduce una vita solitaria accompagnato da Hāthī, un pupazzo automa che lui stesso ha creato e che gli funge da segretaria personale. Questa, oltre ad organizzare l’agenda e gestire i contatti, tiene conto di tutte le uscite videoludiche nel periodo lavorativo di Rama, le quali quest’ultimo recupererà richiudendosi in casa per mesi, giocando fino al completismo più estremo.

***


TESLA

“Ah. Ho rotto di nuovo Internet.” -cit

Individuo molto ambiguo, Tesla è una tra le personalità più di spicco nella ricerca sul rapporto Demone/uomo e senza dubbio la più controversa. È stato accusato più volte di tradimento e diffamazione, ma i risultati delle sue ricerche sono così importanti da renderlo praticamente intoccabile. Protetto da una famosa organizzazione, conduce esperimenti sugli esseri umani, alla ricerca della Verità: la chiave che porterà all’evoluzione. Per quanto il suo operato potrebbe far trasparire l’opposto, Tesla ama incredibilmente gli esseri umani e passa molto del suo tempo a interagirvi su Internet: se per caso vi imbattete in grossi dibattiti e fenomeni virali, quasi sicuramente nell’occhio del ciclone c’è lui.

***

MAMAN

“AHAHAHAHAHAHAH!!!” -cit

Maman è una guaritrice molto famosa e con una lista d’attesa quasi interminabile. Con le sue terapie ha salvato non poche vite, tra cui quelle di personaggi famosi e potenti. Sempre positiva, il suo motto è “la guarigione inizia sempre con una sana risata” e la sua, in particolare, scalda gli animi più tristi. La si può considerare il sindaco del Borgo, luogo incantato e in continua trasformazione, dove vivono molti Demoni e personaggi particolari, tra cui la stessa Anima. Come quest’ultima, anche Maman ha la capacità di legare con i Demoni e uno tra questi è talmente potente da essere la base su cui poggia l’intero Borgo.

***

MOMO & PAPILLON

“Doppio High five dell’amicizia!!!” -cit.

Migliori amiche da sempre, Momo e Papillon appartengono alle due famiglie rivali del Borgo: quella dei Gatti del porto e quella dei Procioni del quartiere commerciale. Momo  ha un carattere dolce e gentile, lavora come cameriera e ragazza delle consegne per il Ramen-ten della madre e quando ha tempo va ad aiutare lo zio al Sushi-ya. Papillon  ha un carattere forte e altruista, lavora al supermercato di famiglia, ma è più il tempo che perde in giro a divertirsi che quello che impegna effettivamente a lavorare. Nonostante le continue lamentele da parte dei parenti, ad entrambe piace trasformarsi in esseri umani perchè lo trovano divertente e comodo. Tutte e due sono le candidate numero uno per succedere al posto di capofamiglia: riusciranno a rappacificare le acque tra i clan?

***

SIRIO

“Cacciatori di Demoni, Streghe, Stregoni, Pirati Spaziali, ne ho abbastanza! Sempre a complicare cose che potrebbero essere semplici! Vivere una vita normale vi è così difficile?” -cit.

Apparentemente scontroso, ma dal cuore d’oro, Sirio lavora presso il Sushi-ya di Sakana-san come apprendista. Non sta mai con le mani in mano e passa il suo tempo libero ad aiutare gli abitanti del Borgo in difficoltà: è praticamente un tuttofare. Non mostra minimamente interesse per le mirabolanti avventure di Anima, anzi, il solo sentirne parlare lo irrita profondamente. Seppure sia abituato a convivere con il surreale, Sirio ama le cose semplici e trova che la vera felicità sia nell’ordinario, assieme alle persone care. È strano che una persona del genere si ritrovi al Borgo, non vi pare? Forse in lui si nasconde molto di più che un semplice apprendista cuoco.

***

KIM

“Provate anche solo a sfiorare la mia roba e vi troverete rivoltati dentro per fuori. Io vi ho avvertito.” -cit.

Kim è una programmatrice e si occupa di gestire la struttura del Borgo, impedendo che il suo continuo mutare lo porti al collasso. È estremamente schietta e distaccata, ha una pazienza senza pari e riesce a mantenere la calma anche nelle situazioni più difficili. Possiede un repertorio di imprecazioni pressoché immenso che usa a pieno regime quando arriva al limite di sopportazione con determinate persone o quando gioca ai MMORPG. Abita assieme a Maman, Anima ed Hormon nella Prima Casa. La si può considerare il vice sindaco del Borgo.

***

L’OMBRA

“Sei una persona mediocre e questo è l’unico modo in cui puoi sopravvivere. Credi in me ed io non ti lascerò mai solo.”

Il Demone che si nasconde nell’ombra di Marco. Funge da ripostiglio e trattiene dentro di sé tutte le paure ed il dolore del ragazzo, in cambio della sua energia. L’Ombra è la materializzazione del fardello del passato che Marco si trascina appresso impedendogli di vivere serenamente. Riuscirà il ragazzo a liberarsene o soccomberà sotto il suo peso? 

Il progetto

Anima affonda le radici estetiche in tutto quello scenario magico che spazia dal mondo dei videogiochi, Kingdom Hearts e Zelda in primis, al mondo dell’animazione: Evangelion, Kill la Kill, Gurren Lagann sono alcuni dei progetti più cari all’autrice. 
Lo stile tipicamente orientale e il gusto per la cultura del Sol Levante sono da sempre stati fonte d’ispirazione: nelle tavole respiriamo la delicatezza e il sapore del maestro Miyazaki ma anche forti rimandi a opere della Gainax come FLCL e Punta al Top 2! Diebuster. 
Molti stimoli anche da produzioni americane come Adventure Time e Steven Universe, dove elementi inverosimili e magia la fanno da padrone.

Anima sarà un albo cartonato a colori, di 92 pagine in formato 21 x 29,7 cm.

Un libro coordinato da Tatai Lab, ormai una garanzia di qualità nel mondo delle auto-produzioni targate Crowdfunding.


Come useremo questi fondi

Anima e' stato disegnato da Chiara e colorato da Lorenzo durante questi ultimi mesi, grazie al supporto del Tatai Lab 
Si tratta di 92 pagine ed e' tutto pronto, dobbiamo solo raccogliere i soldi per stampare e spedire.

I fondi verranno usati nel seguente modo:

  • € 700 per le tasse e Indiegogo
  • € 5.000 per la stampa e i gadget
  • € 1.300 per la spedizione

Come posso aiutare?

Puoi aiutarci supportando il progetto o anche solamente condividendo la pagina Indiegogo sui diversi social network. Segui i nostri account: Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/KnowWhoYouAreAnima 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/WhoYouAreAnima 
Instagram: https://instagram.com/animaproject/ 
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/tatailab
story_txt:
Note for English people: unfortunately this campaign is reserved only to Italian people (due to limited budget). In case of overfunding we will evaluate to release an English version and for information write to info@tatailab.com 



Menu
Introduzione
I Perks
La storia
I personaggi
Il progetto
Come useremo questi fondi?
Come possiamo aiutare?



Introduzione

Ciao a tutti, mi chiamo Chiara e sono qui per presentare il mio progetto, Anima.

Ho iniziato a lavorare a questo fumetto alcuni anni fa e quando ho incontrato Emanuele Tenderini e Linda Cavallini, gli autori di Lumina, ho deciso di provare la strada del crowdfunding.Inizialmente avevamo provato a realizzare una campagna su Kickstarter, ma il budget richiesto era troppo alto, però dagli errori si impara, non ci siamo arresi e così abbiamo deciso di riprovarci, ripromettendo la campagna e riducendo il budget al minimo (investendo anche qualche risparmio nella realizzazione).Quindi, aiutata dal Tatai Lab, sono felice di presentarvi...ANIMA è un fumetto di genere fantastico, ricco di personalità, emozione, colori e follia. Libro d’esordio di Chiara Zuliani, giovanissima autrice tout-court che ha curato ogni aspetto della sua idea: dal soggetto, alla sceneggiatura, dal disegno al colore.Stilisticamente riconducibile ai moderni codici orientali, con un segno fresco che strizza l’occhio agli anime e un’impostazione narrativa tanto europea quanto giapponese, Anima è un libro vivace, fresco, pulsante.
I Perks
BOOK - Il libro a fumetti di Anima (92 pagine di colori formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) - IL LIBRO E' GIA' PRONTO!BOOK + USB - Il Libro + una chiavetta USB 3d raffigurante il personaggio di Hormon realizzata da Maikii (contenente illustrazioni, disegni, wip e tanto altro)BOOK + T-Shirt - Libro + T-Shirt a tiratura limitata realizzate da Kingyo Sukui 

BOOK + CUSTOM A4 - Libro + Commission personalizzata, in B&N in A4

BOOK + CUSTOM A3 - Libro + Commission personalizzata, in B&N in A3


BOOK + ORIGINAL - Libro + Tavola Originale di Anima

BOOK + SKETCHBOOK - Libro + Sketchbook 17,4 x 12,2 cm contenente 20 pagine di sketch e disegni originali di Chiara!


La storia
In questo primo libro seguiamo la storia di Marco, ragazzo incastrato in un’ossessiva e deprimente routine, che all’improvviso viene catapultato in una realtà alternativa, il Borgo, un luogo fantastico abitato da strane creature magiche dove la realtà è in continua e vorticosa trasformazione.
Anima, una caotica “cacciatrice di demoni”, costringerà il protagonista a confrontarsi con le sue più profonde paure, in un’oscura lotta che lo metterà di fronte ai suoi demoni interiori, con lo scopo di vincerli per diventare una persona nuova.
Tema portante del libro è la presa di coscienza sui propri limiti e il superamento di questi ultimi.
Nella sua completezza, Anima è un lavoro immenso e profondo: nel corso dei diversi volumi, conosceremo diversi protagonisti ognuno con i propri problemi e le proprie divertenti psicopatie. Un puzzle di personalità, di cui Marco è il primo tassello, che andranno a comporre un quadro sempre più grande e sofisticato.

I personaggi



MARCO
“...Meh.” -cit.
Dopo aver abbandonato l’università, Marco lavora come commesso al Suppa
Market e conduce una vita noiosa e ripetitiva. É goffo ed impacciato e molto
spesso finisce in situazioni imbarazzanti, dalle quali esce sempre con l’amaro
in bocca. Da qualche anno la sua personalità ha preso una brutta piega,
trasformandolo in una persona apatica e cinica. Qualcosa nell’ombra lo sta
lentamente divorando, ma cosa?
***


ANIMA
“Voi umani siete tutti uguali, di continuo a lamentarvi senza fare
nulla aspettando un qualcosa che vi salvi e vi sollevi dalle vostre sofferenze.
Quando verrà il giorno in cui vi prenderete le vostre maledette
responsabilità?” -cit.
Cacciatrice di Demoni caotica e imprevedibile. Anima porta distruzione,
disinteressandosi delle conseguenze sugli esseri umani che, anzi, disprezza. A
differenza dei suoi colleghi, non mira a distruggere i Demoni, bensì ad
ammansirli e farli passare dalla sua parte, garantendole potere e protezione. È impulsiva ed infantile e sebbene le sue doti siano molte, è assolutamente
negata a relazionarsi con il prossimo.
***


HORMON
“Non c’è abbastanza zucchero!” -cit.
Dal carattere altezzoso e dispotico, Hormon è una Musa, Demone che vive
a stretto contatto con gli esseri umani e che ha sviluppato una personalità ed
un ego propri. Trae forza dall’energia che scaturisce dalle persone in preda a
forti emozioni e dai quintali di zucchero che ingerisce ogni giorno
(preferibilmente sotto forma di marshmellow); è in grado di intervenire sugli
stati emotivi altrui dando un improvviso senso di benessere seguito da un boost
di energia. Si diverte a giocare con le emozioni delle persone, in particolare
stimolandone la libido, dalle quali trae poi nutrimento. Sebbene il suo aspetto
sia carino e coccoloso e inciti allo spupazzamento, vi conviene non allungare
troppo le mani: morde.

***

OBLAK & NEBE
“Se voi seguiste le regole, il nostro intervento non sarebbe
necessario.” -cit. Oblak
Gemelle estremamente legate, Oblak e Nebe sono state cresciute ed
istruite per diventare dei sicari di alto livello. Eseguono sempre ogni
missione in modo perfetto, quasi fossero dei robot, e sono estremamente devote
al loro superiore. Seppure agiscano sempre in sincrono, chi ha l’iniziativa tra
le due è Oblak, che dimostra di avere il carattere che invece a Nebe sembra
mancare del tutto. Ultimamente sono sulle tracce di Anima che gli ha procurato
non pochi problemi, macchiando il loro curriculum perfetto.

***

ALASTOR
“L’equilibrio è alla base dell’esistenza, va preservato ad ogni costo e
per questo importanti scelte devono essere fatte. Se non siete in grado di
giudicare, allora io mi farò giudice per voi. Affidate a me le vostre vite.”
-cit.
Conosciuta come la “Strega di metallo” Alastor è un eterna guerriera,
reputata da molti una semi divinità. Persegue il concetto di giustizia ed
equità come nessun altro e non ha pietà per chiunque le sia d’intralcio; alcuni
dicono che per il bene di questi ideali abbia gettato via il suo stesso cuore.
Appartiene ad un’organizzazione che preserva e protegge la razza umana, ma,
seppure riceva ordini, il suo giudizio sul campo di battaglia è del tutto
imparziale. Agisce prevalentemente in solitaria, ma da qualche tempo ha un paio
di apprendiste ai suoi comandi, le uniche che sono riuscite a sopravvivere al
suo metodo disumano.

***

RAMA
“Dov’è il divertimento se non c’è sfida?” cit.
Considerato un genio, Rama è un cacciatore di Demoni dalla bravura
eccezionale, ma dal carattere impossibile. Accetta solo incarichi se
interessanti e/o se pagato profumatamente, non si fa problemi ad abbandonare
una missione se la ritiene sotto ai suoi standard di “sfida” e non ha alcun
rispetto per le persone che non siano per lui fonte di divertimento.  Seppure i suoi fan (e le sue amanti) siano
numerosi, conduce una vita solitaria accompagnato da Hāthī, un pupazzo automa
che lui stesso ha creato e che gli funge da segretaria personale. Questa, oltre
ad organizzare l’agenda e gestire i contatti, tiene conto di tutte le uscite
videoludiche nel periodo lavorativo di Rama, le quali quest’ultimo recupererà
richiudendosi in casa per mesi, giocando fino al completismo più estremo.

***

TESLA
“Ah. Ho rotto di nuovo Internet.” -cit
Individuo molto ambiguo, Tesla è una tra le personalità più di spicco
nella ricerca sul rapporto Demone/uomo e senza dubbio la più controversa. È
stato accusato più volte di tradimento e diffamazione, ma i risultati delle sue

ciclone c’è lui.

***

story:
Dawn Hughes and the Rise of Eve Fantastic takes place in the cutthroat and prestigious Atwood School for the Arts, where everyone is vying for a piece of the spotlight. DAWN HUGHES, 17, is an insecure high school senior who is always the stage manager, never the star, although she desperately wants to be noticed. She decides she has been ignored by her crush, ZACH ZELENY, 17, and humiliated by the school’s primadonna, HALEY HAWKINS, 17, for the last time, and in a moment of bravery and glitter, her superhero alter ego EVE FANTASTIC is born. Eve is the polar opposite of Dawn; she’s exciting and forthcoming and refuses to take no for an answer, and most importantly, with her powers of electric eye contact, everyone notices her. But when Eve goes too far, it’s Dawn that has to pick up the pieces of her life. After losing her best friend, LEAH LAZARUS, 17, usurping the lead role in the winter musical, and stealing test answers, Dawn realizes that being noticed isn’t everything. Two personalities become one as Dawn learns to channel the best parts of Eve while remaining true to herself.

Dawn Hughes & the Rise of Eve Fantastic will be the complete multi-media experience. We are going to seamlessly join live-action and comic to tell our story. We will be producing a hybrid webcomic and web-series. In the webcomic, readers will see panels with a PLAY button. These panels will activate short live-action episodes that are cohesive with the comic. Our live action episodes will be shot by the exceptionally talented cinematographer Dakota Wotton and will feature music from Toronto girl power rock band, Pins & Needles.

Dawn and Eve’s story will not only exist online, we will be creating a limited edition printed comic. When you read the tangible print comic, you can access the live episodes with our customized QR codes using your smart devices.

Our goal is to have Dawn Hughes and her friends exist online, in film and in print!

We are Sketchy Content Productions. Our team is extremely passionate and capable of bringing this project to life.

Yona Strauss
Co-Writer and Director
Super Hero Alter Ego: Dame Dehaan
Yona has been dreaming up this project for over a year and could not be more excited to see it come alive. Her other interests include digital media, documentary production and standup comedy.

 

Izzy Ahrbeck
Co-Writer and Producer
Super Hero Alter Ego: Winona Wunderkind
Izzy has had a passion for film since receiving her first box set of Woody Allen films (perhaps a bit prematurely). This past summer, Izzy thrived in a bustling production office working on the NBC/Universal show, Eyewitness. When she isn’t working on a production and feels a little adventurous, Izzy loves to watch Narcos without English subtitles.

 

Katie Burns
Illustrator and Art Director
Super Hero Alter Ego: Aurora Ace
Katie is an illustrator and cartoon enthusiast. This past summer she had the pleasure of working at Nelvana studios on Max & Ruby and Zhuzhu Pets. When she’s not in the studio she can be found riding her bike and drinking hot coffee at the same time (not recommended).

 

Tate Brombal
Comic Book Writer and Assistant Art Director
Super Hero Alter Ego: The Incredible Tot
Tate has been an avid comic book reader since he was 11-years-old and loves the X-men more than most people. While he has scripted television and film media before, this is his first time scripting a comic (and he is excited!!). He drinks a lot of tea and espresso. He wants a kitten. He reads too much.

 

Kristin Saddy
Post Production Supervisor and Casting Director
Super Hero Alter Ego: Elizabeth Electric
Kristin has had a passion for film and television starting when she was six months old and couldn’t fall asleep until after the Friends episode. Kristin has worked in a variety of forms of production, from radio intern, to social media liaison, to editor’s assistant, and she’s extremely excited to take part in the web comic/web series hybrid. In her spare time, Kristin likes to snuggle with her cat and eat pizza.

 

Eric Sleeth
Marketing Director
Super Hero Alter Ego: Dr. Hex
Since Eric was young, he has enjoyed the stories people tell through film and television; from comedy to Sci-Fi, horror to action and everything in between. He was always facsinated by how these stories were sold and marketed to audiences to drive interest. He is excited to be part of the Sketchy Content team and wants to get audiences as excited about Dawn Hughes as he is. Eric is also an enthusiast of a life well lived.

 

John Sullivan
Audio Director
Super Hero Alter Ego: Mr. Man
John Sullivan is the director of audio for Dawn Hughes and the Rise of Eve Fantastic. He has previously worked with the Truth and Reconciliation Commission as a live stream administrator, and is also the program director of RTA’s SPIRITLive radio. He is very excited to bring Eve Fantastic to life!

 

Sarah Thomas
Production Manager
Super Hero Alter Ego: Scarlett Queen
Sarah has been obsessed with all things pop culture since the very first time she ever saw Ferris Bueller dance on top of a float at the age of four. Being an Aries, leadership is something Sarah loves, so taking on the role of Production Manager for this exciting project has been a dream. Her favourite accessory is always a book and at any given time you can find her reading when she should be working (shh don’t tell anyone).

To make this comic hybrid a reality, your support is crucial. Your generous donations will aid in:

  • Create the website to host the web-comic and videos
  • Rent professional grade equipment to create high quality videos
  • Purchase and create colourful wardrobe to match our quirky aesthetic
  • Feed our lovely crew on set
  • Cover location permit costs
  • Print the comic. Printing costs can be expensive, and we want to print a high quality comic for our backers and fans. The more money can we get, the more comics we can print!
  • And more!

We have some awesome gifts to show some love to those who back us. We believe our backers deserve great prizes that were made with thought and care from our team.

  • $5 - Social Media Shout Out: Every little bit helps and for your help we will show you our appreciation on our social media.
  • $10 - Eve Fantastic Postcard: Get an Eve Fantastic Post Card, created by our Illustrator and a social media shout out
  • $20 - Super Sticker Pack: Get a pack of different Dawn Hughes and Eve Fantastic Stickers and a social media shout out. You can put them on your laptop, phones, or around your city!
  • $25 - Fantastic T-Shirt: We want you to rep our production! Wear our custom designed shirt to be designed by our own illustrator.
  • $50 - Print Comic: You will receive 1 of the 200 limited edition print comics.
  • $85 -  Print Comic + Perk Bundle: You will receive 1 of the 200 limited edition print comics as well as a bundle of the previous perks!
  • $100 - Autographed Illustration of Favourite Character + Perk Bundle: You will get an illustration of your favourite character signed by the actor, as well as a bundle of the previous perks!
  • $150 - Thank You in the Credits + Perk Bundle: Your name will appear on screen as the credits roll. As well, you will receive a bundle of the previous perks!
  • $500 -  Custom Drawing + Perk Bundle: Our Illustrator will draw you as a character in the Eve Fantastic world, and you will also receive a bundle of the previous perks!
  • $1000 - Executive Producer Credit + Perk Bundle : Get your name up on the screen as an Executive Producer! And also get a bundle of the previous perks!

 

Be sure to follow @SketchyContent on Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, and Twitter to get the latest updates and behind the scenes on our journey to making this a reality.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
story_txt:
Dawn Hughes and the Rise of Eve Fantastic takes place in the cutthroat and prestigious Atwood School for the Arts, where everyone is vying for a piece of the spotlight. DAWN HUGHES, 17, is an insecure high school senior who is always the stage manager, never the star, although she desperately wants to be noticed. She decides she has been ignored by her crush, ZACH ZELENY, 17, and humiliated by the school’s primadonna, HALEY HAWKINS, 17, for the last time, and in a moment of bravery and glitter, her superhero alter ego EVE FANTASTIC is born. Eve is the polar opposite of Dawn; she’s exciting and forthcoming and refuses to take no for an answer, and most importantly, with her powers of electric eye contact, everyone notices her. But when Eve goes too far, it’s Dawn that has to pick up the pieces of her life. After losing her best friend, LEAH LAZARUS, 17, usurping the lead role in the winter musical, and stealing test answers, Dawn realizes that being noticed isn’t everything. Two personalities become one as Dawn learns to channel the best parts of Eve while remaining true to herself.Dawn Hughes & the Rise of Eve Fantastic will be the complete multi-media experience. We are going to seamlessly join live-action and comic to tell our story. We will be producing a hybrid webcomic and web-series. In the webcomic, readers will see panels with a PLAY button. These panels will activate short live-action episodes that are cohesive with the comic. Our live action episodes will be shot by the exceptionally talented cinematographer Dakota Wotton and will feature music from Toronto girl power rock band, Pins & Needles.Dawn and Eve’s story will not only exist online, we will be creating a limited edition printed comic. When you read the tangible print comic, you can access the live episodes with our customized QR codes using your smart devices.Our goal is to have Dawn Hughes and her friends exist online, in film and in print!We are Sketchy Content Productions. Our team is extremely passionate and capable of bringing this project to life.Yona StraussCo-Writer and DirectorSuper Hero Alter Ego: Dame DehaanYona has been dreaming up this project for over a year and could not be more excited to see it come alive. Her other interests include digital media, documentary production and standup comedy. Izzy AhrbeckCo-Writer and ProducerSuper Hero Alter Ego: Winona WunderkindIzzy has had a passion for film since receiving her first box set of Woody Allen films (perhaps a bit prematurely). This past summer, Izzy thrived in a bustling production office working on the NBC/Universal show, Eyewitness. When she isn’t working on a production and feels a little adventurous, Izzy loves to watch Narcos without English subtitles. Katie BurnsIllustrator and Art DirectorSuper Hero Alter Ego: Aurora AceKatie is an illustrator and cartoon enthusiast. This past summer she had the pleasure of working at Nelvana studios on Max & Ruby and Zhuzhu Pets. When she’s not in the studio she can be found riding her bike and drinking hot coffee at the same time (not recommended). Tate BrombalComic Book Writer and Assistant Art DirectorSuper Hero Alter Ego: The Incredible TotTate has been an avid comic book reader since he was 11-years-old and loves the X-men more than most people. While he has scripted television and film media before, this is his first time scripting a comic (and he is excited!!). He drinks a lot of tea and espresso. He wants a kitten. He reads too much. Kristin SaddyPost Production Supervisor and Casting DirectorSuper Hero Alter Ego: Elizabeth ElectricKristin has had a passion for film and television starting when she was six months old and couldn’t fall asleep until after the Friends episode. Kristin has worked in a variety of forms of production, from radio intern, to social media liaison, to editor’s assistant, and she’s extremely excited to take part in the web comic/web series hybrid. In her spare time, Kristin likes to snuggle with her cat and eat pizza. Eric SleethMarketing DirectorSuper Hero Alter Ego: Dr. HexSince Eric was young, he has enjoyed the stories people tell through film and television; from comedy to Sci-Fi, horror to action and everything in between. He was always facsinated by how these stories were sold and marketed to audiences to drive interest. He is excited to be part of the Sketchy Content team and wants to get audiences as excited about Dawn Hughes as he is. Eric is also an enthusiast of a life well lived. John SullivanAudio DirectorSuper Hero Alter Ego: Mr. ManJohn Sullivan is the director of audio for Dawn Hughes and the Rise of Eve Fantastic. He has previously worked with the Truth and Reconciliation Commission as a live stream administrator, and is also the program director of RTA’s SPIRITLive radio. He is very excited to bring Eve Fantastic to life! Sarah ThomasProduction ManagerSuper Hero Alter Ego: Scarlett QueenSarah has been obsessed with all things pop culture since the very first time she ever saw Ferris Bueller dance on top of a float at the age of four. Being an Aries, leadership is something Sarah loves, so taking on the role of Production Manager for this exciting project has been a dream. Her favourite accessory is always a book and at any given time you can find her reading when she should be working (shh don’t tell anyone).To make this comic hybrid a reality, your support is crucial. Your generous donations will aid in:
Create the website to host the web-comic and videos
Rent professional grade equipment to create high quality videos
Purchase and create colourful wardrobe to match our quirky aesthetic
Feed our lovely crew on set
Cover location permit costs
Print the comic. Printing costs can be expensive, and we want to print a high quality comic for our backers and fans. The more money can we get, the more comics we can print!
And more!
We have some awesome gifts to show some love to those who back us. We believe our backers deserve great prizes that were made with thought and care from our team.
$5 - Social Media Shout Out: Every little bit helps and for your help we will show you our appreciation on our social media.
$10 - Eve Fantastic Postcard: Get an Eve Fantastic Post Card, created by our Illustrator and a social media shout out
$20 - Super Sticker Pack: Get a pack of different Dawn Hughes and Eve Fantastic Stickers and a social media shout out. You can put them on your laptop, phones, or around your city!
$25 - Fantastic T-Shirt: We want you to rep our production! Wear our custom designed shirt to be designed by our own illustrator.
$50 - Print Comic: You will receive 1 of the 200 limited edition print comics.
$85 -  Print Comic + Perk Bundle: You will receive 1 of the 200 limited edition print comics as well as a bundle of the previous perks!
$100 - Autographed Illustration of Favourite Character + Perk Bundle: You will get an illustration of your favourite character signed by the actor, as well as a bundle of the previous perks!
$150 - Thank You in the Credits + Perk Bundle: Your name will appear on screen as the credits roll. As well, you will receive a bundle of the previous perks!
$500 -  Custom Drawing + Perk Bundle: Our Illustrator will draw you as a character in the Eve Fantastic world, and you will also receive a bundle of the previous perks!
$1000 - Executive Producer Credit + Perk Bundle : Get your name up on the screen as an Executive Producer! And also get a bundle of the previous perks!

story:
Who is The Holdup?

The Holdup is Andrew Glick, Jake Minton, Ian Carr, Hayley Huntley, and Devin Field. We met at USC and fell in love. A little later -- two years ago this month! -- we started an improv group and hired a coach to take our improv skills to the moon.

What's going on?

We're heading to the Out of Bounds Comedy Festival in Austin, TX!

What the heck?

You heard us! After our 12-week winning streak at UCB Cagematch, we submitted a video to the Out of Bounds festival and were selected to perform alongside acts from all over the country!  

When though?

Labor Day weekend -- September 3rd through the 6th! More like Labor of LOVE Day!

How are you getting to Austin?

We're flying on the discount (but dependable) air carrier Southwest!

Where are you staying?

We booked a one-bedroom AirBnB and lied to the lady about having a fifth person! The max is 4!

That sounds expensive!

It's expensive compared to not going, but we've found very reasonable options for traveling, and we know we can swing this thing.

Why do you want to go?

It's not "financially smart" to be a performer or "fiscally responsible" to take your unpaid act on the road, but we're so crazy f***ing passionate about this group, and we feel like we continue to grow and grow in this undeniable way that's exciting and worth pursuing. In Austin, we're going to put our group on a stage in front of strangers for the first time -- no Trojans in the audience, no significant others, no Wednesday Nite Cagematch Crew -- just us, a brand new crowd, and the sound of tumbleweeds rolling on through to the next town. Out of Bounds is going to be so valuable to our growth as performers, and it's an honor to get in this festival, and we're dying to go.

How can I help?

We'll take any support you want to give -- from a couple dollars to a recommendation for great Tex Mex. On August 29th, we're throwing a special event in Los Angeles to fundraise -- and you'll get that invite -- but maybe you're not in LA. Maybe you're a dad or a work friend of a mom. Perhaps you're an old college friend who moved to the opposite coast and would totally come to the show if you could. Maybe you're a venture capitalist tired of hitting it big-time with investments that offer wow-level returns. Maybe you're a sorority with an unspent philanthropy budget and a guilty conscience from that prank-turned-federal offense. Whoever you are, if you're reading this, you're probably already one of the people who makes the Holdup the most supported improv team to ever walk this Earth, so thanks already. Thank you.  

What will my money pay for?

  • 5 Plane tickets @ $240 each = $1120
  • 3 Nights at an AirBnB = $880

What will my money NOT pay for?

  • Tequila Shots
  • Breakfast Tacos
  • Bail

story:
The Nerd King Needs YOUR Help!

Max, or the Nerd King as his annoying sister Tabi calls him, is half-way done Diary of a Nerd King Season 3.  Episodes 1 to 4 are finished and available on Amazon, but Max  needs someone to finish the illustrations for Episodes 5 to 8.  

With someone else to do the illustrations, Max will be able to concentrate on writing each of the new episodes and get them finished faster so that thousands of Nerd King fans won’t be kept waiting for the next episodes.  You know what they say... don’t stand in the way of getting the kids reading! :-)



What’s that?  You haven’t met Max yet?  Ok Max, better introduce yourself...

(here’s Max intro from the first book in the Diary of a Nerd King series)



“My name is Max Ridgemont. My sister says I'm the Nerd King. I resent that. She says I resemble that. She thinks she's so smart. Wait til I'm famous from inventing a burping machine.

This is my diary, except it's not a diary. It's a journal, or a blog, or a log... just not a diary 'cause diaries are for girls and wimpy kids. There's also a lot of wicked awesome pictures I drew in here too. Don't feel bad if you can't draw as well as I can. Most people can't.

Oh yeah, my best friend Boogie and I are going to make millions with our new YouTube channel, and our plan is in here too. DON'T try and copy us. You'll just get upset when you don't make a million dollars and find out you're not as awesome as us.”

Max and I were really lucky with the release of the original Diary of a Nerd King.  It climbed the charts quickly on Amazon and hit #1 several times within weeks when we did a FREE e-book promo on Amazon.  

Diary of a Nerd King continued to climb the charts, fighting with the big guys in the graphic novel category like Dork Diaries, Big Nate, and Diary of a Wimpy Kid, and it managed to hold it's own, getting as high as #3 on the Top 100 Paid Kindle chart.  

Pretty AWESOME for an Indie book to be competing with and beating these other BIG name books from BIG name publishers!!!

Then came the second book, except we decided to shake things up.  We turned Diary of a Nerd King into a serial.  That’s right, just like your favorite tv show, Diary of a Nerd King came out with a new episode every week or so.  


Best of all, each new episode was only 99 cents!  The kids loved it.

Half-way through Season 2, we released Episodes 1-4 as a set, and when Episodes 5-8 were finished, we released them as a set.  

We also released the complete Season 2 Episodes 1 to 8 at that time too!

And then Max went on vacation with Boogie for March break, and as usual, they had some crazy wicked awesome adventures so of course we couldn’t keep the kids waiting.  We released Diary of a Nerd King 2 ½ The Greatest March Break Ever!



And once he was back from vacation, you guessed it!  We started in on Diary of a Nerd King Season 3!









And that brings us to now.  We want to bring a professional illustrator on board to do the illustrations for E5-8.  By doing so, we’ll bring the quality up to a whole new level, and we’ll be able to speed up the release schedule for the final episodes of Season 3.  

We’ve been in touch with some top notch illustrators, and we need about $125 to $150 per episode to pay for the illustrations.  Each episode has around 22-26 illustrations, so this is actually really reasonable for professional work!

If we pass the goal of $500.00, we’ll use the money to fund the illustrations for additional episodes of Diary of a Nerd King, and everyone who contributed at the $20 and up will get these additional episodes at no charge as part of our thank you for your much appreciated support.

Diary of a Nerd King has done really well on Amazon, and we’ve been humbled by it’s success.  It’s great to hear the feedback from all the kids who have loved the series, and it’s even better to think that we’re helping to get kids reading!

We really appreciate any contribution you can make, and you can take a double thank you for helping to get kids reading!  

If you can’t afford to contribute financially, we would still REALLY appreciate your support by helping spread the word about the Diary of a Nerd King Indiegogo campaign and the Diary of a Nerd King e-book series on Amazon!  You can use the share tools right below the video at the top of this page.  And thank you for your help!
