story:
In the future, as the 1% becomes the .001% - all of societies problems continue to spiral out of control.  Desperate measures are passed, but each has their own repercussions.  When firearms are made illegal, genetic modifications are perfected and become the norm.  Canine based mods are most prolific, and 'hounds' roam the streets.

So, in a world where super powers are for sale, can a normal, unmodded man hold his own?  William Keyes is a contractor (A field dominated by heavily modded experts), but has seen the harm that testing the mods caused.  He has stayed 'norm', and now competes in a field where he is massively outclassed. 

When a valuable case falls into Will's hands, he finds himself under pursuit from all sides. Can an unmodded contractor stay ahead of the pack? The chase is on!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A lot happens behind the scenes of what happens on the page.  The movies, starting with Fixer, will give you another perspective and let you see the man behind the curtain.  Many forces are at work in the world, and the movies will reveal many things that the comics do not. 

Currently, we are working with a single animator, Ryan Swain.  In addition to the web comic, Ryan is creating motion comic shorts that will be used as cut scenes within the feature film 'Fixer' - firmly rooting the two narratives into the same world. 

  • Ryan needs to upgrade some of his software to better generate the animated sequences, as well as having the tools to complete the work on the comic, the movie, and all of the perks as well. 
  • As you get involved in the comic, we will send a digital copy of 'Fixer' - in addition to art from the comic, or even immortalizing you into the world of Hounded by using your likeness to inspire a character in the comic.
  • Work has already begun, and the funds raised here will be focused on equipment needed for the best execution possible of the art (or motion art).


We have already ran a successful campaign, raising a third of the budget for the tie-in feature film.  Work continues on all fronts - and you can make a difference! 

We are building a franchise, with one movie in active development, and five more outlined and ready.  The web comic is expanding, and there are a lot of stories to tell.  Together, we can lay the foundation for the future. 


So let's get the word out!  Share this campaign, find us on Facebook, check out the movie on IMDb, and keep checking back.  I will continue to post more updates and development.  This is going to be fun!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

An early concept sketch of the hero of Hounded, Will.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A look at a patient following a failed mod surgery.  Failed surgery patients are known as 'scars' - and treated as outcasts.  

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

An early peak at the design for a 'judge'.  The new face of law enforcement.

story:
Classic adventures with a new twist!

Welcome to the new KING SOLOMON'S MINES --a colorful and sexy new 48 page graphic novel by Pablo Marcos & Mark Ellis!

The KING SOLOMON'S MINES graphic novel is a fresh take on H.Rider Haggard's classic tale of adventure and treasure hunting in 19th century Africa.

This adaptation by the team of legendary comics illustrator Pablo (Conan The Barbarian, Tales of the Zombie) Marcos and best-selling author Mark (Outlanders, Doc Savage, Justice Machine) Ellis brings a new and colorful perspective to the Victorian-era yarn.

The KING SOLOMON'S MINES graphic novel by Pablo Marcos and Mark Ellis is just the first of several planned projects (with Ying Ko Graphics) featuring "reimagined" classic adventure heroes. Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's CHALLENGER rendered here by the ever-awesome Jeff Slemons, Jules Verne's NEMO by the uber-talented Steven E Gordon and of course, HR Haggard's QUATERMAIN, by the legendary Pablo Marcos.

 And here's some samples of Pablo's fantastic work for the book...

 The book will be available in 4 formats. A PDF version, a trade paperback version, a signed version of the trade paperback, and a limited signed/numbered hardcover version.

Postage and handling included on all US-based mailing addresses. All foreign-based addresses will have additional shipping charges.


Risks and challenges

The project was a labor of love from two highly regarded professionals. Everyone involved has a proven track record with similar projects. The entire project is complete, going through final production prep, and waiting to go to print. With your help, this book will be published.

 King Solomon's Mines


 
King Solomon's Mines


 The book will be available in 4 formats. A PDF version, a trade paperback version, a signed version of the trade paperback, and a limited signed/numbered hardcover version.


Postage and handling included on all US-based mailing addresses. All
foreign-based addresses will have additional shipping charges.
 


Risks and challenges 
The project was a labor of love from two highly regarded professionals. Everyone involved has a proven track record with similar projects. The entire project is complete, going through final production prep, and waiting to go to print. With your help, this book will be published.

story:
Section 8 Comics Needs YOU!

We at Section 8 Comics are pleased to announce another project that is close to completion. However, as good as this project is, we think it can be better, and with your help we can not only make that happen sooner but make something even greater than we imagined! 

We are excited to present you with Gai-Do Xin!

What is Gaido Xin?

Gaido Xin is about a character named Prey who escapes captivity from an evil corporation known as Bren Werks.  The story follows his escape and his plans to take down the menacing conglomerate and rescue his fellow captives.  This book will be a 32 Page 1 Shot brought to you by an amazing creative crew.
   

  • Marc Rivera - Writer

  • Nadir Balan - Pencils & Inks

  • Tom Chu - Colors

  • Wilson Ramos Jr. - Letters

Who is Section 8 Comics?

Section 8 Comics is an independent comic company that makes up part of 8 Spot Entertainment,  which generates content from weekly podcasts to web-based comic strips. We recently released the premiere issue of Star’s Edge on Comixology, and are promoting other popular titles in our catalog such as Ninja Mouse and Dark Bloods. More importantly Section 8 Comics is made up of fans with their own stories to tell. Business partners Eric Rivera and Wilson Ramos Jr. have over 20 years of comic book experience between them and both love the medium.


     

How You Can Help?

The Book is over 50% done, but due to financial constraints we are having a tough time getting it out as quickly as we would like, so we have turned to a few freelancers to help us finish the book, but quality doesn’t come cheap.  The people we work with are great and they will work out a schedule with us, but with your help we can speed up that schedule.  


And if you can’t contribute, just spread the word. Let people know about the project. Comics have had impacts in literature, TV, Film and Music. They have inspired multiple people and we want to give back to this artform that we love so much.

How do I Know You Will Finish the Book?

This is not our first time putting a comic book together. We have six titles we have done for ourselves and helped many other creators with their projects. We have a solid track record of finishing what we say we will do. We have been told time and time again that we would not be able to make something happen, and it might have taken longer than we wanted, but the books always happened.

Page 1

Page 4

Page 5

Note: If we make goal Eric will actually do the Gallon Challenge.

story:
The Plot

Electric Pulse Divide is a science fiction comic that follows the story of Zed, a rebellious teen who thinks he has life figured out. Having grown up on the new Moon colony as the son of Asher who ensures the Moon's defence, Zed thinks that his only problem in life is to separate himself from the burdensome legacy of his father. 

In the spirit of freedom and good will, Zed sets off to scavenge for scrap material with fledgling mechanics, fund small business owners, and compete in company technology races without permission, all the while thinking of himself as a small time hero.

He doesn’t realize how wrong he is about his father or his freedom, until the Moon’s protective shield breaks. Crashing down with it comes monsters, betrayal, death, and the legacy of a fifty year war fought between Humans and the Eclet alien race.

The Project

You will notice that unlike other funded comics, I am not only funding to print, but also to create the pages in the first place. This is due to the nature of this project involving a writer and artist collaboration in which I provide the story in script format and pay to have it converted into comic pages. 
I have prepared as much as possible, having already written the first eight chapters of the first story arc and started into the second. I have invested in a cover and the first two pages and will continue to invest my time and money to make this a success, but I can't do it all by myself.
The funding goal covers the creation and printing of 25 pages of the first issue.
The overall goal will be to complete the eight chapters/issues of book one. 

The Creators

My name is Denny B. Reese and this is my project.

I am a longtime writer and avid comic fan looking for a way to get my stories into the hands of loving readers. I am also interested in creating new ways to reward and involve my audience which supports me.

My Writing Blog

Accompanying me is the artist Michael Yakutis.

Funding the First Issue

My prizes mainly include access to the series as it is released in many forms. 

I want to release this comic in the way each reader will enjoy the most, be it online as a Web Comic or in full chapter e-books and printed comics. You may believe the costs are high, even for this type of project. That is because I am paying for high quality artwork to bring this story to life.

That being said, there are still goodies including wallpapers and prints.

Shortly after the printed publication, the chapter will be free for anyone to read online to reward all supporters, fund the next installment, and as a testament to the age of free downloads. 

What Will it Look Like

The Wallpapers

Available Art Prints 8.5 x 11"
(you can choose one)
1                                                       2                                                      3


The cover page of the first issue.


The first two pages of the comic.



What becomes of it is now up to supporters like yourself.


What We Need

The costs being covered in this campaign are as follows

  • Paying the artist $2500 (pages, inking, and lettering)
  • Comic Book printing and shipping $900 (6.625" x 10.25" matte coated comics)
  • Indigogo and Paypal processing fees $200
  • Art Print making and printing $200 (8.5" x 11", 80 lb. coated paper)
GOAL: $3,800

If the Goal is Not Reached

Other funding will be pursued and contributors will get access to all digital prizes. However, the completeness may be compromised by my ability or inability to pay for the full costs of this project by myself.
Remember: $2500 will get you the completed chapter in electronic format
This includes:
  • Access to read the pages online (as they are funded)
  • Access to production section of website (guaranteed)
  • A PDF of the comic (if it is completed)
  • Character design input spots (guaranteed)
  • Online advertising spots (guaranteed)
  • Printed advertising spots (on hold until the comics completion)
  • The Wallpaper  (guaranteed)
  • The art print (if the $600 mark is reached; comic pages are top priority)
  • Original first two pages (guaranteed)

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge is gathering funds to support the project. 

The main risk is time of completion. It has been agreed that a page will be completed every two weeks as the written script is translated into pages. This gives the project a time frame of 13 months. We will strive to complete it sooner, but no guarantee can be made.

That being said, you will be with us every step of the way. Updates will be posted on the website and supporters can gain access to read the pages online as they are completed so you can be assured that the comic is progressing as planned. 

View the Website (some pages will be password protected after the campaign)

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Do you think this is a cool project, but don't have the money to spend. That's OK!
    Try sharing this project on social media sites that you use or mention it to your friends. Remember that even those who have not donated will gain access to read this comic after it's publication.

story: Welcome To Inglewood:  The Animated Series!  It's a 60 minute collection of 30 cartoons based on Second City Graduate Eric Lawson's true life story as THE White resident of Inglewood, CA.  Hi!  I'm Carey Westbrook, co-producer of this series.  Jerry Springer told me after appearing with my comic strips for the second time on his hit TV show, Baggage, that I was so funny I deserved my own show.  Well here it is, Jerry!  Here's that honest conversation about race America's president said we the people must have.  I'm raising $500 to buy superior microphones, an editing bay, pay professional actors, and give you the superior 60 minute cult classic you deserve.  The more we raise the bigger more spectacular masterpiece we will create.  I can pull it off because I've made ABC, FOX, and GSN MILLIONS of dollars appearing as myself with my comic strips and doing improvised comedy on their game shows for years!  Now the time has finally come to tell a story about real people and real life in a way that will make you laugh, love, learn, and feel a little better about life!  Whether we raise one million dollars or slightly less than that we will honor your contributions and give you the perk you seek!  We thank you for your support.

story:
What if all the myths, magic, and abstract thought from past to present suddenly became reality? What if everything that one's imagination could hold was suddenly released into our physical world?
 
This idea became the basis for our story: a barely traceable energy that manifests thought: Wisteria. The word itself comes from the wisteria tree, a beautiful tree with violet blossoms, which, in its own way, is rather magical.
 
"Wisteria" tells of the struggle and balance between GOOD and EVIL, not only on a global setting but within one's self. More will be revealed in the future, but with encouraging support from all of you, that future will come sooner than later.

The GRAPHIC NOVEL:

Wisteria (n.): 1. A microscopic particle discovered by scientists in 2012. 2. A magical force which creates superhuman abilities. mutations, and creatures.

Wisteria has existed since before creation; however, it has remained dormant due to the need of a proper reactive agent. Once Earth developed and humans began to roam, the "wist" finally had an opposing charge to react with: human imagination and fantastical cognitive thought. The effects were apparent: ancient reports or glimpses of magical creatures, wizards and witches, and superhuman warriors of old. The progression of time, increased skepticism, and dismissal of old traditions & stories, however, caused the physical effects of wist to slowly fade.

The particle was rediscovered in the early 21st century, mistaken for a possible energy source. ToL scientists attempted to harness it, but an unfortunate labratory experiment supercharged it, causing a global shockwave. This shockwave once again cause thought to manifest into reality, only this time tenfold. Ancient mythological creatures, vampires & werewolves, zombies, angels & demons, super heroes & villians... All supernatural forms of GOOD and EVIL come to life.

The EVENT:

This Thursday, four friends are going to head into their local Denny's at 12:00am and stay there, working on the comic and fending off insanity, until 12:00am the following Friday. This marathon is going to take everything out of us, but we hope it'll be enough to gain attention for our Wisteria Project. For every hour we spend there, we hope you'll be generous enough to donate just one dollar. If by the end of the day, we've earned only earned $24, that's okay: we reached at least one person about this project.

What We Need & What You Get

We're aiming for between $500 & $1000; however, anything helps and we mainly wish to catch your attention and support. We're not entirely sure how to break down perks they're called for those who donate certain amounts, but we'll definitely reward those who donate.

  • Tentative Donation Perks (Donation Rank 3/4/5 include poster & issue #1)
    1. $10 - Signed "Legendary Battle" poster
    2. $25 - Signed "Wisteria" Issue #1
    3. $50 - Cameo appearance an issue of Wisteria
    4. $250 - Reoccuring character designed after your likeness & signed issues character is in
    5. $1000 - Reoccuring hero/villain designed after your likeness  & signed issues character is in

Our main goal, though, is just to create an amazing world the reader can be immersed in. We hope to make magic and fantasy feel as real and exciting as it should be. Readers should recapture the imagination and excitement of childhood, when everything seemed to be possible and nothing was out of reach.

Simply put: we just want to tell a great story.

Other Ways You Can Help

In reality, we're not expecting many donations. What we're really looking for is recognition and to build a following that's excited to read the story and help us push forward. Tell your friends and family about Wisteria and help get folks interested!

- Thank you all!

story:
Hey! Our names are Mitch and Jackie and we RP on Instagram in a group called Marvel Comics Gang (mcg) as the famous Marvel Comics characters Iron Fist and Dazzler.

We Found MCG at a weird time in our lives. We made it a family and honestly love the RPs and people involved. We want to make it to New York Comic Con (NYCC) this year with our MCG Family to put the name out there and to spread the amazing feeling we all get when we're around each other near or far!

We are looking to raise money to not only travel to NYCC from our home town, Indianapolis. But also to Cosplay as our respective characters at NYCC. We would make our own costumes to wear around the Con! Any donations would go twords either making the costumes or the travel expenses of getting to New York and being there for 4 days!

This has been a dream of ours for a while now. Making friends, a bond, a home away from reality, all of it! The love of our followers/friends makes everything worth it! We've had great turn outs woth our contests and give aways in the past with great feed back! The cherry on top? would be to hang out with our family from the IG world in one epic weekend of geekdom!

We have some awesome perks! Ranging from pictures of us at NYCC all the way up to having a drink with us or 60 minutes of free time at NYCC with us!

Thank you for taking time to read about our dream! We know not everyone can donate but help us spread the word! Give us a shout out igg.me/at/dazandfistnycc! Follow us on IG @official_dazzler_mcg and @official_ironfist_mcg! Help us get this out there and make our dream come true!

Thanks!

Mitch aka Iron Fist

Jacqueline aka Dazzler

story:
What's this about then?

The Ghost Pirate Skeletons of Three Craters Lake is a giant-sized comic book adventure starring The Inquiring Minds. When I say giant-sized, I'm talking a whopping 33 full-color story pages!

Who am I?

My name is John Steventon, and I am the creator of two comic strips Knight and Day and The Inquiring Minds, as well as a few other fun projects.  I am also a freelance illustrator whose work appears worldwide in various print media. (see my bio for more). 

What do I need?

As HappyGlyphs Comics, I've self published several books and comics before, but not on this scale. This time I'm aiming to get this new adventure into comic book stores across the country. This would require at least 2000 copies being printed and shipped by me, providing I get enough orders for the distributor to accept the project.  Printing full color comics is very expensive, and I will not be able to do this unless I can get at least $1900 to offset some of the printing costs.

What I would like is for you to get as excited as I am about this book, and to help me make this possible. This is more than just a fundraiser... it's a way for us all to come together and make something happen. At the same time, you get some fun rewards for your contribution, so it's win-win all around. :0)

Why Should You Help Me?

This is a great book, for people of all ages.  Kids will enjoy it, grownups will enjoy it, and they can even enjoy it together.  And you would be helping a small business to grow.  Check out Update #4 for proof that this is an awesome book.

 

What do YOU get?

Besides the warm fuzzies of helping a small but fun business grow, I've come up with what I think are some cool incentives, as well as some of my favorite pieces of original art! Check the list at the side there, as well as my updates for details.

For starters, everyone who pledges four dollars or more will get a pirate postcard with my personal thanks on the back, a HappyGlyphs refrigerator magnet, and a collectible Trading Card featuring art from the book.  These will ship in January at the end of this campaign.

Any pledge of ten dollars or more will get a signed copy of the comic book when it comes out, plus the starters.  The comic book will come out sometime next spring at the latest.

Please read each of the pledge levels, since some of them build on others.
And please, feel free to offer any suggestions. :0)

PLEASE:  If you are outside of the United States, please contact me.  Additional funds need to be pledged for shipping costs.  Thank you!

 And I know that not everyone can contribute at this time, and I appreciate that. If you like the project, please share the link to this campaign with others who like fun family-friendly comics, and follow HappyGlyphs Comics on facebook for lots of fun comics and stuff.

What if we Fall Short of the Goal?

Well, I really hope that doesn't happen!  Honestly, the $1900 goal is the minimum I need to make this project viable. The art is done, and the book is coming together, though, so yes, it will be published.  If national distribution is not viable, then I will have a shorter print run made until we can do it right.

What if I surpass my goal?

My goal here is to raise enough to offset some of the costs of printing the comic book.  I honeslty need double that to come close to the total printing costs.  Beyond that is advertising costs, shipping costs, and lots of other things that will have to come out of my pocket.

Passing our goal here would be awesome, and would assure that you'd get more books like The Ghost Pirate Skeletons of Three Craters Lake, and at a greater frequency.  I would love to put out a couple of comics a year if all goes well, and I have plans for other projects like a short story collection, a series of Inquiring Minds illustrated novels, and even an Inquiring Minds collectible card game.  And there's  the second Knight and Day comic strip collection in the works.

Your contributions will help make this dream a reality.  Beyond financing, your belief in this project will convince others that it is worth supporting.  And for that, I thank you.    JOHN :0)

PS If we were to exceed our goals, I would definitely come up with some extra incentives for y'all. :0)
story_txt:
What's this about then?
The Ghost Pirate Skeletons of Three Craters Lake is a giant-sized comic book adventure starring The Inquiring Minds. When I say giant-sized, I'm talking a whopping 33 full-color story pages!

Who am I?
My name is John Steventon, and I am the creator of two comic strips Knight and Day and The Inquiring Minds, as well as a few other fun projects.  I am also a freelance illustrator whose work appears worldwide in various print media. (see my bio for more). 
What do I need?
As HappyGlyphs Comics, I've self published several books and comics before, but not on this scale. This time I'm aiming to get this new adventure into comic book stores across the country. This would require at least 2000 copies being printed and shipped by me, providing I get enough orders for the distributor to accept the project.  Printing full color comics is very expensive, and I will not be able to do this unless I can get at least $1900 to offset some of the printing costs.
What I would like is for you to get as excited as I am about this book, and to help me make this possible. This is more than just a fundraiser... it's a way for us all to come together and make something happen. At the same time, you get some fun rewards for your contribution, so it's win-win all around. :0)
Why Should You Help Me?
This is a great book, for people of all ages.  Kids will enjoy it, grownups will enjoy it, and they can even enjoy it together.  And you would be helping a small business to grow.  Check out Update #4 for proof that this is an awesome book.
 

What do YOU get?
Besides the warm fuzzies of helping a small but fun business grow, I've come up with what I think are some cool incentives, as well as some of my favorite pieces of original art! Check the list at the side there, as well as my updates for details.
For starters, everyone who pledges four dollars or more will get a pirate postcard with my personal thanks on the back, a HappyGlyphs refrigerator magnet, and a collectible Trading Card featuring art from the book.  These will ship in January at the end of this campaign.
Any pledge of ten dollars or more will get a signed copy of the comic book when it comes out, plus the starters.  The comic book will come out sometime next spring at the latest.
Please read each of the pledge levels, since some of them build on others.And please, feel free to offer any suggestions. :0)
PLEASE:  If you are outside of the United States, please contact me.  Additional funds need to be pledged for shipping costs.  Thank you!
 And I know that not everyone can contribute at this time, and I appreciate that. If you like the project, please share the link to this campaign with others who like fun family-friendly comics, and follow HappyGlyphs Comics on facebook for lots of fun comics and stuff.

What if we Fall Short of the Goal?
Well, I really hope that doesn't happen!  Honestly, the $1900 goal is the minimum I need to make this project viable. The art is done, and the book is coming together, though, so yes, it will be published.  If national distribution is not viable, then I will have a shorter print run made until we can do it right.

What if I surpass my goal?
My goal here is to raise enough to offset some of the costs of printing the comic book.  I honeslty need double that to come close to the total printing costs.  Beyond that is advertising costs, shipping costs, and lots of other things that will have to come out of my pocket.Passing our goal here would be awesome, and would assure that you'd get more books like The Ghost Pirate Skeletons of Three Craters Lake, and at a greater frequency.  I would love to put out a couple of comics a year if all goes well, and I have plans for other projects like a short story collection, a series of Inquiring Minds illustrated novels, and even an Inquiring Minds collectible card game.  And there's  the second Knight and Day comic strip collection in the works.
Your contributions will help make this dream a reality.  Beyond financing, your belief in this project will convince others that it is worth supporting.  And for that, I thank you.    JOHN :0)
PS If we were to exceed our goals, I would definitely come up with some extra incentives for y'all. :0)

story:
Watch the TEASER here:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L9isTq6T8c8

For the past eight years I have been working on a project, that I believe has the potential to reshape the way we see the world, and ultimately play a role in increasing Third World Literacy.

I’ve realised of course, that I can’t do it alone anymore, and now need your help.

I have in my possession, one of the most profound and oldest stories known to man. I would go as far as saying that it is the story from which all other stories told since, find root. What the Book of Genesis is to Christians, this story was to the Ancient Africans. Prior to popular belief, these ancient Africans weren't spear-throwing heathens, but were Philosophers, Astronomers, Mathematicians, Artists and Great Leaders of men. Believe it or not, they were also responsible for seeding the many great civilisations that have existed in pre-history. One need only look at pictures of the enigmatic Olmec heads for evidence of these great African men, whose history has been fervently rewritten.

With this story and with others to follow, it is our aim to redefine African identity and popularize long-since forgotten and suppressed African wisdom to the world.

Our first story comes from the acclaimed African book - Indaba, My Children. ‘Indaba’ simply means – listen. Indaba, My Children was written in 1964, by the great Zulu Sanusi (Shaman) - Credo Vusamazulu Mutwa. ‘Vusamazulu’ is a title he was given at his initiation, meaning ‘Awakener of the People’. Credo Mutwa, is the High Witchdoctor and Knowledge-Keeper of the Zulus, and belongs to an ancient chain of Sanusis. It is a Sanusi’s duty to pass down orally, to their first-born son, the profound knowledge of their ancestors.

But when his son was murdered, and thus, the link in the chain of knowledge had been broken, he was determined not to let this profound ancient wisdom die with him, and so he wrote Indaba, My Children. In so doing, he broke a sacred oath, and betrayed his lineage, becoming an outcast to many of his people. Although he has long since fallen into obscurity,  the book he has left behind, has been hailed as one of the most iconic African works ever written.

When I first read this book eight years ago, something inside me simply ‘clicked’. I felt oddly compelled to firstly, meet this extraordinary man, and secondly, get his permission to bring these ancient stories back to life. Easier said than done… but I did it.

When I began this eight years ago, I could never have predicted how hard it was going to be, and how big it was going to get. I have tried countless times to secure funds from public and private entities, but to no avail. In the end, I have had to borrow money from my family and friends, which for a guy my age, is a tough pill to swallow. I am humbled that they believe in this as much as I do, and I can only hope that you will too.

We are currently half-way through MA, Book One of The Tree Of Life Trilogy. A Graphic Novel Adaptation, of the epic creation myth written in Indaba, My Children. 

I would therefore truly appreciate any funds that you can spare, to help me change the altitude and velocity of this project. These funds will firstly, allow us to focus all our time and energy on the timely completion of the first book - MA, and with enough support, toward the printing and distribution of both high and low quality prints to bookstores, rural African schools and to people like yourself. We would then use all profits to fund us into the second and third installments of the trilogy.

You can find the first chapter of our E-Comic, which we have given away for free, in the hope that if you can't contribute financially, you may be able to assist us by spreading the word of this truly profound and ancient story, to someone who perhaps can.

You can find the e-comic, the blog, and more at www.vusamazulu.com.

“One of the sad realities today is that very few people, especially young people, read books. Unless we find imaginative ways of addressing this reality, future generations are in danger of losing their histories.” Nelson Mandela.

Kind regards,

Mark McKeown.

Teaser filmed by Mathew Poolman @ http://www.mathewpoolman.com.
Track - 'Sleep Ali' by Markus Wormstorm @ www.markuswormstorm.tv. For free full album download - http://www.mediafire.com/?cpo5xiiyf48vlz5.

To view the works of Hubert Barichievy (see incentives 11 & 12) - http://hubertbarichievy.com/people-prosthetics-...

story:
Akkor csak röviden!

Sziasztok! A nevem Molnár Attila, én vagyok "A halál temploma" című képregény írója.

A halál temploma egy új, izgalmas kaland történet két magyar régészről, akik akaratuk ellenére belecsöppennek egy évszázadok óta tartó rejtélyes kincs felkutatásába.

A képregényt 56 oldalas, színes, minőségi, B5 méretben szeretnénk kiadni, és már csak a nyomtatás választ el minket a megjelenéstől.

Ehhez kérnénk a segítségedet!

A cél

Ezzel a kampánnyal azt szeretnénk elérni, hogy a képregényünket országos terjesztésben kiadhassuk. 

Az $1000-os célösszeg, ami nagyjából 280 ezer forint, fedezné egy 100-200 példányszámú megjelentetés költségét. Minden egyes felajánlás ennek a célnak a megvalósítására fordítjuk.


Látványterv a képregényhez

Abban az esetben, ha nem érnénk el a kitűzött összeget, kisebb példányszámban akkor is szeretnénk megjelenni a képregénnyel, mely csupán rendezvényeken lesz elérhető.

Ezért is választottuk a rugalmas kampányt. Ez ugyan azt jelenti, hogy minden felajánlást megkapunk, akkor is ha a kitűzött célt nem érjük el, de hogy ez ne tántorítson el senkit, minden felajánlónak biztosítunk egy kedvezményes példányt.

Zárásul

Bízunk képregényünk sikerében, mert úgy véljük helye van a magyar képregények sorai között egy ilyen képregénynek. Az alkotó gárda két tagja (Halmi Zsolt és Puskás Szabolcs) régóta jelen van a magyar képregényes életben.

Oldalt találhatjátok a felajánlási csomagokat. Minden csomag része egy előjegyzés a képregény 1 példányára, de emellett egyebekkel is kiegészül. Minden felajánlásért nagyon hálásak vagyunk, és köszönünk mindennemű segítséget, mellyel támogattok minket és a képregényünk!

Hogy segíthetsz még?

Kérünk téged, hogy terjeszd hírünk és kampányunk ahol csak tudod.

Köszönjünk még egyszer a segítséged!

Facebook címünk: https://www.facebook.com/ahalaltemploma 

-----------------------------

English summary

Hello! This is a campain to our new adventure comic book "The Pyramid of Death".

Although we primary aim for Hungarian publishing in this campain, we're planning to publish an english version in a later time depending mostly on its success. 

The comic is about 2 archeologist (brothers) who got involved in a centuaries long search of a mystic treasure. It will be a full colour 56 pages long in B5 format. At least this is our goal.

The comic is in finished state and only waits for printing. We would like to rise funds to cover the cost of a 100-200 copies and country-wide publish. We choose flexible funding (which means we receive the money even if we did not reach the goal), but for encouragement we ensure a copy for every donate (check perks).

We appreciate every donation.

If you have questions feel free to contact us here, or on our Facebook page!

Thank you!

story:
Jack Irons T-shirts and other Goodies : https://teespring.com/stores/the-steel-cowboy-m...

RUNNING INDEMAND TILL Issue #1 is ready to ship!!!

Read Issue #1 Here for free uncolored : https://tapas.io/episode/994758 

Now both Issues will be delivered in fabulous full color!!!

All perks $25 and over now include a printed copy of issue #1, as well as a printed copy of issue #2 after its completion :) Thanks Wikid Publishing!!!

FINAL STRETCH GOAL! : From now on every $250 dollars goes towards hiring indie artists to collaborate on pin up inserts for issue #2 :) 5th pinup already unlocked! Stopping at five for budgetary concerns :)

 

 

 

  

 "Jack Irons: The Steel Cowboy" is a science fiction western set across history with a main character who is over 200 years old and has well over 2000 years of past life memories. Cursed in a past life with the burden of immortality in his next, Jack struggles to find the peace that will forever be denied him.
    The year is 2076. In a savage wasteland populated by zombies, mutants, post apocalyptic raiders, aliens, and the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse, can Jack save what remains of humanity and find a way to end his life? Or will he come to terms with his unique and amazing existence and become the beacon of hope a dying species needs?
          

That's the pitch line. Hoped you liked it! Now on to the meat of the situation.

I have scripts for issues 2-8. I have a spin-off character issue written. I have a wonderful artist (Maximilliano D'allo). What I do not have, is funding to pay these wonderful individuals.  You can see our first issue here, (one brought together from much generosity and effort on their behalf btw)

https://tapas.io/episode/994758 

I am very proud of their work, but one issue barely scratches the surface of the story we have to tell. A story of loss and redemption spanning many cultures and many times, seen through the eyes of someone who has watched the world burn time and time again. A man who throughout the infinite heartache of his life and his memories, still manages to find the good within himself and act upon it.  Jack may be a cowboy, but in 2076, not much else can oppose the Four Horsemen and bring humanity back from the brink of extinction.

Will you help us continue Jack's tale? Will you help bring together a world with so many possibilities for the future?

It all started a few years years ago, with a comic nerd and a dream, and then continued over a year ago with a Craigslist ad and a eventual meeting at a McDonalds. It continues today with the hope that many will connect to the world and characters as many others have come to know and love already!

Now unto the risky business,

I made sure this was not a flexible campaign, because even at a little over half the goal, we can start on the art, but I can not, in good faith, take money that may not lead to a final product within a reasonable time. Even if I can promise all funds would be saved for issue #2 and that art would be produced, if we were to fail to meet even half the goal, the money that was left really couldn't lead to anything substantial, and that would be unfair to everyone kind enough to support this en-devour.

Long story short, it ain't cheap making a comic, so if you like our work, please consider helping us make issue #2!

Thanks so very much for your time,

The Jack Irons Team

Cody Fernandez /Words/Creator

Maximilano D'allo /Pencils/Inks/Designer

Vincent Rush /Letterer/Editor

Matias Laborde/ Colorist

 

All perks $25 and over now include a printed copy of issue #1, as well as a printed copy of issue #2 after its completion :) Thanks Wikid Publishing!!!

 

We now have a STRETCH GOAL!!! If we can raise at least $1200 over our initial goal I can alter all perks to include full color issue#1 by Matias Laborde! This becomes printed if you pledged over $25 >>>> GRAND TOTAL $3700 *NOW UNLOCKED*

If we can get $3000 over I can offer both issues in full color! (issue #2 is 8 pages longer than #1) Come on people. Look at that brilliant work! >>>>>>>>>>GRAND TOTAL $5500 *COMPLETED AND UNLOCKED*

FINAL STRETCH GOAL! : From now on every $250 dollars goes towards hiring indie artists to collaborate on pin up inserts for issue #2 (5 pin-ups REACHED> GOAL DONE FOR BUDGET PURPOSES :)

story:
Fanzaghirò nasce per gioco, un'idea leggera che ha entusiasmato più di ogni previsione. Abbiamo voluto giocare fino in fondo, ed eccoci qua. Quaranta disegnatori italiani dal mondo del fumetto e dell'illustrazione, professionisti ed esordienti, uniti per celebrare un cult della nostra gioventù.

Alessandro Baronciani ※ Alessandro Coppola ※ Alexiel April
Alice Girlanda ※ Claudia Nuke Razzoli ※ Cristina Portolano
Eleonora Antonioni ※ Fabio Mancini + Marco B Bucci
Flavia Biondi + Anna Ferrari ※ Francesco Zito ※ Freddie Tanto
Giopota ※ Giorga Marras ※ Giulia Sagramola ※ Greta Xella
Guido Fiato ※ Jacopo Camagni ※ Laura La Came ※ Lois
Lorenza De Luca ※ Loris De Marco ※ Luisa Torchio
Maicol&Mirco ※ Marco Albiero ※ Maurizia Rubino
Michele Soma ※ Noemi Gambini ※ Nova ※ Pablo Cammello
Raffaele Sorrentino ※ Rita Petruccioli ※ Salvatore Callerami
Salvatore Giommarresi ※ SantaMatita ※ Silvia Rocchi
Simone D'Armini ※ Spugna ※ Valentina Brancati ※ Vittoria Macioci

Il volume sarà di 52 pagine completamente a colori, in brossura con alette. In ogni copia sarà inserito un poster formato A3 a opera di Alessandro Baronciani.

Poiché crediamo moltissimo in questo progetto abbiamo impostato un flexible funding, per cui qualunque sia la cifra raggiunta vi investiremo comunque i fondi ottenuti. Con il vostro aiuto, siamo certi di poter raggiungere cifre che ci permetteranno di stampare più copie e materiale extra per la gioia di tutti noi nostalgici. Ecco dei piccoli assaggi dei gadget disponibili in un unico perk:

Con il perk "L'opera" potete acquistare, oltre alla vostra copia del libro, anche una stampa a scelta tra le illustrazioni di Greta Xella e Jacopo Camagni.

I perk più cari e più limitati, infine, sono per gli ammiratori irriducibili. Giopota e Greta Xella mettono a disposizione il loro talento per soddisfare ogni richiesta di chi vorrà accaparrarsi i perk "La rarità" e "Il tesoro".

Il numero di volumi stampati sarà in rapporto ai fondi accumulati. Prevediamo comunque un minimo di 200 copie, che potremmo noi spedirvi o potreste voi ritirare al Treviso Comic Book Festival in settembre, dove presenteremo il progetto con un evento dedicato, o ai successivi eventi Renape a Bologna.

Affinché il gioco non fosse fine a se stesso ci siamo detti che avremmo devoluto tutti i ricavati ad un'associazione benefica. Abbiamo conosciuto le ragazze de La casa delle donne di Bologna, una realtà concreta che tutela le donne dalle violenze su tutto il territorio. Il loro eccezionale lavoro ci ha ispirati a realizzare un progetto che esaltasse l'ideale femminista e abbattesse gli stereotipi di genere.

http://www.casadonne.it/wordpress/

Fanzaghirò è un progetto ideato e curato da Giopota, logisticamente gestito da Thomas Govoni dell'associazione culturale Renape e supportato con entusiasmo dal Treviso Comic Book Festival.

Our Story

Hey my name is Jesse Crandall I am the writer of green salamander a comic. what is green salamander it is a comic book/manga the story involves magic, love, comedy, and mystery the name is Green salamander the main character is named (Jesse Crandall) and he is a lazy pickpocket, magician who hates work. Jesse's love interest is (Kai Hill) she is very motivated and can be manipulative but is also kind. The story revolves around them them trying to seal the three keys to heaven before a demon (Kisou) gets them and links the spirit realm with the human realm.The Impact

If we reach $600.00 I can produce the cover for the comic!!!! If we reach $2,000 for the comic I can finish the art for it. If we reach 5,000 I can finish the art and publish the book. If I reach the 20,000 were talking about lodes of advertising so it dose well and possibly a movie later on.


What We Need & What You Get

So the real goal for this is 5,000 dollars that is the minimum I need to make this work so please help me make my dream your reality.  


Other Ways You Can Help

advertise for me, donate, blog, fan art, propaganda any of that helps and be creative also that helps thank you so much I hope you donated and LOVE ON.

story:
BEFORE YOU READ BELOW:

On July 19, 14 people lost their lives for the love of comics. In honor of them, 14% of this IndieGoGo campaign will be donated to the victims of the Aurora, CO shooting at The Dark Knight Rises midnight release.

________________________________________________________________________

 

Welcome to the World of Valendor, a bold new world where steam-powered ships sail across the sky and where you’ll find that the standard heroes come in any shape or form—even Pirate!

In the Sky Pirates of Valendor comic book series written by Everett Soares and illustrated by Brian Brinlee, the leading airship has been the Rogue's Revenge. Its crew consists of Captain Tobin Manheim, Bryan Springhammer, Gearz and Shyni. Currently we are one issue away from completing our 2nd volume of books. In February 2013, we will release the collected trade paperback at TempleCon in Providence RI, featuring a painted cover by Marvel veteran artist Mark Sparacio. This debut is signifiicant as it represents our first major release as self publishers. We are very proud of our accomplishments!
 
We are conducting this IndieGoGo campaign to accomplish 3 goals:
1.  To start pre-sales for Volume 2 trade.
2.  To raise funds to support the release of Volume 2 (i.e. assembly, promotion, printing, distribution).
3.  To involve our readers in developing the Volume Three storyline.
 
The theme and storyline for Volume 3 of Sky Pirates of Valendor is Pirate Wars.
 
What is Pirate Wars, you ask?
 
Off the coast of Gray Holt, a hurricane is brewing. In the eye of this hurricane is a stranded Khorii airship called The Hand of Might. You may be asking yourselves why this ship is so important. Well, the scuttlebutt is that it’s the Temple Khorii’s newest warship. That is Khorii’s newest tax ship. It holds the combined taxes and tribute for Terus Major and Terus Minor, and before you ask that is a lot of gold to be had. So much gold you could use it to take control of the Pirate Guild.

The downside of the scuttlebutt is that it makes its way into a lot of ears, the wrong ears. Those ears belong to some of the villainous, deranged and darkest pirates Valendor has ever known. However one set of these ears belongs to the only pirate motivated by revenge as opposed to greed. That is Tobin Manheim of the Rogue’s Revenge.

There are many obstacles that Tobin Mannheim must face to achieve his goal. The storm is only the beginning; soon he finds himself in the depths of full out Pirate Wars!

Our goal is to have the fleet of ships competing in the wars to be named and manned by you, our readers. Based on your level of contribution, you can name a ship all the way up to starring in your own issue!
 
The campaign will run for 90 days and contributors will be contacted in the fall of 2012 for their respective contributions.
 
Pre-sales of Volume 2 trade paperbacks will be fulfilled in January 2013, prior to the official release.

story:
Greetings my name is Martin Brandt and I am here on behalf of Grim Crew. The Grim Crew is a small collection of indie writers and artists looking to promote the their work and the work of the indie community. It has been their goal since inception to help grow and bring together their indie brethren and sisters to show the comic world there is more out there. For the past 3 years Grim Crew has been publishing Graphic Novels and Comics series. One of the more popular series, Dead Future, is now becoming a collected volume for release this fall. 


Dead Future is a anthology set in a post apocalyptic world over run by the undead. Each story was contributed by teams of artists and writers from local communities and around the globe. All contributors are indie creators looking to promote to work and the work of their peers. As Dead Future's first set of stories comes to a close we look to the future of, Dead Future. For that we envision continuing the popular series, once again calling on our indie peers to contribute and help promote. For all this to happen and continue to grow we're going to need to increase not only our efforts but our operating capital as well.


If successful we'll be able to continue to publish the Dead Future series and promote the work of our creators and peers. It has been Grim Crews primary goal to promote the work of the indie community and my own personal efforts to continue that. This will enable us to keep doing it and continue to grow it and make it better for all involved. Of course if we don't succeed it means that the future of Dead Future will become uncertain but it doesn't mean we'll give up the good fight.


Our goal for this campaign is to raise $4,500 USD. All money will go into the printing, advertising and web hosting costs associated with the Dead Future. It will also contribute to further marketing and support for the indie comic community. Of course this is just enough to keep things going and we will use other methods to bring in more money to keep the efforts going. Things such as advertising, book sales, and our own pockets.


For helping us out we've devised a set of nice perks you can browse to the right. There you will find all manner of inspired methods of thanks to show you just how much we appreciate your help in keeping this thing going. Additionally you'll see mention of the ZDR (Zed Dead Right) this is a club of "theoretical" zombie hunters that Dead Future is in the infancy of bringing to life. As a perk we are offering membership into this unit before it is open to the public.


We'd also like to ask you to spread the word. You can use the sharing tools above or word of mouth us to your friends, classmates or local comic shops. Let's get the word out that even though the future may be dead, it doesn't mean we can't survive it together.


Thank you for your time and support.

story:
Help Get It Printed!

Don't Let This Happen To You is a uniquely drawn comic strip by cartoonist Elana Pritchard.  It has been featured on the web and in the The L.A. Record.  Your help is needed to bring the 24 page full color comic book to life.



A Breakdown:

  • Your donation will go towards the cost of printing, as well as compensating the artist for the over 250 hours spent drawing and putting the book together.
  • Along with the comic book, every donation over $25 will receive an original doodle.
  • Don't worry if we fall short, the money raised will still go towards printing the comic book.  (But let's not do that.)


"Why are they beating the sh*t out of each other?"

-My Mom.

It's funny?  Don't Let This Happen To You has a wide array of influences, from Segar's Popeye, to Spy Vs. Spy, to Fleischer Studios.  In many ways, Don't Let This Happen To You is a throwback to the times where comics had a broad range of expressions, poses, and emotions.  


Want To Help More?

You can help out more than you realize by sharing this campaign with your friends, or posting it up on your blog, Facebook, or Twitter feed.  Broke?  That's ok.  You are still welcome to enjoy the comic online at elanapritchard.com.

Thanks!
Elana


*Update!

New reward options have been added.  Now all pledges at the $10 level will receive an original doodle card sent to them in the mail.

There is also a limited edition special at the $25 level of a custom doodle.  This is a chance to interact one on one with the artist by giving her an idea to draw.  Don't miss it!

* Another Update!

There is now a caricature reward at the $40 level.

story:
What's This All About?

Drea Boyd is a nice girl, living in a nice suburb -- and feeling pretty much disconnected from everything.She finds solace in books and escapes into a fantasy world she creates. There, she's Boy -- a tough, smart cowgirl living in 1910 Alberta.

You can follow the stories in the first edition of "A Cowgirl Named Boy", a creative collaboration between writers Trent Wilkie and Natasha Deen, and illustrator Dan Schneider.

Just to make it more interesting, this is the first time -- in recorded history -- that a comic book has been set in Strathcona County, a place that's celebrating its 120th anniversary this year. We've even giving the founding father -- Lord Strathcona -- a cameo.

You're supporting the work of independent Alberta artists -- and we're prepared to make it worth your while.

What Are We Doing With Your Money?

Your dollars will go to the costs of illustration and printing for this limited-edition project. There will only be 250 copies of "A Cowgirl Named Boy" printed, and we plan to release the comic on a high-grade parchment-style paper with a full-color cover. 

What Do You Get?

There's some great perks, but we think the best one by far is the opportunity to be drawn into the story. There's only 30 of those up for grabs.

If your pockets aren't that deep, $5 will still get your name in the comic as a sponsor, and we'll send you a digital copy the same day the paper version is released to the world. 

$10 will get you a printed copy of the comic that's been signed to YOU by the creators of "A Cowgirl Named Boy".

Add another $15 to that ten-spot and you'll score the comic book PLUS two tickets to the invitation-only launch party on November 9!

If, on the other hand, you do have deeper pockets, $500 will get your business drawn into the story. (Plus, your accountant will give you an award for this year's most original tax write-off.) There's only 2 of these available.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends! Tell them to tell their friends! Spread the news far and wide on social media (a luxury they didn't have back in the wild west). It all makes a difference and we truly appreciate the support.

If, on the other hand, you do have deeper pockets, $500 will get your business drawn into the story. (Plus, your accountant will give you an award for this year's most original tax write-off.) There's only 2 of these available.
Other Ways You Can Help
Tell your friends! Tell them to tell their friends! Spread the news far and wide on social media (a luxury they didn't have back in the wild west). It all makes a difference and we truly appreciate the support.

story:
What is "The Good Man"?

The Good Man is a graphic novel in Three parts. It follows the life of Aldo D'Agnelli, an principal ballerino growing up during the rise of Fascism in Italy. His good fortune and affluence allows him to lead a comfortable life during a time of terror, until a terrible event changes his life forever.

The Good Man seeks to answer the question: When we lose what we love, what can we live for? 

This campaign seeks to print the first Part of the series, which follows Aldo's childhood to  adolescence in Italy and his budding career as a ballerino. However, Aldo's ever-increasing ego taints his relationships; and although he is still able to get ahead, his success will come with a price. 

This story is my Senior Project as I finish my BFA in Illustration from Montclair State University. I hope to continue it after I graduate and send it out to bigger publishers. I will be printing the first part of my series in a graphic novel. Because this isn't the full story, I also will be printing concept art and character designs in the back. (Ya know, so everyone can get a feel of the world I'm trying to create.) 

This story is close to my heart and I want to produce a beautiful sample of what it can be. Your contributions will help bring an idea from my freshman year into an epic tale about life, love and the people we encounter along the way. 

What will be produced:

(Multiple copies of) A paperback graphic novel that will feature the first part of the story with a back section of concept art and character designs. 

The Funding Breakdown:

This campaign has been set up to help me send my comic to be printed and shipped before my BFA show. $750 will cover the costs of creating and shipping multiple, color-covered copies. I encourage all who are interested to pay $15 to not only receive a book, but to help me achieve more for my story's future publication.

Funding Beyond $750 means:

  • More copies can be made! YES!
  • I can pay to have it shipped to publishers
  • Continuing the series can be done quicker and easier
  • Prints!

PERKS: 

Here are the perks! If you give___ you get:

  • $5- A postcard of the concept art
  • $15- THE BOOK ITSELF! 
  • $20- The Book...signed :D 
  • $30- The  signed Book and a lovely print of the concept art.
  • $50- Book, print and a T-shirt! 
  • $100+- Everything in the previous reward tiers and I will name a character after you in the later editions
  • $1000 (Wishful thinking)- I will make a personalized comic for you and probably clean your house

For more news and information on this project, please visit The Good Man Tumblr

A Thousand thanks from the bottom of my heart for your support.

-V

story:
THE STORY

At age 8, Cliffy Goldfarb was the recipient of an emergency heart
transplant. At age 9, Cliffy is now struggling to cope with the
limitations his still recovering body is undergoing, and the fact that
because of this, he has trouble relating to his peers. When his mom
suggests spending his summer at Camp Bravehearts, a place for kids
living with heart defects like his own, he has some trepidations about
going this camp for “special” kids, but soon learns his worries were
all over nothing when he meets a young girl named Rosie who introduces
him to a group of new friends who encourage him by showing off their
surgical scars to one another and inducting Cliffy into “The Zipper
Club”.


THE HISTORY OF THE ZIPPER CLUB

Len himself is a life-long survivor of a congenital heart defect.
Growing up with his unique condition and the work he did over a 14
year old period counseling at the real Camp Bravehearts inspired him
to write The Zipper Club not just for children who grew up like he
did, but even for kids who have  survived pretty much any sort of
illness or adversity. In the five year run that we hope to take the
book on, we hope to tackle issues ranging from dealing with divorce,
young love, coping with loss of a friend or family member, survivor's
guilt, all the way up to navigating the locust swarm known as puberty.
As we grow up, we all gain our share of scars, be they physical and
otherwise, and Cliffy, Rosie and the gang are here to be the voice
that says the things we survive are what ultimately show us what we're
really made of. Brought to life by Brenda's artwork that gives the
children their own unique senses of personality while bringing a sense
of fun, quirk, and youth to a tale of friendship and survival unlike
any ever told before.

The original Zipper Club short stories were first published in a six
issue run of Grayhaven Comics' ongoing anthology series, The
Gathering. All 27 pages of the short stories will be reprinted in this
collection, with an added 13 pages of new material interspersed
throughout to make it one full,
seamless, fun read for children and adults alike.



WHERE YOU COME IN...

By contributing to The Zipper Club, you will not only be supporting an
independently produced project, you will also be helping a greater
good.

From our reasonably attainable goal, the money from this IndieGoGo
campaign will go towards funding a first print run for our first
Zipper Club annual, paying Brenda and myself a little for our work, as
well as helping to make a few extra copies to be donated to pediatric
cardiac care centers around the country, so the book can make its way
into the hands of kids who could really need it.  Additionally, a
portion of any profits from the book will be donated to the American
Heart Association as our personal way of giving back to the
organization that's helped to save my life on top of thousands of
others over the years.

Furthermore, if we make a certain amount of money over our goal, we
have a list of stretch goals in mind for the book, chief among them,
upgrading the entire book from black and white to full color!

If you don't have the money to contribute, that's okay! You can still
help us out by spreading our link around through Facebook, Twitter,
Tumblr, and any other social networks you may be on. If we don't hit
our goal, all contributions go right back into the pockets of our
donors. No fuss, no muss.

THE CREATORS

Len N. Wallace is a professional freelance writer who has worked in
the comic industry for going on ten years. His first graphic novel,
Love Buzz with artists Michelle Silva and Dave Tuney was published
through Oni Press in 2010. He's also worked on the Kung-Fu Panda for
Ape Entertainment/Dreamworks SKG, as well as work for Image Comics,
Grayhaven Comics, and Ronin Studios.



Brenda Liz Lopez is a professional freelance illustrator who, in
addition to her work on The Zipper Club, has illustrated the comic
Asinine with C.J. Johnson, as well as illustration works for Shut Up!
Magazine and Ugly Things!


The two first collaborated on a five page short story called The
Valentine's Day Massacre that told a tale of a third grade class of
boys versus girls in a war of cooties. The duo had so much fun with
the project that they later dreamed up the idea for what has become
The Zipper Club.

(INTERNATIONAL DONORS, PLEASE ADD AN EXTRA $10 TO YOUR DONATION TO BE USED FOR SHIPPING)

story:
FAIRWEATHERONLINE.COM 

Graphic Novel Project

Story|Characters

It's Fairweather! Bringing you the zompocalypse with rainbowtastic madness and candy coated carnage from across color spectrum every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday!

Fairweather - the story

Alright Kids, let me break it down for you:

There is an inter-dimensional tentacle monster called the Great Leviathan. Levi eats zombies and contaminates parallel dimensions with micro-organisms that in life bind the subject’s mind to it’s will and in death, results in zombification.
Given half a chance, Levi will collapse the dimensional divide and an destroy our world.  Usually, it uses a person that exists in both worlds, creating a constant. It infests that person, possessing them in one dimension and then throwing itself forward metaphysically into the uncontaminated host, but this is a messy and unreliable mode of transmigration. So when the Leviathan meets unlikely inter-dimensional traveler Paige Heron, an unfortunate graduate student of Dr. Weyland, it decides to conquer our world with seduction and technology instead. This releases hordes of inter-dimensional zombies on our unsuspecting world, specifically Kansas City.
Our story follows the Raintree siblings: Mark, Amber, and Susie as their lives tangle with Dr. Weyland and his unfortunate graduate students (Stark, Paige, and Alex), while they unwittingly open a gateway for the Leviathan.
Our Players:

Dr. Bruce Weyland - Heads THE CENTER, a black ops think tank located underneathe Subtropolis, Kansas City, sleeps with and/or waterboards graduate students. Don't piss him off or you'll find yourself with a sack over head and on your way to Gitmo.

Stark Lee, unfortuante graduate student #1 - An alcoholic firebug, made the original discovery of inter-dimensional travel, shortly before trapping himself across the divide. Believe it or not, this was not rock bottom for him.

Paige Heron, unfortunate graduate student #2 - Dr. Weyland’s former lover, who forgoes clothing after being possessed by the Leviathan. She spends most of her time at war with the alien presence living in her head.

Alex, unfortunate graduate student #3 - Alex, the great white nerd, falls madly in love with Amber Raintree after meeting her in community service. He heard it was a good place to meet nice girls, she was serving a sentence for vandalism. Ain't love grand!

Jennings, Dr. Weyland’s henchman and right hand man, Carrys out waterboardings, interrogations, beatings, putting people on planes with bags over their heads, ya know, the usual. Also involved in a nurturing relationship with  Amber’s  ex-boyfriend, Pete.

Mama Raintree - Dies in an amusement park water feature after a blotched attempt to cross the divide by the Leviathan, leaving daughter Susie as the next constant between worlds. That's some inheritance, eh kids?

Mark Raintree - Joins the Army and is sent to Iraq following his mother’s death, which leaves him hollow and incapable of emotion for his sisters, brutal.

Amber Raintree - Former model/actress turned waitress to support her unusual sister, Susie. She has a rage problem, a pistol in her purse, and tire iron in the glove box. It's the perfect recipe for comedy.

Susie Raintree, a constant between dimensions - Torn between a world where she houses the consciousness of the Leviathan and our own world, where she is the target of bullies, living the life of a teenage social outcast.

Pete, the cop - Formerly Amber’s boyfriend until he came out at Mama Raintree’s funeral. Best friend to Mark and a dead shot. Currently dating Jennings, and completely in the dark about what he does for a living.

Currently I am fundraising to offset the cost of travel to Zombcon, or as I like to call it, "The Happiest Place on Earth". It is my hope to connect with others living the zombielife. With your generous donation of $5, you will receive a signed limited edition chapter 1 CENTERFOLD.


Other Ways You Can Help

Drop by, see the site, tell your zombie friends! We post every M-W-F and would love to have you by the site

www.fairweatheronline.com

story:
Short Summary

Creepy scarlett is a new and exciting independent project that will start out with a 6 issue run of the comic book. Featuring awesome new characters such as Scarlett, Pumpkinface, Vincent Priest, Trixie Treat, and not forgetting Scarletts companion Mr. Ted!

As the creator/writer of Creepy Scarlett my goal is to create a franchise that is to include an animated series, movies and merchandise. Being able to keep the project independant means it will remain fan friendly and ensure that as the creator I am able to create a fresh and exciting franchise.

Synopsis

In a storyline that weaves from centuries ago to modern times, Creepy Scarlett follows the tale of a simple girl and her teddy bear as she batttles the evil Vincent Priest and the Red Sun Corporation in a quest for the ultimate power. Along the way Scarlett faces pumpkin faced serial killers, zombies, an evil funfair troupe and more... set against the backdrop of the cemetery that is home to Scarlett and the nearby town that she has a personal vendetta against, the series is a fast paced adventure that twists and turns it's way through each chapter unlocking the true mystery and power that make a simple girl named Scarlett the only one who can stop the Red Sun Corporation controlling the fate of humanity! 

What We Need & What You Get

All of the funding goes to hiring the best team possible to create the best possible product. picking a team that shares the same passion and goals for the character is of great importance to me. Artists, colorists, letterers, printing costs are the main sources that need funded.

Perks include special edition comic books, merchandise and more

ALL raised funds go to creating the best possible product.

Other Ways You Can Help

you can also help out by spreading the word of the Creepy Scarlett comic book series. Visiting and liking/sharing the facebook page for lots of previews and updates and exclusive artworks of Scarlett and co. 

http://facebook.com/creepyscarlett
